With the loan of S/.3,000.00 ($1,100.00) to be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase cement, paint for the finish and housecleaning products to improve the infrastructure of the rooms for rent. Doña María Edith is 44 years old, has 2 children and lives with her husband and one of the children. Her family supports her by taking care of the cleaning of the rooms.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora María Edith Navarro P. pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas” vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia de San Martín, Distrito de Tarapoto, su domicilio está ubicado en el Jr. Sinchi Roca Nº 430 donde también presta servicios de alquiler de cuartos, negocio al que se dedica paralelo a prestar servicios como profesora en un centro educativo de la ciudad. La oportunidad de un préstamo en Manuela Ramos le permite seguir mejorando la infraestructura de los cuartos que alquila para prestar un mejor servicio. En este negocio la apoya toda su familia.

Con el crédito de S/. 3,000.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará cemento, pintura para los acabados y otros materiales de limpieza para mejorar la infraestructura de los cuartos que alquila. La señora Maria Edith tiene 44 años, tiene 2 hijos y vive con su esposo y uno de ellos, tiene el apoyo de su familia en el desarrollo de su negocio en cuanto a la limpieza de los cuartos.

loans.use: Purchase cement, paint and other products  for maintenance of rooms for rent.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Nimia

texts.es:
Mrs. Nimia P. A. is a member of the “Banco Comunal, Nuestra Sra. de la Paz”, she lives in the Region of San Martín, Province of San Martín, District of Tarapoto, her address is Jr. Ulises Reátegui No. 235, where her business of groceries – general store also is located. The loans from “Banco Comunal” have allowed her to implement her business and keep growing. Her husband and son support her and they have plans to pack coffee beans for the next season.

With the loan of S/.800.00 to be repaid in 6 months, she will buy sacks of rice, sugar, toilet paper, soft drinks, and other products to supply her store. Doña Nimia is 56 years old, lives with her husband and she has 2 children, one of them lives with his parents and her husband and son help her organize the tasks at home and at the business which allows her time for her personal affairs.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Nimia P. A. pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Sra. de la Paz” vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia de San Martín, Distrito de Tarapoto, su domicilio está ubicado en el Jr. Ulises Reátegui Nº 235, donde también se ubica su negocio de venta de abarrotes – bodega. Los préstamos del Banco Comunal le han permitido implementar su negocio y seguir creciendo, es apoyada por su esposo e hijo y tiene previsto asimismo en el próximo ciclo envasar café de cereales.

Con el crédito de S/. 800.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará sacos de arroz, azúcar, papel higiénico, gaseosas y otros productos para surtir. La señora Nimia tiene 56 años, vive con su esposo y tiene 2 hijos, sólo vive con uno de ellos, su esposo e hijo le ayudan a organizar las tareas del hogar y del negocio por lo que ella tiene tiempo también para hacer sus cosas personales fuera de casa.

loans.use: Purchase products to supply general store and increase sales.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Dora Lisbet

texts.en:
Dora Lisbet Fevres M. owns a general store that she runs with her daughter in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali.  She started the store 10 years ago with the help of her husband who has recently passed away.  

Dora is 50 years old, healthy, happy to have her store and work with her daughter. She loves socializing with her clients and building relationships. Dora will continue to invest in her business and make her clients happy.

A member of the community bank Mujeres Empresarias, Dora is requesting a loan of s/1500 to repay over 6 months.  She would like to use the extra capital to buy sugar, rice, sodas and everything else that she sells at her store.

loans.use: She would like to use the extra capital to buy sugar, rice, sodas and everything else that she sells at her store.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Mr. Angel Ramon A. is from the city of Santaní. He is 36 years old and married to Mrs. Marlene Vergara, who is 30 years old. They have their own home and 1 school age son.

Angel is the owner of a bread bakery called "Panadería Marle" , a business he started 4 years ago. He currently has 6 employees. He has built a clientele thanks to the quality of his products. Angel tells us that the business is quite profitable and generates good earnings. Every day he begins his work in the very early hours of the morning in order to be able to have fresh bread prepared first thing in the morning.

He sells his products to business in the area as well as to neighboring cities. The distribution of his products extends to cities as far as 40 minutes from his own.

Angel is applying for a loan that he wishes to invest in the purchase of ingredients in large quantities, since buying wholesale he will obtain better discounts from his vendors.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

El Señor Ángel Ramón A., es de la ciudad de Santaní, compañía Tacuara, tiene 36 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Marlene Vergara, de 30 años de edad, tienen casa propia y 1 hijo, en edad escolar.

Ángel es propietario de una Panadería llamada “PANADERIA MARLE” y que lleva ya 4 años de funcionamiento. Actualmente tiene 6 empleados, y posee una clientela formada gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos. Ángel nos cuenta que el negocio es bastante rentable y le genera buenos ingresos, todos los días empieza su labor a muy tempranas horas de la madrugada para poder tener el pan fresco a primeras horas de la mañana.

El provee sus productos a comercios de la zona y además a ciudades aledañas, el reparte sus productos, inclusive llega a ciudades que quedan a 40 minutos de su ciudad.

Ángel solicita un crédito que desea invertirlo en su negocio para la compra de ingredientes en grandes cantidades, ya que comprando de este modo el obtiene mejores descuentos de sus proveedores.

loans.use: Purchase flour in large bundles, plus sugar, salt, anise, eggs and milk, among other ingredients.

loans.name: Giovanni

texts.en:
Giovanni G. G. sells beer and sodas in the city of Pucallpa. She started her business two years ago and now has many loyal customers. Giovanni enjoys building relationships with her customers and making friends.

Giovanni is 31 years old and a single mother. Her husband left her a few years ago, and she was forced to find a way to take care of her son. She loves her business and saves carefully so she always has money to reinvest. Educating her child is the most important priority in her life.

A member of the community bank Mujeres Empresarias, Giovanni is requesting a loan of $375 to repay over 6 months. She would use the loan to increase her stock of beer and soda.

loans.use: To increase her stock of beer and soda

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Cayetano

texts.es:
Cayetano R. Díaz is from the Ycua Pai neighborhood of the city of San Estanislao. He is 59 years old with 2 children who are now grown and living independently. His wife, Rogelia Toledo, is 58 years old. She assures us that the happiest man in the world is living by her side.

Cayetano owns a convenience store where he now has a well developed clientele made up largely of people from the neighborhood who come to his store looking for convenience items. He and his wife are beloved in the community and thanks to their good client service the local people prefer to buy what they need in Cayetano's store.

One of his largest projects is the expansion of the room where he sells his products. The expansion would allow him to stock his store with a wider variety of merchandise for sale, including books, which are difficult to find in the neighborhood and would sell well with the large number of students living there. Cayetano and Rogelia are very hardworking people and much loved in the neighborhood.

Cayetano already has a small amount of money saved and he hopes to fulfill his dream of adding books to the store next year. At the moment, he is requesting a loan with which to stock more merchandise, such as sugar, meat, dairy products, baked goods, canned goods, sweets, cleaning products, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Cayetano R. Díaz es de la ciudad de San Estanislao, del Barrio Ycua Pai, es casado, con 59 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos que ya son mayores de edad y viven independientemente, su esposa se llama Rogelia Toledo tiene 58 años de edad y asegura que la vida al lado de ella lo hace el hombre más feliz del mundo.

Cayetano posee una despensa en su domicilio particular, donde ya cuenta con una clientela formada especialmente por vecinos del barrio que todos los días acuden a su despensa en busca de artículos de primera necesidad. Son personas muy queridas en el barrio y gracias a su buena atención la gente prefiere comprar en su negocio.

Uno de sus proyectos mas grandes es la de ampliar su salón comercial y así poder surtir de más variedad de artículos para la venta como los de librería, ya que en la zona hace mucha falta, por la cantidad de estudiantes que hay. Son personas muy trabajadoras, y muy queridas en su barrio.

Cayetano ya tiene un pequeño dinero ahorrado y espera cumplir su sueño para el próximo año, en esta ocasión, solicita un crédito para surtir de más mercaderías para su despensa tales como: azúcar, carne, lácteos, panificados, productos enlatados, gaseosas, golosinas, productos de limpieza, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise such as meat, dairy products, baked good, canned goods, soft drinks, sweets, cleaning products, etc.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel R. R. serves food and runs a general store from her home in a rural suburb of Pucallpa. Neighbors and friends come to her home to eat and drink on her beautiful porch. In the morning Isabel serves sandwiches and juices. At lunch time, she serves home cooked Peruvian meals. At night she has a grill and cooks steak, chicken, and cow heart.

Isabel is 55 years old, has 3 children and is married. Her children are grown, and she is more than happy to help care for her grandchildren. Isabel wants to continue to work hard, save money and invest in her businesses.

A member of the community bank Mujeres Empresarias, Isabel is requesting a loan of $375 to repay over 6 months. With the extra capital, Isabel will buy ingredients for her restaurant and restock her shelves. These ingredients include sugar, oil, rice, milk, meat and much more.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her restaurant and restock her shelves

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
Mr. Hernán G. González is from Jejui - Chore, a neighbor city to Santaní. He is 25 years old. He is the father of a beautiful boy and is married to Mrs. Carmen Figueredo López, who is 22 years old.

Hernán is very hardworking young man. Since he was very young he has worked and saved; he bought his own home through his own effort. He owns a business where he sells CD's, MP3's, DVD's and VCD's. The store has been functioning for more than 2 years now; he runs it from a rented space. In addition to the store Hernán and his wife also run, in the same space, a dining room where they serve food to the workers in the area. His wife works with him and together this young couple is seeking to move themselve ahead.

They have many projects. Hernán is a very enterprising man eager to progress. Despite the fact that he was not able to finish his studies he looks to get ahead through his hard work.

Today they are requesting a loan which they will invest in the business, especially in beverages such as soft drinks, juices, dairy products, and beer, along with meat, eggs, and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Hernán G. González es de Jejui – Chore una ciudad vecina de Santaní, él tiene 25 años, es padre de un hermoso niño y esta casado con la señora Carmen Figueredo López de 22 años de edad.

Hernán es un joven hombre muy trabajador, desde muy pequeño ha trabajado y ahorrado y hoy día ya ha adquirido su casa con su propio esfuerzo. El posee un negocio de ventas de cd´s, Mp3, dvd´s y vcd´s, el local está funcionando hace ya más de dos años y es alquilado. Además de ello también habilitaron en el mismo un comedor en donde dan de comer a gente trabajadora de la zona. Su esposa trabaja con el él y juntos esta pareja joven busca salir adelante.

Ellos tienen muchos proyectos, Hernán es un hombre muy emprendedor y con muchas ganas de progresar, a pesar de que no pudo culminar sus estudios el busca salir adelante con arduo trabajo.

Hoy ellos solicitan un crédito que lo invertirán en el negocio especialmente bebidas como gaseosas, jugos, lácteos, cerveza, carne, huevos, leche, entre otros.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise such as soft drinks, juices, dairy products, beer, meat, eggs and milk, among others.

loans.name: Lidia Victoria

texts.en:
Lidia Victoria S. C. has a business selling chicken in the city of Pucallpa. Lidia wakes up at 1 a.m. go to a market and buy live chickens from farmers. She then takes her poultry to her stand were she prepares them to sell. She has been selling chicken for many years and has plenty of loyal customers.

Lidia is 40 years old, has 5 children and is happily married. She is happy to have the support of her husband, unlike many other working women in her neighborhood. She often works side by side with these women, who all save money so their children can have more opportunities than they had.

A member of the community bank Mujeres Empresarias, Lidia is requesting a loan of $450 to repay over 6 months. She would use the loan to buy more chicken each day.

loans.use: To buy more chicken on a daily basis

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela T. A. has a business selling beauty products door-to-door in the city of Pucallpa. Her products include earrings, necklaces, bracelets, perfumes and more.

Adela is 40 years old, has 5 children, and is happily married. She loves her business and making her own money. She enjoys getting out of the house, building relationships, and helping people feel better about themselves. Adela is charismatic, hardworking, and now has many loyal customers.

A member of the community bank Amigas Siempre Unidas, Adela is requesting a loan of $475 to repay over 6 months. She will use the loan to buy more of her best selling products.

loans.use: To buy more popular products for her door-to-door business

loans.name: Elizabeth Angelica

texts.en:
Elizabeth Angilea S. R. owns a restaurant in the city of Pucallpa. She serves tasty meals of regional, Creole, and oriental origins. She has run the restaurant for eight years and it is always packed during lunch.

Elizabeth is 54 years old and happily married. She has 3 grown children and one of her daughters helps run the restaurant. Elizabeth started the restaurant because she loves to cook and she wanted to help her husband by earning money. Elizabeth loves serving the people of Pucallpa and has made lots of friends at the restaurant.

A member of the community bank Amigas Siempre Unidas, Elizabeth would like a loan of $400 to repay over 6 months. She will use the loan to buy sugar, oil, bananas, rice, salt, potatoes, and condiments.

loans.use: To buy sugar, oil, bananas, rice, salt, potatoes, and condiments

loans.name: Iris

texts.en:
Iris O. M. has a general store in the city of Pucallpa. From this store, which she runs in her home, she sells many popular products. She started the business two years ago after deciding to leave a market she had worked in for many years.

Iris is 43 years old with 5 children and is happily married. She loves her business, particularly because she gets to work from home and can be with her family. She is very social and loves building relationships with her customers.

A member of the community bank Amigas Siempre Unidas, Iris is requesting a loan of $400 to repay over 6 months. She will use the loan to buy rice, sugar, toilet paper, oil, and much more.

loans.use: To buy products for a general store, including: rice, sugar, toilet paper, oil, and much more

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Mr. Victor R. is 45 years old and has 2 children. He is married to Mrs. María Augusta Martínez, who is 48. Victor owns a convenience store that has been in business for 10 years and thanks to his efforts and savings he now has his own business premises in a very good location.

His wife works in Copaco, the company responsible for the telephone service in Paraguay. Thanks to her good sense of responsibility she has been promoted to Head of Administration.

Victor feels very happy and satisfied with his family and his work. He says that thanks for his good earnings he can give a good education to his children. The family is already saving for the children's university studies. One of his future projects is the set-up of a butcher shop in his convenience store, which will allow him to increase his clientele by offering a full range of basic necessities in his store.

Today Victor is requesting a loan he will invest in the purchase of a variety of merchandise for the store such as: fruit, vegetables, eggs, canned good, baked good, soft drinks, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Víctor R. tiene 45 años, es casado y tiene 2 hijos, él está casado con la señora María Augusta Martínez de 48 años de edad. Víctor es propietario de una despensa con 10 años de funcionamiento y gracias a esfuerzos y ahorros ya posee un local propio con una muy buena ubicación.

Su esposa trabaja en Copaco la entidad encargada de las líneas telefónicas de país. Gracias a su gran sentido de responsabilidad ya la han a Jefa Administrativa.

Víctor se siente muy feliz y satisfecho con su familia y trabajo, dice que gracias a sus buenos ingresos pueden dar una buena educación a sus hijos y ya están ahorrando para los estudios universitarios de ellos. Uno de los futuros proyectos que tiene es la de habilitar una carnicería en su despensa, de este modo podrá aumentar su clientela surtiendo de todo lo básico en su negocio.

Hoy Víctor solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mercaderías varias para la despensa como: frutas, vegetales, huevos, productos enlatados y de limpieza, panificados, gaseosas, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of fruits, vegetables, eggs, canned goods, cleaning products, baked goods, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Karina

texts.en:
Karina T. K. has a business selling clothing door-to-door in the city of Pucallpa. She sells underwear, shirts, and pants for all ages. Karina has many loyal customers; she uses a credit system so her customers can pay over a week or month. This credit system works well because many people get paid monthly.

Karina is 29 years old with 3 children and is happily married. She enjoys working, helping her family and earning money. Karina never had the opportunity to study, so sending her children to school is very important to her.

A member of the community bank Amigas Siempre Unidas, Karina is requesting a loan of $450 to repay over 6 months. She will use the loan to buy more clothing from the local distributor

loans.use: To buy more clothing from the local distributor

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis is 32 years old and has one son who goes to school. He is married to Ramona Leon. Luis has been selling clothes for women and children in the area of Santaní for the past three years. He has steady clients thanks to the competitive pricing of his merchandise.

With a lot of effort he was able to get his own home where he lives with his wife and children. In the future he would like to build a commercial space in his house where he could open a a store and also sell his clothes.

Luis has in the past requested loans and he has always maintained a good record on his payments. Now he wants to obtain a new loan with which he will be able to buy merchandise such as t-shirts, blouses, jeans, shorts, shoes, and underwear, among other items.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Luis tiene 32 años, tiene 1 hijo en edad escolar, y esta casado con la señora Ramona León. Luis se dedica a la venta de ropas para damas y niños, en toda la zona de Santaní, desde hace 3 años y ya cuenta con una buena clientela formada, gracias a los buenos precios de sus mercaderías.

Con mucho esfuerzo logró tener su casa propia en donde vive con sus hijos y esposa. Tiene proyectado en el futuro construir un salón comercial en su casa para abrir una despensa y una ropería.

Luis ya ha solicitado créditos anteriormente y ha mantenido siempre una buena referencia en sus pagos, hoy el desea solicitar un nuevo crédito para poder comprar mercaderías como remeras, camisas, jeans, shorts, zapatos, ropa interior, entre otros.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his business (clothes for women and children)

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha P. O. has a business selling shoes and small gifts door-to-door in the city of Pucallpa. She also has a grill and barbeques chicken, steak, and Juane to sell in the evening.

Martha is 45 years old with 2 children and is happily married. She loves working and helping her family and community. Her children are young and she wants them both to go to school so they can become professionals. She will continue to save and invest in her businesses.

A member of the community bank Amigas Siempre Unidas, Martha is requesting a loan of $475 to repay over 6 months. She will use the loan to buy rice, meat, fish, oil, and beans.

loans.use: To buy rice, meat, fish, oil, and beans

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta is 46 years old, married to Santiago Mendoza (47 years old), and living in the city of San Estanislao. Marta sells beverages in her house and her husband works agriculture.

The couple makes many sacrifices, they begin the day very early in the morning, preparing greens that the husband grew in order to sell them in the market. Marta has a store in her house where she sells cold beverages and some fast foods. She also sells candy and cigarrettes.

They are very happy and wish to move on with their business. However, they need to cover expenses (house and food). SHe wishes to add more things to her maket, this way she will be able to increase her sales. She wishes to purchaes a breadmaking machine, canned goods, sugar, mate, coffee, flour, eggs, meat, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Marta tiene 46 años de edad, ella esta casada con Santiago Mendoza de 47 años de edad y viven en la ciudad de San Estanislao. La señora Marta vende bebidas en su domicilio y su marido trabaja en la agricultura.

Esta pareja es muy sacrificada, ellos empiezan su día a tempranas horas de la madrugada, preparando hortalizas que el señor Santiago cosecha para ir al mercado juntos a venderlas mientras que Marta realiza sus compras para la casa y algunas mercaderías para su tienda. Marta tiene un tienda donde vende bebidas frías y algunas comidas rápidas así como también golosinas y cigarrillos.

Ellos son muy felices y desean seguir adelante con su trabajo pues gracias a ello tienen para cubrir los gastos de la casa y los alimentos. Marta desea habilitar una despensa en su tienda de bebidas, de este modo incrementar los ingresos en las ventas, entre las mercaderías a ser adquiridas podemos citar: panificados, productos enlatados, azúcar, yerba mate, café, aceite, harina, frutas, huevos, carne, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of beverages

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel T. V. runs a general store in the city of Pucallpa. She started the store a year ago and it has grown quickly. She has a good location in Market #3 and always serves her clients with a smile.

Raquel is 43 years old, has 2 children, and is happily married. She is very hard working and only sleeps for a few hours each night so that she has time to take care of her many responsibilities. After she closes her shop in the afternoon, she goes home to cook and sell grilled meats to her neighbors.

A member of the community bank Amigas Siempre Unidas, Raquel is requesting a loan of $475 to repay over 6 months. Raquel will use the loan to buy sugar, rice, eggs, oil, and other popular products for her store.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, eggs, oil, and other popular products for her store

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es:
Mr. Paulino Q. is 35 years old and married to Mrs. Isadora Ortega, who is 31. They have 1 son and live in their own home in a neighborhood of the city of Santaní.

Paulino is a multifaceted man. He works selling clothing together with his wife. She stays at home to sell the merchandise in the small store they have set up in their home while Paulino travels the neighborhoods offering his products. In addition to his sales work, Paulino is a teacher and director of a small local school where children, especially those with scarce resources who work during the day, attend night school.

Paulino says that despite being a humble man he aspires to instill in his students the idea and the example, through his own life, that those who want to get ahead can. Working and studying is a reality for many children in Paraguay who come from poor families and who from a very young age must learn to earn a living just to eat. He wants his country to generate more sources of work for older people. He desires with all his heart that Paraguay progresses so that two year old childen no longer have to beg in the streets and children from 4 years old no longer have to go out to sell sweets and wash windows when they ought to be learning and playing.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Paulino Q. tiene 35 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Isidora Ortega de 31 años de edad, tienen 1 hijo y viven en su casa propia en un barrio de la ciudad de Santaní.

El señor Paulino es un hombre multifacético, se dedica a la venta de ropas junto con su esposa, ella queda en la casa a vender las mercaderías en una pequeña tienda que tienen ahí mientras que Paulino recorre los barrios ofreciendo sus productos. Además de sus ventas, Paulino es docente y director de un pequeño colegio de la zona en donde acuden especialmente niños de escasos recursos y que trabajan por las mañanas y por las noches acuden a la escuela.

Paulino dice que a pesar de ser un hombre humilde, el desea inculcar a sus alumnos el ejemplo del que quiere puede superarse, trabajar y estudiar es una realidad de muchos niños de nuestro país, que provienen de familias muy humildes y desde temprana edad deben aprender a ganarse el pan.

Paulino se dedica a la venta de ropas hace mas de dos años y desea seguir progresando en las mismas, hoy el solicita un crédito que lo ayudará a comprar mercaderías en mayores cantidades, esto a su vez le ayuda a obtener mejores descuentos por sus compras al por mayor.

El desea que su país genere más fuentes de trabajos a personas mayores, desea de corazón que el país salga adelante para evitar que niños de dos años estén pidiendo limosnas en las calles y niños desde los 4 años tengan que salir a vender golosinas y limpiar vidrios cuando deberían estar aprendiendo y jugando.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor Núñez Molas is from the city of Santaní. He owns his own home, acquired through working and saving money. Víctor is married to his wife, Mabel, who is 23 years old. Together they are parents of a child who is just one year old.

Víctor is a confectioner dedicated to the production of sweet and salty candies. He works mornings in a bakery in the city and in the afternoons he makes sweet and salty candies at home. Victor is very well-liked in his area, and has very good sales as his products are in demand. Every day he produces large quantities of candies and sweet breads, which he sells out completely throughout the day. Already 4 years ago he was able to establish a mini bakery in his house, but he wishes in the future to be able to build a retail store in his home to be able to offer his products in addition to other products for sale.

He is now asking for a credit to be able to buy ingredients to prepare his candies, including flour, leavening, flavorings, vanilla, allowed colorantes, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer.

EL Señor Víctor Núñez Molas es de la ciudad de Santaní tiene una casa propia que pudo adquirirla gracias a su trabajo y ahorro. Víctor es casado, su esposa se llama Mabel y tiene 23 años, ambos son padres de un pequeño de tan solo un año.

Víctor es confitero, el se dedica a la producción de confites dulces y salados y trabaja por las mañanas en una panadería de la ciudad y por las tardes se dedica a hacer confites dulces y salados en su casa. Es un hombre muy querido en la zona, tiene muy buenas ventas ya que son muy demandados sus productos, todos los días produce grandes cantidades de confites y panes dulces y son vendidos en su totalidad en el día. Hace ya 4 años que pudo montar una mini panadería en su casa, pero desea en el futuro desea poder montar un salón comercial en su casa para poder ofrecer sus productos además de otros productos de despensa.

El esta solicitando hoy día un crédito para poder comprar insumos para preparar sus confites como harina, levadura, aromatizantes, vainilla, colorantes permitidos, huevos, leche, azúcar, etc.

loans.use: Expansion of Home

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosalía P. P. is a member of the Communal Bank "Nuestra Señora de la Paz". She lives in the department of San Martín, San Martín province, Tarapoto district. Her business is located at her own house at Jr. Bolognesi #1726. For 27 years, she has sold perfume and cosmetic items of different brands, such as ESIKA, AVON, and UNIQUE, which she sells via catalog and special order. Her main customers are workers of public and private companies. With a loan of $725 USD which will be paid in 6 months, she will buy various items such as: perfumes, lotions, shampoo, soaps, makeup, deodorant, and other products of these brands which go on sale at this time of year. This way she can have items in stock and will be able to offer product variety and satisfy the preferences of her customers. She is 50 years old and lives with her husband, 3 independent children and 1 son which she still financially supports so he can reach his goal. For this reason, she works with much preserverance day in and day out. Her wish is to be able to have her own shop someday to sell her products from.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosalía P. P., es socia del Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora de la Paz” vive en el departamento de San Martín, provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto, su negocio se ubica en su propia casa en el jr: Bolognesi Nº 1726. Se dedica hace 27 años a la venta de artículos de perfumería y cosméticos de diferentes marcas como ESIKA, AVON, UNIQUE, que lo vende a través de pedidos y por catalogo, siendo sus principales clientes los trabajadores de instituciones públicas y privadas. Con el crédito de S/. 2000.00 que será devuelto en 6 meses, comprará diversos artículos como : perfumes, cremas, champús, jabones, maquillajes, desodorante y otros productos más, de estas marcas que salen en ofertas en esta temporada para tener en stock y variar sus productos para así satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes Tiene 50 años vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos independientes y 1 hijo que todavía lo esta apoyando en lograr sus meta, razón por el que día a día trabaja con mucha perseverancia, su anhelando es poder tener su propio local propio para ofrecer sus productos.

loans.use: With the loan, she will buy more products to have in stock.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 42745

loans.name: Ursula Milagros

texts.es:
Mr. Ursula Milagros López Ramírez is a member of the Communal Bank "Nuestra Señora de la Paz". She lives in the region of San Martín, in the San Martín province, Tarapoto district. Her business is located on Jr. Huayna Cápac #328 and she provides telephone booth services and also sells beauty products. She started with the sale of beauty products, and thanks to her efforts and dedication, she was able to make her business succeed. Today, she also provides a telephone booth service, which she receives much support for from her husband. With a loan of $375 USD, which will be paid in 6 months, she will enhance her telephone booth business with equipment such as: fixed telephones, timers, and booths to service the community out of her own house. Mrs. Ursula is 28 years old. She lives with her husband and works tiredlessly to see results and to feel productive in live. She has much potential in the future and is thinking about expanding her telephone booth business without abandoning the sale of beauty products on the side.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ursula Milagros López Ramírez es socia del Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora de la Paz”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia San Martín y distrito de Tarapoto, su negocio está ubicado en Jr: Huayna Cápac Nº 328 y se dedica a brindar servicio en un Locutorio y también vende productos de belleza.. Ella se inicio con la venta de productos de belleza, y gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación pudo sacar su negocio adelante ahora cuenta con un servicio de locutorio es su esposo quien la apoyo. Con crédito de S/. 1,000.00, el cual será devuelto en 6 meses, implementara el negocio del locutorio con equipos como: teléfonos fijos, controladores de tiempo, y cabinas, del mismo que esta al servicio de la comunidad y esta ubicada en su misma casa. La señora Ursula tiene 28 años, vive con su esposo, trabaja incansablemente para poder ver los resultados y sentirse útil en la vida con muchas perspectivas en el futuro y más adelante esta pensando ampliar su locutorio sin dejar de lado la venta de productos de belleza.

loans.use: With the loan, she will buy equipment for her business

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Mrs. Flor D. Maria H. D. D., a member of the Communal Bank "Nuestra Señora D. la Paz", lives at department and province of San Martín, Tarapoto district. She sells domestic animals from her home, located on Jr. Leoncio Prado # 629 in the same district. She started in the business through her daughter, who has encouraged her to get ahead to this day. With the loan of $1,100 USD which will be paid in 6 installments, she will purchase domestic animals (a male and new females) such as ducks, hens, and turkeys, balanced food for growing and putting on weight, and medicines to prevent animal sickness. Flor D. Maria is 69 years old, and has 5 dependent children. She considers herself a strong woman, able to confront whichever difficulty, and with a great attituD. to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Flor D. Maria H. D. D., es socia del Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora D. la Paz, vive en el Departamento, Provincia D. San Martín, Distrito D. Tarapoto, se dedica a la venta D. animales domésticos en su misma vivienda ubicada en el Jr: Leoncio Prado Nº 629 del mismo distrito. Se inicio en el negocio por su hija, quien la impulso e incentivo a que siga adelante hasta el día D. hoy Con el préstamo D. 3000.00 que será cancelado en 6 cuotas lo invertirá en la compra D. animales domésticos (un macho y nueve hembras) D. patos, gallinas, pavos, comida balanceada para crecimiento y engorD. y medicinas para prevenir las enfermedades D. los animales. Flor D. Maria tiene 69 años D. edad, con 5 hijos independientes, se considera una mujer fuerte, capaz D. enfrentar cualquier dificultad, y con buen animo D. seguir adelante.

loans.use: With the loan, she will buy animals to sell

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Mrs. Zoila M. Ramírez is member of the Communal Bank "Nuestra Señora de la Paz". She lives in the department and province of San Martín, Tarapoto district. She sells condiments of all varieties; her shop is located at market #2 Tarapoto. She started in this business since she was very young. She would bring products from her small farm (bananas, yuca, cilantro, orange) to sell. Today, she sells condiments and does very well. She feels proud of what she does. With the loan of $375 USD which will be paid back in 6 months, she will buy cumin and whole black pepper (2.2 lbs daily of each), garlic, cilantro, peppers of various species, coffee (11 lbs weekly approximately). These products will then pass through a grinding process in order to sell bags according the quantities needed by her customers. In addition, she will buy spices in boxes and packages to sell by bulk. She is 67 years old and has 3 dependent children. She tends to this business because she enjoys it and she distracts herself with her customers. She has always been known to be strong, preserverant, calm, and a fighter.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Zoila M. Ramírez, es socia del Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora de la Paz”, vive en el Departamento y Provincia de San Martín y Distrito de Tarapoto se dedica a la venta de condimentos de todas las variedades, su puesto se ubica en el mercado nº 2 Tarapoto. Se inicio en el negocio desde muy pequeña, traía productos de su chacra de pan llevar (plátano, yuca, cilantro, naranja) par venderlo, ahora vende condimentos y le va muy bien, se siente orgullosa de lo que hace. Con el préstamo de 1000.00, que será devuelto en 6 meses comprara: cominos y pimienta en granos (1.0 Kg. .diario de cada uno ), ajos, cilantro, ajíes de diversas especies, café (5.0 Kg. aproximadamente semanal ), para luego estos productos pasar por un proceso de licuado y así poder vender al menudeo en bolsitas según la necesidad de su clientela. Además compra sazonadores en cajas y paquetes para vender al por menor. Tiene 67 años de edad, con 03 hijos independientes. Ella se dedica a este negocio porque le gusta y así se distrae con su clientela. Siempre se caracterizó por ser fuerte, perseverante, tranquila y luchadora.

loans.use: Con el prestamo comprara mas insumos para su venta

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Mrs. Irma García Torrejón is a member of the Communal Bank "Nuestra Señora de la Paz". She lives in the department and province of San Martín, Tarapoto district. Her seamstress workshop is based out of her own home, located at Jr. Circunvalación #2308 in the same district. She started this business 33 years ago along with her mother; she was her inspiration and the person who constantly motivated her to become independent and get ahead in order to provide the best for her family. With the loan of $550 USD which will be paid in 6 months, she will purchase: threads of various colors, good quality fabrics of various materials (cotton, licra, broadcloth, dracon) with many designs in meters and bolts to satisfy her demanding customers and provide good service. Currently, she is 48 years old and has 3 independent children. She considers herself a woman that is happy about what she has accomplished. In the future, she is thinking about selling clothing for children, men and women out of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Irma García Torrejón es socia del Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora de la Paz”, vive en Departamento, Provincia de San Martín y Distrito de Tarapoto, su taller de costura esta ubicado en su propia casa ubicado en el Jr: Circunvalación Nº 2308 del mismo distrito. Se inicio hace 33 años en el negocio junto con su mamá que ella fue su inspiración y el ser constante le motivo a independizarse y seguir adelante para dar lo mejor a su familia. Con el préstamo de 1500.00 que será pagado en 6 cuotas, comprara: hilos de colores variados, telas de diferentes materiales: Algodón, licra, popelina, dacron, en variados diseños y de buena calidad en metros y fardos para satisfacer a su exigente clientela un buen servicio. Actualmente tiene 48 años de edad, con 3 hijos independientes, se considera una mujer feliz de lo que ha logrado en futuro piensa poner en su propia casa venta de ropas para niños, caballeros y damas.

loans.use: With the loan, she will buy materials for her business

loans.name: Keyla

texts.es:
Mrs. Keyla P. S. is a member of the Banco Comunal "La Esperanza". She lives in the San Martín Region, province of Mariscal Cáceres, district of Juanjui. Her business is located on her own home, at Jirón Tomas Aguirre Nº 661 Barrio La Merced (661 Jiron Tomas Aguirre, La Merced neighborhood). She owns a general store where she sell general merchandise, basic medicine, candy, and other everyday products.

She has been enjoying and dedicating herself to this business since very young together with her husband who used to batter her, so she decided to file for separation and start her own business, which is going very well.

With the loan that she is requesting S/. 3000.00, which she will return in 6 installments, she will invest in the purchase of school supplies such as notebooks, pens, pencils, erasers, vinifan (book wrapping plastic), glue, tape, and notions merchandise such as thread, ribbon, tape, blond lace, and clothing goods such as polo shirts and pants.

Mrs. Keyla P. S. is 32 years old, has two daughters and one son, is persistent and very optimistic, and is eager to go on working and see her dream of her children becoming professionals and to be useful to society come true, so she come feel totally fulfilled as a mother, a woman, and a business woman.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva volunteer

La señora Keyla P. S. , es socia del Banco Comunal “ La Esperanza ” vive en la Región San Martín ,provincia de Mariscal Cáceres , distrito de Juanjui su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa situada en el Jirón Tomas Aguirre Nº 661 Barrio La Merced, tiene una Bodega donde vende abarrotes en general, medicinas básicas, huevos, golosinas y otros productos comestibles de consumo diario. Desde muy joven le gusto y se dedico al negocio junto a su esposo quien la maltrataba constantemente, razón por lo que decide separarse e instalar sola su negocio en la que le va muy bien. Con el préstamo de S/. 3000.00 el cual será devuelto en 6 cuotas, lo invertirá en la compra de útiles escolares como: cuadernos, lápices, lapiceros, borradores, vinifan,(plástico para forrar cuadernos) gomas para pegar, maskentape, asimismo artículos de pasamanería como hilos, cintas, blondas, y prendas de vestir especialmente polos y pantalones. Ella tiene 32 años de edad, 03 hijos, 02 mujer y 01 varones, es perseverante y optimista, con muchas ganas de seguir trabajando y ver cristalizado su anhelo de ver profesiones a sus hijos y útiles a la sociedad y ella verse realizada con madre, mujer y negociante

loans.use: With this loan she will purchase more merchandise for her business

loans.name: Pasanqueri Group

texts.es:
The “Pasanqueri” group works with the Pro-Mujer Villa Exaltación focal group in the Villa Exaltación area of El Alto.

This particular women's group is new and is in its 2nd cycle. All are very excited and happy to start their own businesses so that they can support their families. They all have large families and need to help their spouses with the household costs, especially since the majority of them have children who are old enough for school, but they do not have the money to give them a proper education.

There are several types of businesses within the group. For example, Don Carlitos has a public taxi service. Also, members sell clothing, condiments, produce, and cosmetics. They sell these goods retail, and have to purchase them wholesale in order to sell them as street vendors.

The entire group needs a larger loan to be able to get the products wholesale and, thus, expand their businesses and increase their profits. With these improvements, they will be able to support their families and pay the loans back quicker.

Translated by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

EL GRUPO "PASANQUERI" TRABAJA CON EL CENTRO FOCAL DE "VILLA EXALTACION DE" PRO-MUJER HUBICADO EN UNA VILLA DEL MISMO NOMBRE, EN LA CIUDAD DE EL ALTO .

ESTE PARTICULAR GRUPO DE SEÑORAS, ES UN GRUPO NUEVO CUMPLIENDO ASI SU SEGUNDO CICLO. TODAS MUY EMOCIONADAS Y FELICES DE EMPRENDER NEGOCIOS PROPIOS CON EL UNICO FIN DE SUSTENTAR SUS HOGARES YA QUE EN GENERAL TODOS CENTAN CON FAMILIAS NUMEROSAS Y NECESITAN APOYAR A SUS PAREJAS CON LA ECONOMIA DE SUS FAMILIAS, YA QUE LA MAYORIA TIENEN HIJOS EN EDAD ESCOLAR Y NO LES ALCANZA EL DINERO PARA OFRECERLES UNA EDUCACION DIGNA

EXISTEN DISTINTAS ACTIVIDADES DENTRO LA ASOCIACION COMO POR EJEMPLO DON CARLITOS TIENE UN TAXI DE SERVICIO PUBLICO, ADEMAS EXISTE LA VENTA DE ROPA, CONDIMEMTOS, VERDURAS, FRUTAS, COSMETICOS QUE GENERALMENTE SE LAS REALIZA AL POR MENOR, TENIENDO QUE ADQUIRIR ESTOS DISTINTOS PRODUCTOS AL POR MAYOR PARA PODER LUEGO OFRECERLOS DE MANERA AMBULANTE AL POR MENOR.

TODO EL GRUPO AFIRMA QUE NECESITA MAYOR CREDITO PARA PODER ADQUIRIR ESTOS PRODUCTOS AL POR MAYOR ASI LOS NEGOCOS CRECERIAN Y SUS GANANCIAS SERIAN MAYORES DE ESTA FORMA PODRIAN SUSTENTAR A SUS FAMILIAS Y PARALELAMNETE PODER PAGAR LOS CREDITOS DE MANERA MAS RAPIDA,

loans.use:
The group has expressed that they need more loans to be able to acquire wholesale products.

EL GRUPO AFIRMA QUE NECESITA MAYOR CREDITO PARA PODER ADQUIRIR ESTOS PRODUCTOS AL POR MAYOR

loans.name: Siempre Alegres Group

texts.es:
In the Villa Exaltación zone of the Villa Exaltación region where Pro-Mujer is located, you will find the "Siempre Alegres" or Always Happy association. This name is right on the mark since the group was unanimously happy upon meeting each other. They also say they are always happy because Pro-Mujer offers them a huge help with the services they grant to their members.

With the help of the service consultant, Sonia Aguayo Zeballos, they have been able to make a very well organized group. The group includes several small businesses, such as stores. Others are street vendors that sell artisan chocolates and crafts. The majority of them sell clothing they bring from the Desaguedero where prices are better. Therefore, they need to invest more capital to make trips to Desaguedero or other places where wholesale goods are sold. In this manner, the merchandise acquired will result in greater profits to be reinvested in expanding their businesses.

Moreover, they need to increase their incomes to support their families. Doña Lupe's husband has passed away, and she needs to take care of her family. She and her four children are trying to improve their economic situation despite the difficult times they are going through.

This is the association’s 3rd cycle, and they hope to keep counting on these or larger loans so that they, too, can grow.

Translated by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

EN LA ZONA DE VILLA EXALTACION FUNCINA EN CENTRO FOCAL DEL MISMO NOMBRE QUE PRETENECE A PRO-MUJER SE ENCUENTRA LA ASOCIACION DENOMINADA "SIEMPRE ALEGRES" DENOMINACION MUY ACERTADA YA QUE EL GRUPO MOSTRO UNA ALEGRIA GENERAL AL CONOCERLOS. ALEGAN ADEMAS ESTAR SIEMPRE ALEGRES PORQUE PRO-MUJER LES BRINDA UNA GRAN AYUDA CON TODOS LOS SERVICIOS QUE BRINDA A SUS SOCIOS Y CON LA AYUDA DE SU ASOSORA DE SERVICIOS SONIA AGUAYO ZEBALLOS LOGRAN FORMAR UN GRUPO MUY BIEN ORGANIZADO EL GRUO TIENE DISINTO NEGOCOS PEQUEÑOS COMO SE TIENDAS, OTROS VENDEN DE MANERA AMBULANTE CHOCOATES ARTESANALES, ARTESANIAS PERO LA MAYORIA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ROPA QUE LA TRAEN DESDE LA LOCALIDAD DEL DESAGUADERO DONDE LA ENCUENTRAN A UN PRECIO MENOR, ESTO IMPLICA QUE DEMANDAN INVERTIR MAYOR CAPITAL PARA REALIZAR VIAJES AL DESAGUEDERO U OTROS LUGARES DONDE PUEDAN ADQUIRIR PRODUCTOS AL POR MAYOR, DE ESTA FORMA LA MERCADERIA ADQUIRIDA LES PROPORCIONARIA MEJORES INGRESOS QUE IRIAN DESTINADOS POR LO GENERAL AL CRECIMIENTO DE SUS NEGOCIOS. ADEMAS TAMBIEN LOGRAR MAYORES GANANCIAS PARA CONTRIBUIR CON LA MANUTENCION DE SUS FAMILIAS TAL ES EL CASO DE DOÑA LUPE QUE TUBO LA MALA SUERTE DE QUEDAR VIUDA Y TENER QUE TOMAR LAS RIENDAS DE SU FAMILIA, ELLA JUNTO A SUS 4 HIJOS EN INTENTAN TENER UNA MEJOR SITUACION ECONOMICA PESE A LA DIFICIL SITUACION QUE ESTAN ATRAVESANDO. LA ASOCIACION YA ESTA EN SU TERCER CICLO CON LA ESPERANZA DE QUE ESTOS CREDITOS SE MANTENGAN Y SOBRE TODO CRESCAN PARA ASI TAMBIEN ELLOS PODER CRECER

loans.use:
They need to invest more capital to make trips to the Desaguedero or other places where they can purchase products wholesale.

DEMANDAN INVERTIR MAYOR CAPITAL PARA REALIZAR VIAJES AL DESAGUEDERO U OTROS LUGARES DONDE PUEDAN ADQUIRIR PRODUCTOS AL POR MAYOR,

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan Obregón is a single man who began his business 4 years ago. He began selling seasonal clothes because his salary was not enough to support his personal needs. This way he always has some kind of money and doesn't have to wait 'till payday.

This business has worked out because he is able to provide work clothes, people know him and are confident to place their orders with him. He delivers good quality clothes on a timely manner. He gets clients through recommendations and some of these clients purchase with credit.

He requests a loan for $475 which he will pay back in two months. This money will be used to purchase seasonal clothes. WIth your help Juan will be able to increase his business.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan Obregón es un hombre soltero quien emprendió un negocio hace 4 años la venta de ropa de temporada, ya que no alcanzaba a costear su gastos personales solo con su sueldo, de esta manera siempre cuenta con efectivo y no tiene que esperar a la quincena por un pago. El negocio le ha funcionado porque le permite ofrecer la ropa en el trabajo y hay personas que lo conocen y saben que pueden hacer sus pedidos con toda confianza ya que el se las entrega sin ningún problema, es decir, a tiempo y de buena calidad. De esa manera busca que sus clientes lo vayan recomendando con otras personas que paguen a tiempo y así les puede ofrecer crédito para que paguen en plazos.

El solicita un crédito por US $475 que pagara en 2 meses para surtir mercancía de temporada. Con tu contribución Juan seguirá haciendo crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of clothes

loans.name: Maria De La Luz

texts.es:
Maria de la Luz M. is a hardworking woman who once divorced assumed all the responsabilities in the raising of her son. At that moment she started working on her own in order to obtain money to cover all of her daily expenses as well as her son's studies. She started her business more than 12 years ago, and during this time she has learnt that you have to try everything in order to obtain earnings. There were times when one product would not sell well, and then she would have to try to sell another product so that she would not depend on the sales of one product only. Currently she sells menudo (a traditional soup), sausages, and beauty supplies. That way she can ensure that she will always have work and it also helps her keep active. On top of all these activities she also works at a laundromat where she has the opportunity to get more clients for her products.

She requires a $750 loan which she will repay in 6 months. She will use the loan to buy merchandise and also beauty supplies . With your help Maria can keep on working.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Ma. de la Luz Martínez es una mujer trabajadora y ejemplar al divorciarse asumió sola las responsabilidades de su hijo fue entonces que empezó a trabajar por su cuenta para poder obtener dinero y solventar los gastos de su casa y también los estudios de su hijo. Su negocio comenzó hace más de 12 años y a lo largo de este tiempo ha aprendido que se tiene que intentar de todo para poder obtener ingresos. Había ocasiones en que no se vendía un producto y había que intentar con otro para no depender de la venta de un solo producto. Actualmente vende menudo, chorizo y también ofrece productos de belleza, de esa manera siempre tiene trabajo y se mantiene activa. Además de todas estas actividades trabaja en una lavandería donde tiene la oportunidad de buscar más clientes

Requiere un crédito por US $750 que liquidara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y también algunos pedidos de productos de belleza que tiene pendientes por surtir. Con tus contribuciones María podrá seguir trabajando.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Nora Eneida

texts.es:
Ms. Nora Sánchez lives in an area of common land near to Victoria city, Tamaulipas, since there are no job opportunities for women other than housekeeping in the area where she lives. The economic situation is difficult, and that's why she decided to open her own business, since she didn't have money, is a single mom, and needs to maintain her child. After giving it some thought, she decided to work on her own. She started her business 5 years ago and she sells used clothing and novelties. She started with very little amount of merchandise that she sold to her friends, until she increased her list of customers. Thanks to this business she earned money for her child's schooling and for her home.

Ms. Sánchez is currently asking for a loan of US $575 that she will return in 6 months. This loan will help her to purchase merchandise since she already sold all the merchandise that she had and wasn't able to purchase more due to the lack of resources. Please help Nora so she can continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva volunteer

Nora Sánchez ella vive en un ejido cercano a ciudad Victoria, Tamaulipas, debido a que no hay oportunidades de trabajo para la mujer mas que el de la casa, y la situación económica es difícil, por esta razón se decidió a iniciar su propio negocio ya que no tenia dinero y ella estaba sola con su hijo y entonces tenia que obtener dinero para mantenerlo. Después de un tiempo de estar pensando que podía hacer para mejorar su situación, hasta que un día se le ocurrió trabajar por su cuenta. Su negocio comenzó hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y novedades, al principio inicio con poca mercancía vendiendo entre amigas y poco a poco se fue haciendo de clientela. Gracias a esto obtuvo dinero para los gastos de escuela de su hijo y de su casa.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $575 que esta dispuesta a pagar en 6 meses, este la va a ayudar a surtir mercancía ya que vendió toda la que tenía y debido a la falta de recursos no ha podido surtir más. Contribuye con Nora para que pueda continuar su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Agapito

texts.es:
Agapito L. is a married man with 7 children who worked for many years as a driver. This job forced him to leave his family for long periods of time in order to travel outside of the city. In order to avoid such long absences, he made the decision to start his own business, looking to work close to his family and become independent. His wife, his father-in-law, and his brothers-in-law all work in the making and selling of sweets. Little by little Agapito learned this trade and finally made the decision to begin working on his own. He struggled at first, but thanks to the support of his wife he was able to get ahead, and later his father-in-law gave a snack shop to Agapito’s wife. Currently two of Agapito’s daughters help with the business.

Agapito needs a loan of $950 US that he will repay in one month in order to restock merchandise and to install a booth in a well-known expo in his city. With your help Don Agapito will be able to continue providing for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Agapito L. es un hombre casado y con 7 hijos trabajaba como chofer motivo por el cual salía fuera de la ciudad dejando mucho tiempo a su familia, fue por eso que tomo la decisión de empezar un negocio por si mismo, buscando trabajar cerca de su familia e independizarse; su esposa, suegro y cuñados se dedican a la elaboración y venta de dulces, poco a poco aprendió este oficio hasta que tomo la decisión de empezar por cuenta propia batallando al principio pero gracias al apoyo de su esposa pudo salir adelante, posteriormente su suegro le dejo un snack a su esposa. Actualmente 2 de sus hijas les ayudan en el negocio

El requiere un crédito por US $ 950 que pagara en 1 mes para surtir mercancía e instalar locales en una conocida expo de su ciudad. Con tu ayuda Don Agapito podrá seguir beneficiando a su familia.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and install a store in a market

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan F. is dedicated to providing transportation services by taking children from their homes to school and back. He began the business because his income from his other work was not sufficient, so he saw the transportation service as an option for sustaining his family.

He started the business 10 years ago as a complementary activity that he worked at part time, and today he does it full-time. He provides transportation to various schools and now he has two vehicles.

He is asking for your support because he needs $375 US, that he will repay in 4 months, in order to pay for driving permits and for the maintenance of his vans. With your support, Juan will continue growing his business.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan F. se dedica a dar servicio de transporte a los niños de su casa a la escuela y viceversa lo inicio dado que con el sueldo que percibía de su trabajo no le alcanzaba, entonces vio como una opción el servicio de transporte escolar para poder mantener a su familia. Empezó hace 10 años, como una actividad complementaria que realizaba de medio tiempo y hoy en día lo hace de tiempo completo, dando servicio a varias escuelas actualmente cuenta con dos unidades.

El solicita de sus contribuciones ya que requiere US $375 que esta dispuesto a liquidar en 4 meses para poder pagar los permisos y el mantenimiento de las camionetas. Con tu apoyo Juan seguirá desarrollando su negocio.

loans.use: To maintain his vehicles

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María Elena Rancel started her business in order to cover school expenses for her three children. She was also struggling to cover family expenses, since her husband does not earn a fixed income, and she felt the need to contribute to the family earnings. For these reasons she began to sell shoes via catalogue to her relatives more than two years ago.

Now she is asking for a loan of $575 US that will be repaid in 6 months in order to purchase seasonal shoes and to expand her inventory so that she can further increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

María Elena R. emprendió su negocio dada la necesidad de solventar los gastos escolares de sus 3 hijos y además de no completar con el gasto familiar debido a que su esposo no tiene un ingreso fijo y ella sentía la necesidad de contribuir con estos gastos. Fue así como inicio con la venta zapatos por catalogo entre sus familiares hace mas de 2 años.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar zapatos de temporada y aumentar el inventario para con ello poder incrementar mis ventas

loans.use: To purchase shoes

loans.name: Maria Eva

texts.es:
María Eva González is a married woman with 2 children. She began her business 9 years ago upon her husband’s retirement. They needed to do something in order to earn sufficient income since the pension of Eva’s husband was not going to cover their expenses. They needed to look for an alternative way to make a living. They decided to open a grocery store, and thanks to this action they have prospered.

Now they need a loan of $950 US that they will repay in 6 months. They will use the money to restock merchandise and to purchase new products that their clients have requested. With your help, Eva and her family will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

María Eva González es una mujer casada y con 2 hijos, iniciaron su negocio hace 9 años al darse la jubilación de su esposo ya que necesitaban hacer algo para poder tener ingresos suficientes, debido a que con la pensión que le iban a dar a su marido no les alcanzaba para solventar los gastos, y necesitaban buscar una alternativa para tener un ingreso. Fue así que decidieron poner una tienda de abarrotes, gracias a esta han ido prosperando.

Ahora requieren un crédito por US $950 que pagara en 6 meses para surtir mercancía y nuevos productos que les han solicitado sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Eva y su familia saldrán adelante.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha Monsiváis began her business 12 years ago, almost by chance, when her oldest daughter refused to continue studying. Martha was looking for an activity that would help her daughter continue to grow so that she wouldn’t waste time and would be occupied with something. Martha decided to sell chips and soft drinks out of her home. Little by little she has invested in the business and it has grown so that now she has a grocery store. It has become a family business, since her husband now helps Martha run it.

Martha is requesting a loan of $675 US that she will repay in four months in order to restock the store and thus to be able to continue growing and getting ahead. Let’s help Martha and her family move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha Monsiváis empezó su negocio hace mas de 12 años de manera fortuita, cuando su hija mayor no quiso seguir estudiando entonces buscando una actividad en la que se pudiera desarrollar para que no perdiera el tiempo y se ocupara de algo, fue que decidió vender frituras y refrescos en su casa, poco a poco han invertido al negocio y lo han hecho crecer hasta tener una tienda de abarrotes, la cual se convirtió en un negocio familiar ya que su esposo le ayuda a atenderla.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $675 que pagara en 4 meses para surtir mercancía para la tienda, y poder seguir creciendo así como salir adelante. Ayudemos a Martha y su familia a seguir adelante

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo N. began his fruit and vegetable selling business when he was 15 years old. He started with a street stand selling only fruit after his father, still living, gave him the post as part of his inheritance. Ricardo took over his father’s entire business when he found out that his girlfriend, now his wife, was pregnant and Ricardo needed to find a way to take care of expenses and face the situation. Now he has four children, two of whom help him with the business.

Ricardo would like to have a larger store and a better supply of products. For this reason his is requesting a loan of $950 US that he will repay in 6 months. He will use the money to expand his business and to offer a larger variety of products to his clients. Let’s help Ricardo move forward with his business.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Ricardo N. inicio en el negocio de venta de frutas y verduras cuando tenia 15 años, empezó con un puesto en la avenida vendiendo solo fruta, cuando su papa le heredo en vida el puesto, tomo al 100% el negocio cuando se entero que su novia, ahora esposa estaba embarazada y tenia que encontrar la manera de solventar estos gastos y enfrentar la situación. Actualmente tiene cuatro hijos, dos de ellos le ayudan en el negocio.

El desea tener un local mas grande y mejor surtido, por esto solicita un crédito de US $950 que pagara en 6 meses para ampliar su negocio y así ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes. Apoyemos a Ricardo para que siga adelante con su negocio.

loans.use: To remodel his store and to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Alegria De Villa Flores Group

texts.en:
Maria is a 22 year-old lady working hard to improve the lives of her two young children. She and her husband have had a hard time making ends meet in their community of Pantoja, an impoverished area on the outskirts of the capital of Santo Domingo. She is excited about taking out this loan because she believes it could be the extra bit of help she needs to begin to really change things.

Maria runs a small business selling a variety of vegetables and fruits to her community members; she is taking this loan out because she wants to begin providing a better variety and higher quality of produce. Through the business-training classes she was required to take before requesting her loan, she learned about how to market products effectively, and how quality really does make a big difference in overall sales—she is very anxious to apply these new skills to her business.

She dreams of being able to grow her business in steps, first renting her own small store, and eventually having enough money to buy her own store. By taking these measure, she hopes to proviD. the means to send her two children to college so they can become educated and professional members of society. For herself, she dreams of growing intellectually, and to be not just a good business woman, but a great one.

If she has a few moments of free time, Maria loves to read, keep her house clean, and participate in a women’s club in her community that works together to keep their children and youth educated about HIV/AIDS and other issues that pose health issues to them.

On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, and from Maria herself, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To purchase a wider variety of fresh fruits & vegetables

loans.name: Secretos De Damas Group

texts.en:
Monica is a 37 year-old woman living with her husband and six children in a small and impoverished community on the far outskirts of the Santo Domingo capital area. From her home and the streets, she sells used clothing to her community members; in fact, she is requesting this loan so that she can finally buy sufficient inventory to meet the demand she faces every week.

With the money from the loan, she plans to go to one of the major marketplaces in the capital to buy her used clothing at bulk. Doing this will increase her profit margin and decrease expenses incurred in trips and higher inventory costs.

Monica hopes that with the increased profit made possible by this loan, she can continue expanding and developing her business and eventually return to school to become better educated. She wants to make certain that her children always have enough to eat and will be able to stay in school instead of quitting to help make money for the family. It is also the family's dream to have enough money to buy their own home and land. Monica's personal goals are to advance herself as a businesswoman, friend, and leader in her community.

On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, and from Monica herself, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To invest in bundles of used clothing

loans.name: La Union Hace La Fuerza Group

texts.en:
Denise P. is the president of her Bank of Hope in the small community of Imbert, on the north coast of Puerto Plata. 28 years old, she is married with one child. Denise sells new clothing out of a small store, and takes pride in the fact that she sells good quality clothing. She attends a Baptist church in the area, and enjoys reading her Bible in her spare time. Her favorite foods are rice and chicken, but she also likes the “ducles” that people are famous for in the Dominican Republic. She hopes that one day she can buy a house and a car because it would make her life much easier.

This is the first loan that this community has applied for, and they are all very excited to improve and start their businesses. Many of the women in this bank are Haitian, and have come to the Dominican Republic in hopes of a better life and future. Esperanza hopes that every single one of these women will experience success and begin the process of lifting themselves out of poverty.

Oh behalf of this entire group, and Esperanza – thank you for your continued support and generosity!

loans.use: To invest in new clothing.

loans.name: Banco Maranatha Group

texts.en:
Maria M. is a 44 year-old woman who lives with her husband, Israel, and her three children (ages: 19, 20, 22). She runs a small grocery store that provides staple items for her community such as rice, toilet paper, water, and candy. We asked Maria to tell us something about herself, and she told us that her favorite food is pork, and during her free time she loves going to church. She is a vivacious and active woman who is looking forward to the opportunity of improving her business and helping her children live better lives.

This will be the first loan for this bank of women, and they have already developed a strong community environment and interdependence. On behalf of these women and Esperanza, we would like to thank you for contributing to this loan!

loans.use: To purchase food staples and household goods.

loans.name: Mujeres Del Nuevo Renacer Group

texts.en:
Higinia is a gracious 47 year-old woman who lives with her three children (ages: 25, 14, 5) and her husband, Manuel Jesus Ramirez.. She has lived in Puerto Plata her entire life, and has been the proud owner of a small “colmado” for seven years now. She carries items such as rice, beans, candy, and beverages, supplying them to her entire community. With this loan she wants to acquire a more extensive inventory of items and improve the appearance of her shop. She says that she has learned a great deal from the preliminary training Esperaza provides, and wants to put this new knowledge to good use! Higina thanks God that she doesn’t have any huge problems in her family right now, and hopes that soon she and her husband will be able to build themselves a home for their family to live in.

This will be the first loan for the community of Los Limones, and they are all very excited about this opportunity. The next six months will not only provide financial support, but also the opportunity for many of these women to become very good friends and maintain life-long relationships. On behalf of Esperanza and the women of Los Limones, thank you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase food supplies and store renovation materials

loans.name: Ni Ketut Hudiani

texts.id:
Hudiani is a mother of 2. Her husband is a seasonal farm worker who does not have a permanent income. Therefore she helps to get extra income by raising piglets at the backyard of her house.

She has 7 piglets now which she feeds every 09.00 am. She can earn up to IDR 3.5 million from a 6 month period (around USD 393). She uses this money to send her children to school and to support her family daily needs.

She wants to use the loan money to buy more piglets and to build a permanent hut that she can use as cage for the piglets.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Setiap pukul 09:00 wita Hudiani memberi makan 7 ekor babi peliharaannya.Pekerjaan ini tentunya sudah menjadi rutinitas kesehariaannya. Kandang bambu yang sederhana dimiliki dibelakang rumah,sebagai tempat untuk menampung babi yang dipelihara. Usaha ini sangat membantu dalam memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Hudiani memiliki 2 orang anak yang masih menjadi tanggungan. Semangat untuk berusaha yang dimiliki membuat suaminya sangat senang karena sangat meringankan beban sebagai bapak kepala rumah tangga. Karena penghasilan suami sebagai petani yang tidak menentu. Keuntungan yang sudah dirasakan sangat memuaskan.dalam 6 bulan 7 bibit babi ini bisa menghasilkan Rp.3.500.000,- bersih. Keuntungan ini digunakan untuk biaya sekolah anaknya dan sangat menunjang kehidupannya.Untuk kedepannya Hudiani akan membuat kandang yang permanen agar babi yang dipelihara semakin banyak.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and to build hut (Membeli pakan dan membuat kandang)

loans.name: Thi Van's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Vân, 36 years old, married with two school age children, is a village cadre. The family farm and weave bamboo baskets and other bamboo products like fences, trays. She is applying for a loan of 2006000 đồng, that would be paid back in 25 weeks, T. buy bamboo and T. invest in their business. She hopes that the loan would help the family’s economy. Her group has 5 other members. They all apply for loans of the same amount as hers.
  • Nguyễn Thị Phương, 40 years old, applies for a loan T. buy rice for noodle production.
  • Tô Thị Hiệp, 42 years old, applies for a loan T. buy pigs.
  • Nguyễn Thị Thanh, 61 years old, applies for a loan T. buy young cows.
  • Nguyễn Thị Thu, 50 years old, applies for a loan T. buy fruits for her fruit stand.
  • C. Thị Bé, 43 years old, applies for a loan T. feed for poultry.
  • C. Thị Ninh, 51 years old, applies for a loan T. replenish her clothing shop.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Vân, 36 tuổi, là cán bộ phụ nữ địa phương. Chị sống cùng chồng và 2 con đang đi học. Ngòai làm ruộng, gia đình chị còn đan lát các dụng cụ bằng nứa, tre, đặc biệt là các loại giàn, phên để phục vụ các hộ sản xuất mỳ, vỏ đa nem, miến trong thôn. Chị tham gia chương trình với mức vốn 2006000 đồng trong 25 tuần để mua tre, nứa đan lát. Chị mong rằng món vay này sẽ giúp chị tiết kiệm hơn, thúc đẩy kinh tế gia đình chị phát triển hơn. Trong nhóm chị còn có các thành viên khác: Chị Nguyễn Thị Phương, 40 tuổi, vay 2006000 đồng để mua gạo làm mỳ. Chị Tô Thị Hiệp, 42 tuổi vay 2006000 đồng để mua lợn. Chị Nguyễn Thị Thanh, 61 tuổi, vay 1534000 đồng để thêm tiền mua bò. Chị Nguyễn Thị Thu, 50 tuổi, vay 2006000 đồng để mua hoa quả bán. Chị C. Thị Bé, 43 tuổi, vay 2006000 đồng để mua cám nuôi gà thịt. Chị C. Thị Ninh, 51 tuổi, vay 2006000 đồng để thêm vốn buôn bán quần áo.

loans.use: Invest in businesses

loans.name: Thi Du's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. C. Thị Dư, 37 years old, married with three school age children, is an industrious woman. The family farm, raise pigs and run a farming general store. She is applying for a loan of 2006000 đồng to invest in their businesses. She hopes that the loan would help the family’s economy. Her group has 5 other members. They all apply for loans of the same amount as hers.
  • Trần Thị Thường, 30 years old, applies for a loan to buy construction materials
  • Lê Thị Sâm, 28 years old, applies for a loan to buy feed for her egg laying chickens
  • Trần Thị Hồng, 41 years old, applies for a loan to buy rice for her noodL. production
  • Trần Thị Sáu, applies for a loan to buy rice for her noodL. production
  • Vũ Thị Thắm, 22 years old, applies for a loan to invest in her husband’s wood shop.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị C. Thị Dư, 37 tuổi, là người phụ nữ rất chăm chỉ. Chị sống cùng chồng và 3 con đều đang đi học. Gia đình chị không chỉ làm ruộng, chăn nuôi nhiều lợn thịt mà còn là chủ cửa hàng kinh doanh các sản phẩm phục vụ nông nghiệp như phân đạm, lân, kali... và các loại thuốc bảo vệ thực vật. Chị vay 2006000 đồng để bổ sung vốn bán hàng. Chị hy vọng việc kinh doanh của gia đình ngày càng tốt hơn. Các thành viên khác trong nhóm gồm: Chị Trần Thị Thường, 30 tuổi, vay 2006000 đồng để thêm vốn mua gạch, sỏi. Chị Lê Thị Sâm, 28 tuổi, vay 2006000 đồng để thêm vốn mua cám cho gà đẻ trứng. Chị Trần Thị Hồng, 41 tuổi, và chị Trần Thị Sáu vay tiền để mua gạo làm mỳ. Chị Vũ Thị Thắm, 22 tuổi, vay 2006000 đồng để cho chồng thêm vốn làm nghề mộc.

loans.use: Invest in businesses

loans.name: Thi Hai's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Hải, 26 years old, married with a small child, tends a small drug store. Her husband is a carpenter. She is applying for a loan of 2006000 đồng, that’d paid off in 25 weeks, T. invest in her store. She’s never had a loan before. Her group has 5 other members. They all apply for loans of the same amount as hers.
  • Nguyễn Thị Hằng, 22 years old, applies for a loan T. invest in her clothing shop
  • Trần Thị Vui, 26 years old, applies for a loan T. buy pigs
  • Tô Thị Sinh applies for a loan T. invest in her fruit stand
  • Trần Thị Hương, 25 years old, applies for a loan T. buy bamboo for her weaving material
  • Đào Thị Thành, 23 years old, applies for a loan T. buy rice for her noodle production

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Hải, 26 tuổi, có 1 con nhỏ. Chị là chủ cửa hàng thuốc nhỏ, ngòai ra, cửa hàng chị còn bán một số đồ dùng, mỹ phẩm... Chồng chị làm thợ mộc. Chị vay vốn để mua thuốc, một số mặt hàng bán. Chị chưa từng vay vốn ở đâu, nay tham gia chương trình vì thích được tiết kiệm trả góp hàng tuần. Các chị còn lại trong nhóm chị đều vay mức 2006000 đồng trong 25 tuần. Chị Nguyễn Thị Hằng, 22 tuổi, vay vốn để buôn bán quần áo. Chị Trần Thị Vui, 26 tuổi, vay vốn để mua lợn. Chị Tô Thị Sinh vay vốn để đi chợ hoa quả. Chị Trần Thị Hương, 25 tuổi, vay để mua tre nứa đan lát. Chị Đào Thị Thành, 23 tuổi, vay để mua gạo làm mỳ.

loans.use: Invest in various businesses

loans.name: Sre Ompel Ii Group

texts.en: Mr. Song S. is the Village Bank President of Sre Ompel II Village Bank, which consists of 28 members in the Kandal Province. He is 46 years old and is a subsistence farmer who usually works on a rice field. He is married with eight children, three of whom are working while the others are enrolled in school. His wife, Mrs. Srey NE. Chhom, is a housewife and she normally helps her husband work in the field. Because his family is very poor and because he has an insufficient number of farm equipment and draft animals, he is hereby requesting a loan to hire a laborer with draft animals to plow his rice field. With the remaining loan proceeds, he would buy fertilizer for the field.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with an animal to plow the rice field and to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Thi Xuan's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. C. Thi Xuan, 50 years old, is living with her 2 children (one of which is working, and the other one is still going T. school), her husband and her father-in-law. Her family does many activities such as: working on the rice field, selling merchandises in general store, sell fertilizer, assisting ceremonies, catering, etc. She wants T. borrow money T. expand her general store. Other members in her group also want T. borrow 125 USD in 25 weeks. They are: Mrs. L. Thi Canh, 47 years old, and Mrs. T. Thi Hoa, 32 years old, borrow money T. buy rice T. make rice crepes; Mrs. T. Thi Nga, 43 years old, borrows money T. sell noodles; Mrs. V. Thi Ty, 54 years old, wants T. borrow money T. buy pig mash; and Mrs. D. Thi Them, 35 years old, wants T. borrow money T. sell noodles and eggs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị C. Thị Xuân, 50 tuổi, sống cùng 2 con (1 con đã đi làm, còn 1 còn đi học), chồng và bố chồng. Gia đình chị rất nhiều hoạt động: làm ruộng, bán hàng tạp hóa, bán phân, đạm... (dịch vụ nông nghiệp); cho thuê phông bạt, bát đũa... phục vụ các đám cưới hỏi, ma chay... Chị vay vốn để thêm vốn mua hàng tạp hóa bán.
