Các thành viên còn lại trong nhóm chị đều vay mức vốn 2006000 đồng trong 25 tuần: Chị Lê Thị Canh, 47 tuổi và Chị Tô Thị Hoa, 32 tuổi vay vốn để mua gạo làm vỏ bánh đa nem. Chị Trần Thị Ngà, 43 tuổi, vay vốn để buôn bán mỳ, hàng mã. Chị Vũ Thị Tỷ, 54 tuổi, vay vốn để mua cám lợn, ngan. Chị Đinh Thị Thêm, 35 tuổi, vay vốn để buôn bán các mặt hàng mỳ, trứng...

loans.use: buy more merchandises for general store, buy rice, pig mash, to sell noodles and eggs

loans.name: Thi Dao's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. T. Thi Dao is a hard-working woman but she does not have a happy life. She divorced with her husband and is currently on her own raising 2 children. Everyday, she makes beans T. sell, works on the rice field and breeds the pigs. She borrows money T. buy more fertilizer and insecticide. She hopes the money will help her family situation getting better so that her children can go T. good school. Other members in her group also borrow 125 USD in 25 weeks. They are: Mrs. N. Thi Mien, 49 years old, borrows money T. buy rice T. make rice vermicelli; Mrs. T. Thi Mai, Mrs. D. Thi Thuy and Mrs. T. Thi Loan borrow money T. buy more pig mash.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Tô Thị Đào là người phụ nữ chăm chỉ, tháo vát nhưng không may mắn, chị đã ly dị. Nay chị một mình vất vả nuôi hai con ăn học. Hàng ngày chị làm đậu bán, chăn sóc ruộng đồng và nuôi đàn lợn thịt. Chị vay vốn để mua phân bón, thuốc trừ sâu bón lúa. Chị hy vọng số vốn này sẽ giúp chị cải thiện kinh tế gia đình để các con chị có điều kiện ăn, học tốt hơn. Các thành viên khác trong nhóm chị cũng đều vay 2006000 đồng trong 25 tuần. Chị Ngô Thị Miên, 49 tuổi, vay vốn để mua gạo làm bún. Chị Trần Thị Mai, Dương Thị Thủy, Trần Thị Loan đều vay vốn để mua cám lợn.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, insecticide, rice and pig mash.

loans.name: Thi Hoa's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoa, 45 years old, has 3 children that are going T. school. Her family does a variety of activities such as: working on the rice field, breeding pigs, selling food in the market, etc. T. earn money. Her husband is a hired driver. She wants T. borrow money T. buy ingredients for her food shop in the market. She hopes that her food shop menu will be more various so that she can earn more profit from it. Consequently, she will be abL. T. send her children T. good school. Other members in her group also want T. borrow 125 USD in 25 weeks. They are: Mrs. D. Thi Thu, 46 years old, borrows money T. sell ceremonial decorations in the market; Mrs. L. Thi Thuy, 43 years old, borrows money for her business in the market; Mrs. T. Thi Nu, 37 years old va Mrs. N. Thi Lan, 32 years old, borrow money T. buy more fertilizer; and Mrs. N. Thi Hang, 34 years old, borrows money T. sell candles in the market.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Hòa, 45 tuổi, có ba con đang đi học. Gia đình chị có khá nhiều hoạt động như làm ruộng, nuôi lợn, bán hàng ăn ở chợ... Chồng chị là lái xe thuê. Chị vay vốn để thêm tiền mua nguyên liệu bán hàng ăn. Chị hy vọng vốn vay sẽ giúp cửa hàng ăn của chị phong phú đa dạng hơn từ đó đem lại lợi nhuận cao cho gia đình để con chị được học hành tốt hơn. Các thành viên khác trong nhóm chị cũng đều vay 2006000 đồng trong 25 tuần, gồm: Chị Đào Thị Thư, 46 tuổi, vay vốn để đi chợ bán đồ lễ cúng. Chị Lê Thị Thúy, 43 tuổi, vay để đi chợ. Chị Tô Thị Nụ, 37 tuổi và Chị Nguyễn Thị Lân, 32 tuổi vay vốn để mua phân đạm... Chị Nguyễn Thị Hằng, 34 tuổi, vay vốn để đi chợ bán các loại nến.

loans.use: buy ingredients for food shop, fertilizer, sell ceremonial decorations, candles in the market

loans.name: Luisa's Group

texts.en:
Luisa L. G. lives in the Yacot community of Santo Domingo with her two children, both of whom attend school. To meet the challenge of earning a living and providing for her family's needs, Luisa sells a variety of products including vegetables, ripe fruits, rice, spices and fresh meat. She has been running her business for three years and has developed a large customer base. While currently operating from her house, she plans on using her loan to rent a local facility to better sell her products and increase her revenue.

Luisa is asking for the funds as the coordinator of a group of four other women, all operating businesses within the same community. These members are: Marta E., an entrepreneur selling underwear for both men and women; Josefa P., buying some goods to continue her fried chicken business; Josefina M., buying tablecloths to resell in her community, and Viola J., investing in the purchase of cookware.

loans.use: To purchase fruits, vegetables and other goods for a small business.

loans.name: Ro Teng Ii Group

texts.en: Mrs. Somaly Chork, Village Bank President, is a single mother with two children in Ro Teng Village. Both of her children attend school. She is 32 years old and she sells vegetable for a living at the Ro TH. market. On average, she can generate approximately $2.50 of income per day. As she is a widow making very limited income, her and her family's standard of living is quite poor; specifically, she is unable to pay for her family’s expenses, such as her children’s educational costs. In order to get her family out of poverty, she is hereby requesting a loan to buy more vegetables to resell at the market for a profit. Mr. Chandy Na S. and Mr. S. Oark V. are not pictured; instead, their wives are pictured in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase additional vegetables to resell at the village market.

loans.name: Sre Ompel I Group

texts.en: Mr. N. T. was born in 1951 and is married. He is a fisherman and is the Village Bank President of Sre Ompel I. He and his wife have eight children: two children are working, three children are attending school, and the other three children are too young to work or go to school at the present time. His wife, Run Vanphea, is a fish seller who usualL. assists her husband gather fish and then sell them in the market. On average, his wife can earn approximateL. $1.75 per day of income. Mr. Ny T. is in need of baskets in which he can put fish and shells, etc. Thus, he is seeking a loan to buy more baskets to help him with his work.

loans.use: To purchase additional baskets to hold fish and shells.

loans.name: Luz Del Alba's Group

texts.en:
Luz Del Alba is an active and hard-working entrepreneur, and she is the coordinator of a group of five women who own and operate businesses in the Yacot community of Santo Domingo. Luz has been selling cookware to the women of her community for more than two years. This activity is the principal means of providing food and a good education for her children. Luz will use her loan to buy more products to sell to her clientèle and to attract more people.

The members of Luz’s group are: Clemencia P., Macila P. and Mathurin Z., all of whom will invest their funds to buy men’s clothing for a small business, and Suanny J., who will purchase cloth for a small business.

loans.use: To purchase cookware to sell in her community.

loans.name: Ni Ketut Hudiani

texts.id: Setiap pukul 09:00 wita Hudiani memberi makan 7 ekor babi peliharaannya.Pekerjaan ini tentunya sudah menjadi rutinitas kesehariaannya.  Kandang bambu  yang sederhana dimiliki dibelakang rumah,sebagai tempat untuk menampung babi yang dipelihara. Usaha ini sangat membantu dalam memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Hudiani memiliki 2 orang anak yang masih menjadi tanggungan. Semangat untuk berusaha yang dimiliki membuat suaminya sangat senang karena sangat meringankan beban sebagai bapak kepala rumah tangga. Karena penghasilan suami sebagai petani yang tidak menentu. Keuntungan yang sudah dirasakan sangat memuaskan.dalam 6 bulan 7 bibit babi ini bisa menghasilkan Rp.3.500.000,- bersih. Keuntungan ini digunakan untuk biaya sekolah anaknya dan sangat menunjang kehidupannya.Untuk kedepannya Hudiani akan membuat kandang yang permanen agar babi yang dipelihara semakin banyak.

loans.use: Membeli pakan dan membuat kandang

loans.name: Ni Putu Sutarmi

texts.id:
Sutarmi lives a simple life. Her house is made of dried leaves. Her husband is an ordinary farmer. She works to earn additional income to support her family. She has 4 piglets which she feeds 3 times a day. From this activities she can earned up to IDR 1.8 million per 6 months period (around USD 205). She uses this profit to buy more piglets so she can earn more.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Sutarmi dalam menjalani kehidupan kesehariannya sangat sederhana dan rumah tempat tinggalnya pun sederhana terbuat dari gedeg, karena suami Sutarmi hanya seorang petani biasa. Sutarmi semangat untuk berusaha agar bisa membantu dalam memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Sutarmi memelihara 4 ekor babi penggemukan yang dibeli dari saudaranya. Usaha ini sangat cocok untuk Sutarmi karena Sutarmi hanya tamat SD. Babi yang dipelihara sangat gemuk, karena dalam 1 hari Sutarmi memberi makan 3 kali. Juga diberikan makanan tambahan berupa dedaunan dan batang pisang. Setiap pagi, babi peliharaannya dirawat dengan cara kandangnya dibersihkan dan juga babinya dimandikan agar segar dan sehat. Keuntungan yang didapat dalam 6 bulan Rp.1.800.000,- Keuntungan ini digunakan untuk modal lagi agar bisa memelihara lebih banyak dan keuntungan juga lebih banyak diterima. Dengan dana pinjaman yang didapatnya, Sutarmi berencana untuk menambah populasi babi peliharaannya agar keuntungan yang diperoleh lebih meningkat.

loans.use: To buy piglets (Membeli bibit babi untuk menambah populasi ternaknya)

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 38 years old. He has three children. They are studying in school. His elderly father lives with his family and he is very sick. The entrepreneur has an old taxi and he applied to get $1200 to replace the old taxi with a new one to increase his income. He wants to save for a better life for his family and to take care of his elderly father .

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Replace the old taxi with new one

loans.name: Ni Ketut Kenti

texts.id:
Once every 3 days Kenti sells the coconut leaves (They are used for religious activity in Bali) to her customers who come to her house to make a pick up. She gets these coconut leaves from her neighborhood for IDR 5,000 per leave set which are sold to her customer for IDR 10,000 (around USD 1.17).

Kenti's husband is very supportive to this business as the profit money she earned can be used to finance their child's education who is now at junior high school.

They want to make this business growing and one of their goal is to invest the profit they earned in pig farming activities so they can improve their income further more.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Setiap 3 hari sekali Kenti menunggu pelanggan yang datang mengambil janur ( daun kelapa ) yang sudah diikat dan siap untuk dipasarkan kembali. Kenti merasa senang dan semangat bila sudah menerima hasil dari jerih payahnya dan bisa diputar kembali untuk membeli janur. Setiap hari Kenti berkeliling kerumah warga untuk membeli janur yang akan dijual kembali.1 pelepah janur dibeli dengan harga Rp. 5.000.- dan dijual Rp.10.000.- Itupun sudah dipotong dan diikat kecil-kecil dengan harga Rp.1.000.- per ikat. Suami Kenti sangat mendukung usaha ini karena keuntungannya bisa digunakan untuk membiayai sekolah anaknya yang kini sedang duduk dibangku SMP. Mereka sangat kompak dalam berusaha sehingga mereka sepakat keuntungan kedepan akan dipergunakan untuk modal usaha dengan usaha yang lain yaitu beternak babi supaya keuntungan yang didapat bisa bertambah banyak.

loans.use: To buy more coconut leaves (Menambah modal usaha agar dapat membeli lebih banyak janur)

loans.name: Fausta

texts.en:
Fausta is 36 years old and is divorced with 2 children, ages 7 and 15. Fausta owns a small food vendor store, which she started in 2007. Everyday, she works from 6.30am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Ni Nyoman Darti

texts.id:
Darti lives alone with her husband. Their two children are married and they live in another town. Darti and her husband lives in a permanently built house which is simple but clean. Darti wants to stay working as she does not want to be dependent to their children's support. Therefore she farms pig. At the moment she has 5 pigs which are kept at a hut build from cement.

She can earn profit of IDR 2 million every 6 months (around USD 220/ 6 months). She uses this money to finance their daily life. In the future she wants to have more pigs so she can have more income.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Darti hanya tinggal berdua dengan suami. Dua orang anak mereka sudah menikah dan tinggal di kota. Rumah tempat tinggal Darti permanen dan sangat bersih. Walaupun dalam hidupnya tidak lagi menanggung anak –anak mereka tetapi Darti tetap bersemanggat untuk bekerja. Darti tidak mau hanya mengharap dan bergantung pada anak –anak dan juga menantunya. Untuk itu Darti memelihara 5 ekor babi, agar bisa mendapat penghasilan yang lumayan. Setiap harinya Darti disibukkan dengan usaha babinya. Dengan kandang terbuat dari beton, Darti setiap paginya mengurus ternak mereka. Pada sore harinya Darti mencari dedaunan untuk babi peliharaannya. Keuntungan yang didapat sebesar Rp. 2.000.000.- per 6 bulan. Keuntungan ini digunakan untuk biaya hidup sehari-hari. Suaminya sangat mendukung usaha ini, bahkan untuk kedepannya Darti ingin lebih banyak memelihara babi dan bisa menambah jumlah kandang lagi.

loans.use: To buy good quality pig feed (Membeli pakan babi berkwalitas)

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is 35 years old and is married with 3 children, ages 1-13. She and her husband also take care of another person, 40 years old. Nuru is a cloth seller; she started in 2004. Everyday, she works from 6am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $220 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more inventory for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 31 years old and is married with 4 children, ages 3-13. Amina owns a small cafe, which she started in 2006. Everyday, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Halima's Juhudi Group

texts.en:
Halima is 45 years old and is a married woman with 5 children, ages 4-26 . She and her husband also take care of 3 other children, ages 8-24. Halima owns a small food vendor store that she started in 2006. Everyday, she works from 7am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Happiness and Fatma, who have businesses dealing in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is 22 years old and is a married woman. Rukia is a cloth seller and owns a small salon which she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 8am to 3pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more inventory for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Ni Putu Miarni

texts.id:
Miarni is a cow farmer. She likes this job and her husband is also very supportive. She feeds the cows early at 06.00 am with grass that she collected before. During the day, the cows are let loose to find their own food. In the evening at 06.00 p.m. she then gives them food again.

She wants to have more capital to buy more cows so she can improve her income.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Menjadi peternak sapi adalah suatu kegiatan yang tidak pernah ditinggalkan bagi Miarni karena Suaminya juga sangat mendukung dalam usaha ini.Mencari rumput setiap hari untuk sapinya adalah suatu pekerjaan yang sering dilakukan oleh Miarni.Bagi Miarni itu adalah suatu pekerjaan yang menyenangkan dan selalu ditekuninya. Setiap hari pukul 6.00 pagi sudah sibuk memberi makan sapinya dengan persediaan rumput yang sudah ada.Sedang untuk siang hari dibiarkan di kebunnya untuk mencari makan sendiri.Menjelang malam hari pukul 6.00 sore juga sibuk untuk memberi makan sapinya. Kegiatan ini dilakukan dengan harapan sapinya yang baru dibelinya tetap sehat.persediaan pakan hijauan tidak pernah kekurangan didesanya asal mau mencarinya di daerah sekitar desanya. Penghasilan memang sedikit namun bisa untuk membantu dan menambah pendapatan bagi keluarganya.Miarni berkeinginan untuk menambah jumlah sapinya agar nantinya keuntungan yang diperolehpun bertambah banyak.

loans.use: To buy cows (Membeli sapi untuk menambah populasi ternak peliharaannya)

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en: Zaituni N., age 45, is the chairperson of the Committed Women in Development group. She is a widow with 3 kids, 2 boys and 1 girl, all still in school. She has a restaurant on Kampala Road that prepares all kinds of local dishes, and it is running smoothly due to its ever increasing customers and good customer care. Customers flock to her restaurant as early as 8:00 AM for breakfast, and come 11:00 AM, they are just ready for lunch until past 4:00 PM. To my observation, there is a need for expansion in terms of seating space for her customers. She needs a loan to help her buy more plates and spoons for the restaurant, but above all, she would like to put a building on her plot that she bought recently on Salaama Road.

loans.use: Zaituni needs a loan to help her buy more plates and spoons for her restaurant.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice, age 38, is such an outgoing businesswoman. She is married with 3 school-going kids, and her husband is a driver. She sub-rents a shop on Ben Kiwanuka Street, where she has been selling cloth (textiles) for 4 years to her customers. She needs a loan to help buy more textiles for her stock to increase her savings. Her dream is to see herself rent a bigger shop space and have enough textiles to fill it.

loans.use: Alice needs a loan to help her buy more textiles for her stock to increase her savings.

loans.name: Diluvina's Group

texts.en:
Diluvina is fifty-nine years old and a proud mother of twelve children. To make a living, she sells homemade ice cream and ripe fruits, operating her business in the public school of the community. The entrepreneur says that it’s a profitable business, and that she would like to augment her production in order to increase both her sales volume and her income. Profits from her activity will allow her to pay for the children’s educations and to deal with some other financial issues.

Diluvina will take her loan with a group of four other women who all own businesses. They are: Lidia F. P., who owns a cafeteria;. Rosa P., who operates a small beauty products store; Cruz Antonia M. G., who will purchase silver jewelry, and Candida A. G., who will use her loan to buy jewelry.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and  raw materials to prepare her delicious ice cream.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina has a tailoring business on Kampala Road that has been running for 15 years. She sits just outside in the corridors with her colleagues, where their customers meet them. She is 39 years old and married with 3 children, as she caters to her sister who is in Form 2. Her husband, a water engineer, has been a great help, mostly in those times when she did not have access to loans, but still he is supportive. She needs a loan to enable her to buy more materials for sewing that she can sell to her customers.

loans.use: Georgina needs a loan to enable her to buy more cloth material for sewing that she can sell to her customers.

loans.name: Paula's Group

texts.en:
Paula C. Paula coordinates the activity of a group of five women, all of whom are entrepreneurs. Paula runs a well-established grocery store in the community. Everyday she receives visits from large numbers of people who want to purchase a variety of products, including rice, beans, vegetable oil, bread, peanut butter and the like. Her store also offers alcoholic and energy drinks. Paula plans on using her loan to purchase more products so that she can considerably increase her sales volume and revenue. That way, this entrepreneur will be able to improve her family’s standard of living.

The members of Paula’s group are: Yesenia María A. A., who owns a grocery store; Maxima Augustina D. L. S. D., who is borrowing for her jewelry store; Celeste R. C., who wishes to purchase silver jewelry, and Claudina V., who wants to buy beauty products for her store.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products to supply a grocery store.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan has a 15-year-old crafts shop in Crafts Africa on Buganda Road, where she sells art and crafts to her customers, who are mostly foreigners and the community people. She is 62 years old with 5 children, as she caters to grandchildren and cousins as well. She needs a loan to enable her to buy more crafts, although she makes some of them herself, as well as help to look after her home. She is a member of Committed Women in Development, a lending group that has helped in instilling the discipline of saving and teamwork among its members.

loans.use: Joan needs a loan to enable her to buy more crafts for her shop, as well as buying the material for the crafts she makes herself, to enable her look after her home.

loans.name: Salongo Kalam's Group

texts.en: Salongo K. is such an outgoing person, and no doubt this has enabled him to keep his all-time customers. He is 43 years and married with 6 children. He used to look after his relatives’ children, but now they are old and most of them married. He is a farmer of rice, tomatoes, coffee, vanilla, cassava, and potatoes, and he has been doing this all his life. The loans have helped him buy from other farmers when he does not have enough for his customers, especially in a bad season. So he needs a loan to buy coffee and green bananas from farmers to sell in the markets in Buikwe, Kawolo, and Lugazi. Both Salongo and Sarah are members of Zibula Atudde Women’s Group.

loans.use: Salongo Kalam plans to buy coffee and green bananas from farmers to sell in the markets in Buikwe, Kawolo, and Lugazi.

loans.name: Magreth

texts.en:
Magreth is 35 years old and is married with 3 children, ages 8-18. Magreth is a hair dresser and owns a small salon , which she started in 2007. Everyday, she works from 8am to 7.30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $275 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Paulina's Utulivu 2 Group

texts.en:
Paulina is 28 years old and is a single woman with 2 children, ages 9 and 4. Paulina has been a business and trading woman since 2008. Everyday, she works from 9.30am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $170 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more inventory for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Abra and Rose, who have businesses dealing in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Zibula Atudde Lugazi Group

texts.en: Running a retail shop in a village is not an easy thing, especially among your friends and relatives, because they would want goods on credit and this is a business setback. This situation is what has been affecting Hadijah, the chairperson of Zibula Atudde Women’s Group, and her 10-year-old shop in Bunyumya, her home village. She is 48 years old and married with 5 school-going children, as well as caring for 3 relatives’ children. She has been a member of her lending group for 10 years, and this has really helped her with business expansion and learning how to save. She needs a loan to help with the expansion of her shop by buying more goods that will attract more customers for more profits and savings.

loans.use: Hadijah has planned to use the loan for the expansion of her shop by buying more goods like sugar, salt, soap, and biscuits that will attract more customers for more profits and savings.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is 28 years old and is married with 2 children, ages 2 and 14. Rehema owns a small shop and has been a shopkeeper since 2006. Everyday, she works from 6am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $170 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more inventory for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Anthonia's Utulivu 2 Group

texts.en:
Anthonia is 27 years old and is a single woman with 1 child, 3 years old. Anthonia is business and trading woman; she started in 2008. Everyday, she works from 9am to 10pm at her business.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more inventory for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Joyce and Asha, who have salons.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Prisca's Furaha Group

texts.en:
Prisca is 28 years old and is single woman. Prisca is a clothes seller; she started in 2002. Everyday, she works from 9.30am to 6pm at her business.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more inventory for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Mwanaidi and Saumu, who have businesses selling utensils and food.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Ro Teng I Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sary P. is 50 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom attends school while the other is working and can generate approximately $2 of income per day. She is a subsistence farmer and her husband, Mr. Manel O., is a government officer. Mr. Manel O. normally earns approximately $1.75 per day, but he sometimes assists his wife in the field when he is not fulfilling his duties as a government officer. As cultivatable land is now harder to come by and less fertile, Mrs. Sary P. and her group are seeking a loan to buy more seeds and fertilizer for their field so that they can grow (and sell) crops.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer to grow crops for sale.

loans.name: Jaweed

texts.en: Jaweed, who is married, lives in District 4 of Kabul, Afghanistan. Jaweed is a highly experienced tailor, specializing in sewing wedding clothes. His growing popularity as a tailor requires him to expand and improve his business, therefore, Jaweed is requesting a loan to buy new machines in order to complete his stock. By improving his business, he will also be able to better support his family.

loans.use: To buy new machines

loans.name: Kompong Svay I Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sidon S. lives in Kompong Svay Village, where she is the Village Bank President. She is 58 years old and a single mother with four children, all of whom are working. She relies on her children for economic support because she is a widow and does not generate any income of her own. Rather, Mrs. Sidon stays at home to cook and care for her children. Mrs. Sidon would like to work around her home in a better and more safe manner, so she is seeking a loan in order to build a kitchen counter in the backyard of the house.

loans.use: To build a kitchen counter.

loans.name: Emomshoh

texts.ru:
Emomshoh Shoimurodovich H. lives in the Fayzabad region. He is married and has four children. He has a college education and is zootechnician by profession. He is 41 and has a business of selling groceries. There no available jobs in his field at this time and this is why he went into retail. He has more than 18 years experience in this field. He is the only one who works in his family. To increase commodity circulation and sales he needs money and decided to apply for a loan. By increasing the variety of produce in his store Emomshoh will be able to make more money to support his family. This will also allow the local residents to buy the necessary goods without leaving the town. He plans to pay off the loan within 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

Хакимов Эмомшох Шоимуродович проживает в районе Файзабад.Женат, имеет 4 детей. Образование высшее . По специальности зоотехник. Возраст 41 год. Занимается куплей продажей продуктов питания. Так как по специальности работы в данное время нет,клиент занимается торговлей.Имеет опыт в торговли более 18 лет. В его семье работает только он один. Для увеличения товарооборота клиенту нужны были деньги и он решил взять кредит . Увеличив ассортимент магазина клиент сможет заработать больше денег на содержание своей семьи. Так же жители смогут покупать у него товары первой необходимости,не выезжая за покупками в город. .Клиент планирует погасить кредит в течении 9 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase commodity turnover

loans.name: Afaf

texts.en: Afaf is 52 years old and lives and works in the town of Nabatieh in south Lebanon. She produces pickles and jams for a living, and sells her products to her neighbors. This is the first time Afaf has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua. She will use the money to buy the provisions she needs to continue her business.

loans.use: to buy provisions for her business

loans.name: Roudayna

texts.en: Roudayna is 36 years old and lives with her family in a town in south Lebanon known as Nabatieh. She works as an agent, selling plastic containers for a living. This is the first time Roudayna has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua. She will use it to buy the inventory she needs to maintain and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell to her customers

loans.name: Izatullo

texts.ru:
Izatullo Iskandarovich Z. lives in the Fayzabad region. He is 39 years old, married and has four children. He has a secondary education and has a small grocery store where he sells food products. To increase the variety of produce in his store Izatullo needs money and decided to apply for a loan. By expanding his business he will be able to make more money to support his family. This will also allow the local residents to buy the necessary goods without leaving the town. He plans to pay off the loan within 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

Зоиров Изатулло Искандарович проживает в районе Файзабад .Возраст 39 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей .Образование среднее. Занимается куплей продажей продуктов питания. Имеет небольшой магазин на местном рынке,где торгует продуктами питания. Для увеличения ассортимента магазина клиенту нужны деньги . Клиент решил взять кредит. Расширив бизнес клиент сможет заработать больше денег и лучше содержать свою семью. Жители смогут покупать у него свежие продукты питания,не выезжая в город.Клиент планирует погасить кредит в течении 9 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Bouchra

texts.en: Bouchra is 29 years old and works and lives with her family in south Lebanon, in the town of Nabatieh. Bouchra makes a living selling clothes and accessories. This is the second time that she has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua. She will use this new loan to buy additional items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing and accessories to sell to her customers

loans.name: Najib

texts.en: Najib is 46 years old and has five children. He lives with his family in south Lebanon, in the town of Nabatieh, where he works as a car mechanic. He has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua to buy several car engines, which he will use to maintain and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy car engines

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is 34 years old and the father of three children. He lives with his family in south Lebanon, in the town of Nabatieh. He makes a living repairing cars, and has applied for a loan to buy equipment to repair car wheels.

loans.use: to buy equipment to repair car wheels

loans.name: Zeboniso

texts.ru:
Zeboniso Mirzoevna N. lives in the Fayzabad region. She is 43 years old, married and has six children. She has a secondary technical education. She is now in the clothing retail business and has a vendor space on the central market of Fayzabad. She has more than five years experience in this business. There is no other work in the area so she has to support her family on her own. This business is the only source of income for the family. Zeboniso wants to buy seasonal clothing at this time and decided to apply for a loan to increase the variety of her store. She plans to pay off the loan within 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

Назарова Зебонисо Мирзоевна проживает в районе Файзабад. Возраст 43 года, замужем , имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее техническое.Клиентка занимается куплей продажей одежды .Торгует на центральном рынке района Файзабад. Имеет опыт в бизнесе более 5 лет . Так как работы в районе нет,ей приходится самой содержать такую большую семью. Бизнес является единственным исчтоником дохода семьи.В данный момент Зебонисо хочет завести сезонную одежду для продажи. Зебонисо решила взять кредит для увеличения ассортимента магазина.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 9 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is 30 years old and has one child. He works and lives with his family in Nabatieh, a town in south Lebanon. He makes his living as a car mechanic, and has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua to buy the spare parts he needs to run and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for a car-repair business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 37 years old and works and lives in the town of Nabatieh in south Lebanon. He repairs cars for a living, and has applied for his first loan from A. Majmoua to buy equipment he needs for his business.

loans.use: to buy equipment for his business

loans.name: Islom

texts.ru:
Islom Shomahmadovich A. lives in the Fayzabad region. He is 61 years old, married and has 8 children. He has a college education and is an agronomist by profession, but does not work in this field. He is in the animal husbandry business and breeds small cattle. He has five years experience in this field. He buys the cattle on the local market, feeds them for about 40-45 days and then resells on the same market at a more profitable price. This business is the only source of income for his large family. Islom wants to buy goats and needs the money so he decided to apply for a loan. At this time small cattle costs less to buy and prices will start to rise in about a month. He plans to pay off the loan within 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

Ашуров Ислом Шомахмадович проживает в районе Файзабад.Возраст 61 год.Женат,имеет 8 детей .Образование высшее,по специальности агроном. По специальности не работает. Занимается разведением мелкого рогатого скота. Имеет опыт в животноводстве 5 лет. Клиент покупает на местном рынке сельхоз.животных ,откармливает их по 40-45 дней и перепродает их на том же рынке,по выгодной ему цене.Животноводство является единственным источником дохода его большой семьи.Клиент хочет купить коз ,для чего нужны средсвта. Поэтому он решил взять кредит .В данное время мелкий рогатый скот можно купить дешевле. Через месяц цены начнут расти. Кредит планирует погасить в течение 9 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy small cattle

loans.name: Assadullo

texts.ru:
Assadullo Toshkuvatovich D. lives in the Khuroson region in the Pahtaobod village. He is 51 years old, married and has six children. He has secondary education and has an animal husbandry business. He has a small cow house where he breeds calves. Because he does not have a specialized education, animal husbandry is the only source of income for his family. Assadullo buys calves on the market at a low price, feeds them and then resells on the same market at a more profitable price. He provides the markets with meat and his family with the necessary food. Assadullo wants to buy a calf and needs money so he decided to apply for a loan. He plans to pay off the loan within 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

Дустмуродов Ассадулло Тошкуватович проживает в районе Хуросон в поселке Пахтаобод .Возраст 51 год. Женат , имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее .Клиент занимается животноводством. Имеет небольшой коровник, где разводит бычков. Так как у клиента нет специального образования, животноводство является основным источником дохода его семьи.Ассадулло покупает на рынке бычков по низкой цене, откармливает их и перепродает на том же рынке или жителям по выгодной ему цене.Тем самым обеспечивает рынки мясом,а семью необходимыми продуктами питания . Клиент хочет купить бычка , для чего ему нужны деньги .Поэтому Ассадулло решил взять кредит. Планирует погасить кредит в течении 9 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Simiao

texts.en:
Simiao is 23 years old, originally from Ponta Mamone, a beach village in the South of Mozambique. He is married and has one 2-year-old child. Simiao lived with his sister in South Africa for 6 years where he went to school until 5th grade in primary school.

In 2003, Simiao returned to Zitundo, a village close to Ponta Mamone, to work at a camping lodge, where he learnt how to fish. He worked there for 5 years and in the beginning of 2008 he resigned to start his own fishing business. Simiao believes that he can earn more than the monthly R800 (approximately US$95) paid at the camping with his business, and so far it has been true. Simiao and his younger brother Ernesto go to the sea with his boat at 4am and return around 8am. They catch between 20 and 50 fishes per day, depending on the weather. Each Kg of fish (around 5-7 fishes) is sold for MTn 20 (approximately US$0.8). On top of supporting his wife and child, Simiao supports his brother Ernesto who also lives with them.

This is Simiao’s first loan. He heard about Hluvuku through an older brother that is a client and has successfully paid his loan. Simiao plans to use the MTn 3,200 to buy a fishing net and improve his business. For now, Simiao wants to focus on growing the business and eventually to buy another boat.

The picture shows Simiao selling his fish at Ponta D’Ouro’s open market. Ponta D’Ouro, famous for tourism, is the village next to Zitundo and bordering with South Africa.

loans.use: Buy a fishing net

loans.name: Odinagul

texts.ru:
Odinagul Sattarova lives in the town of Vahdat. She is 44 years old, married and has six children. She has secondary education and is in the agriculture business. Every year she sows a small plot of land with wheat. This gives her family daily bread and flour, which is expensive to buy. Odinagul plans to sow the land with wheat and have a good harvest. She will stock up with seeds and sell the rest on the market. For a good harvest she needs to buy high quality seeds and mineral fertilizer and decided to apply for a loan. She will pay off the loan within 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

Сатторова Одинагул жительница города Вахдат. Возраст клиентки 44 года. Замужем , имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее. Одинагул занимается земледелием .Она каждый год засеивает свой небольшой участок пшеницей.Это дает ее семье не покупать на рынке муку и готовый хлеб,что обходится ее семье очень дорого.Клиентка планирует засееть пшеницей землю и собрать хороший урожай.Запастись зерном ,а лишнее продать на рынке .Но что бы получить хороший урожай нужные качественные семеня пшеницы и минеральные удобрения.. Одинагул решила взять кредит и планирует погасить его в течении 9 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy seeds of wheat and fertilizer

loans.name: Iskhok

texts.ru:
Iskhok Nazurov lives in the town of Yavan. He is 53 years old, married and has five children. He has a college education and has graduated from a pedagogical university. He is a teacher by profession and works in a polytechnic college. In the rural areas most people are in the animal husbandry business. Iskhok also does that and breeds calves for meat sales. He wants to buy a few more calves and resell them after 2-3 months. He needs a loan for that and it will help him increase commodity circulation and also increase his family's income. He has been in this business for the past ten years. Besides money this business also brings joy to his family. He plans to pay off the loan within 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

Назуров Исхок проживает в городе Яван. Женат и имеет 5 детей.Ему 53 года. У него высшее образование. Закончил педагогический университет. По специальности преподаватель. Работает в Политехническом училище. Но в сельской местности мало кто не занимается животноводством. Вот и Исхок тоже разводит бычков для продажи на мясо. Сейчас он хочет купить еще несколько молодых бычков и через 2- 3 месяца продать. Для этого он хочет получить кредит. Это поможет ему увеличить товарооборот и тем самым увеличить доход для своей семьи. Занимается этим видом бизнеса клиент уже 10 лет. Эта работа кроме денег приносит ему и его семье радость . Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 9 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy calves

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana E. A. is a 36-year-old widow with three children. For the past 15 years, she earned a living selling peanuts, beans, and rice in her town of Sunyani, Ghana. With the profits, she has been able to pay for her children's education and even sent the oldest one to college.

Christiana has applied for a loan of $525 U.S. dollars to purchase more supplies. There will be a price hike next year, so she wants to buy them at a lower cost now. With the additional profits, she wishes to put her son through university and save towards building a house.

She is a member of the group “Nyame Aseda” (translation: God’s Thanksgiving). The group guarantees that each member will repay his or her loan.

loans.use: To buy more peanuts, rice, and beans to sell in a grocery market

loans.name: Hai Damaska 2014-2 Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Gesayi F.. She is currently in the business of selling at a shop and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Gesayi is a 40-year-old married woman. Her husband is a business man. They have 5 children ranging from age 10 to 20 and her children go to school. Each week, Gesayi makes approximately 280 Sudanese pound in profit and with the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay fees for her children.

Gesayi is joined in her small group by Rejoice Peter, Jane M., Diana J., and Victoria J.. Rejoice Peter has a business in selling breads and beer and wants to expand the business. Jane M. is currently operating a business in selling vegetable and wants a loan to expand the business. Diana J. operates a business of selling breads and mangoes and wants to expand her business. Victoria J. is currently in the business of brewing alcohol and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: Expand the business

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence K. K. is a 66-year-old married father of four children. For the past three decades, he has made a living by selling groceries, stationery, soap, and soft drinks in a small general store in the town of Drobo, Ghana. Here, he is pictured in his store.

Lawrence has applied for a loan of $625 U.S. dollars to buy more groceries to sell. With the additional profits, Lawrence hops to pay for his children's university fees. Three of his children are currently in college. He is a member of the group called Mount Sinai. The group uses the peer pressure principle to ensure each member repays his or her loan.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and supplies for a small general store

loans.name: Yei Road 2001-3 Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Edina M.. She is currently in the business of selling breads and charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Edina is a 40-year-old married woman. Her husband works as a security guard . They have 6 children ranging from age 6 to 12 and her children go to school. Each week, Edina makes approximately 140 Sudanese pound in profit and with the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay fees for her children.

Asha M., Kaku J., Waron J., and Poni J. join Edina in her small group. Asha M. has a business in selling greens and wants to expand the business. Kaku J. is currently operating a business in brewing alcohol and wants a loan to expand the business. Waron J. operates a business of selling shorgum and wants to expand her business. Poni J. is currently in the business of selling breads and is requesting a loan to to open a bar.

loans.use: Expand the business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose K. is a 51-year-old married mother of six children living in Drobo, Ghana. For the past two decades, she has earned a living by purchasing pillows and mattresses from a nearby city and selling them at a profit in her own town.

Rose has applied for a loan of $625 U.S. dollars to purchase more inventory to sell. With the additional profits, she hopes to pay for her oldest son's college fees and support her family. She is a member of the group called Mount Sinai. The group members guarantee that each individual will re-pay her loan,

loans.use: To buy more mattresses and pillows for a small store

loans.name: Fahriddin

texts.ru:
Fahriddin A. lives in the town of Yavan. He is 32 years old, married and has three children. He has no formal education. He does animal husbandry and breeds large cattle to be able to feed his family. He has a small cow house where he keeps the calves and then sells them on the market where he buys younger ones. He has been in this business for the past three years. Fahriddin wants to get a loan and use it to increase his cattle head count. It will bring additional income to him. His not so big but joyful family also try to help Fahriddin with this business. He plans to pay off the loan within 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Азизов Фахриддин проживает в городе Яван. Женат и имеет 3 детей . Клиенту 32 года, но он не имеет образования. Для того , чтобы прокормить семью клиент занимается разведением крупно рогатого скота. У него есть небольшое хозяйство в котором он разводит бычков . Потом он продает их на базаре и покупает новых помоложе. Занимается этим видом бизнеса клиент уже 3 года.Клиент хочет получить кредит и использовать его для того чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Это поможет клиенту получить дополнительный доход. У него небольшая и веселая семья и они все вместе стараются помочь Фахриддину. Погасить кредит клиенгт планирует в течении 9 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Djumagul

texts.ru:
Djumagul M. lives in the town of Yavan. She is 61 years old, married and has five children. She does not work anywhere, but in spite of her age, she keeps her animal husbandry business herself. Djumagul is a very active and strong woman. She has one milk cow from which she gets milk and sells it on the market. This business brings good income to her. She wants to buy a second cow to increase the amount of milk she can get which will allow to increase her profits. Besides, milk is always in high demand and selling it helps supply the residents with a healthy and nutritious product at an affordable price. This is why Djumagul needs a loan. She will pay off the loan within 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Магмуродова джумагул проживает в городе Яван. Замужем , имеет 5 детей.Возраст 61 год. Клиентка нигде не работает , но не смотря на свой возраст она самостоятельно занимается животноводством. Джумагуль очень активная и сильная женщина. Имеет одну корову которая дает молоко. Свежее молоко она продает на базаре. Этот бизнес дает ей доход. Сейчас клиентка хочет купить еще одну корову , чтобы увеличить количество получаемого молока. Это дает возможность увеличить доход. Кроме того молоко всегда пользуется спросом и продажа данного вида прдукции помогает обеспечить население жизненно- важным продуктом . по доступным ценам. Поэтому клиентка запланировала получить кредит. А погасить кредит она сможет в течении 8 месяца.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix K. is a 33-year-old married father of a one-year-old son. He has recently moved his family to Drobo, Ghana, from his hometown, where there wasn't any business opportunities. Felix has been a tailor for the past five years, and runs his store from a small wooden kiosk. He is currently training four people so they can support themselves as seamstresses. Here, he is pictured with two of his apprentices.

Felix has applied for a loan of $425 U.S. dollars to buy supplies, such as thread, buttons, and his own embroidery machine. Currently he has to send dresses that require needlework to other businesses, which charge him a fee and reduces his profit. He also hopes to rent a store, since his kiosk is vulnerable to theft.

Felix is a member of the group called Magdalene. Each member of the group guarantees for the other in repaying the loan.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials, such as an embroidery machine, thread, and buttons, for a tailoring shop

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 52-year-old widow with six children living in Drobo, Ghana. For the past two decades, she has earned a living running a pharmacy with her husband, but after he passed away, the business began to struggle. Here, she is pictured with one of her sons in the store.

Emma is applying for a loan of $625 U.S. dollars to buy more inventory, such as anti-malaria pills, pain killers, cough syrups. She hopes to expand the store so that she may pay for her children's education. Two of her children are currently in college studying nursing and they rely on Emma's help.

Emma is a member of the group called Magdalene. The group uses the peer pressure principle on members to re-pay part of their loan amount.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for a pharmacy

loans.name: Zendia B 2009-1 Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Ester G.. She is currently in the business of selling breads and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Ester is 32 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has 4 children ranging from age 15 to 18 and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to feed her children and pay school fees.

Ester is joined in her small group by Anna M., Rose P., Rose P., and Martha C.. Anna M. has a business in baking cakes and wants to expand the business. Rose P. is currently operating a business in selling charcoal and wants a loan to expand the business. Rose P. operates a business of selling charcoal and wants to expand her business. Martha C. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: expand the business

loans.name: Holberdi

texts.ru:
Holberdi Hudaynazarovich T. lives in the Khuroson region in the village of Pahtobod. He is 48 years old, married and has eight children. He has secondary education and is in the animal husbandry business. He buys calves on the market at a lower price, feeds them for about 45 days and then resells on the same market later at a more profitable price. At this time, there are no well paying jobs in the region and animal husbandry is the main source of income for his large family. Holberdy wants to buy another calf and for this he needs money. He decided to apply for a loan and will pay it off within 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Тагаев Холберди Худойназарович проживает в районе Хуросон,поселке Пахтообод.. Клиенту 48 лет , он женат и имеет 8 детей. Образование среднее , занимается животноводством.Клиент покупает на рынке бычков по низкой цене , откармливает их в течение 45 дней и продает на том же рынке , по более выгодной ему цене. В данное время в районе нет хорошооплачиваемой работы,животноводство является основным источником дохода его большой семьи. Холберди хочет купить еще одного бычка,для чего ему нужны деньги .Клиент решил взять кредит и погасить его в течении 9 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua B. is a mother of six children in Ghana. For the past nine years, she has sold rice, vegetable oil, soap, and other toiletries. She uses her income to support her children.

Akosua has applied for a loan of $925 U.S. dollars to purchase more inventory to sell. She has saved some of her money, so that she can register for Ghana's National Health Insurance Scheme, a new program that provides healthcare for poor and lower-income residents.

Akosua a proud member of the group “Yonko Do” (meaning Oneness). The group operates on peer pressure principle where each member guarantees for each other to re-pay the loan.

loans.use: To buy rice, vegetable oil, and soap to sell

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa A. is an unmarried mother of three children living in Offinsu, Ghana. For the past eight years, Adwoa has earned a living by selling clothes, bags, shoes, and T shirts. She typically "hawks," or carries the products on top of her head, in the neighboring towns and communities.

She has applied for a loan of $1,025 U.S. dollars so she can buy more inventory from the neighboring country of Togo, where it's cheaper. Adwoa is a member of the group called “Yonko Do," which means Oneness. Members of the group guarantee for each other to re-pay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more jeans, bags, and clothes to sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is mother of six children living in Offinsu, Ghana. She earns a living by selling cosmetics, such as body lotion, hair pomade, perfums, and soap. With her earnings, she has been able to send three of her children to trade school so that they will have future profession. Her other children are currently in school.

Ama has applied for a loan of $925 U.S. dollars to purchase more products so she can increase her sales. She hopes to one day be able to rent a store, so she will no longer have to carry the loads on her head. With the additional profits, she hopes to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy more body lotions, hair relaxers, soaps, perfumes, etc.

loans.name: Zendia B 2009-2 Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Rakele K.. She is currently in the business of selling breads and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Rakele is a 30-year-old married woman. Her husband is a teacher. They have 2 children ranging from age 1 to 16 and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build houses.

Josphine P., Juslian D., Mary M., and Leya F. join Rakele in her small group. Josphine P. has a business selling charcoal and wants to expand the business. Juslian D. is currently operating a business selling charcoal and wants a loan to expand the business. Mary M. operates a business selling charcoal and wants to expand her business. Leya F. is currently in the business of selling cakes and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: Expand the business

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.ru:
Hanifa N. lives in the town of Vahdat. She is 60 years old, a widow with seven children. She has an incomplete secondary education and is in the animal husbandry business. She buys calves on the market at a lower price, feeds them and resells on the market later. Hanifa's husband has passed away and she has to take care of the whole family by herself. Animal husbandry is the main source of income for her family. She plans to use the loan to buy another calf. She will pay off the loan within 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Нурова Ханифа жительница города Вахдат. Возраст клиенки 60 лет. Вдова, имеет 7 детей. Образование неполное среднее. Клиентка занимается животноводством.Она покупает бычков по низкой цене , откармливает их и перепродает на рынке . У Ханифы умер муж и поэтому такую большую семью приходится содержать ей .Животноводство является основным источником дохода ее семьи.На кредит клиентка планирует купить очередного бычка для откормки. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 9 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George O. is a married father of four children in Offinsu, Ghana. For the past six, George has sold groceries to support his family. For a while, his business wasn't doing well, but a previous loan turned it around. He's now earning a profit, which he is saving for his children's school fees. In the picture, he is standing in front of the store with his wife.

George has applied for a loan of $1025 U.S. dollars to buy more products for his customers. He is a member of the group called “Yonko Do” (translation: Oneness). The group works on peer pressure principle where each member pays his or her contribution of the loan amount.

loans.use: To buy milk, soft drinks, soap, and fish for a small grocery store

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en:
Mavis O. is a married mother of four children in Offinsu, Ghana. For the past two years, she has earned a living by selling groceries and charcoal. She uses the profits from her store on her children's school fees.

Mavis has applied for a loan of $625 U.S. dollars to purchase more rice and sugar. She also hopes to buy a refrigerator so she will be able to sell frozen foods. Mavis member of the group called “Yonko Do” (translation: oneness), which ensures that members re-pay their part of the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer, rice, and sugar for a small store

loans.name: Hai Gam D 2028-1 Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Cicilia F.. She is currently in the business of selling at a small shop and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Cicilia is 50 years old and is married with a husband who is a soldier in the wildlife. She has 8 children ranging from age 10 to 24 and her children go to school. Each week, Cicilia makes approximately 50 sudanese pounds in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

Cicilia is joined in her small group by Rose F., Hanan S., Mary A., and Joice L.. Rose F. has a business in selling charcoal and wants to expand the business. Hanan S. is currently operating a business in selling charcoal and wants a loan to expand the business. Mary A. operates a business of selling clothes and wants to expand her business. Joice L. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Kosyin Shg Group

texts.en:
Edwin is 32 years old, married, with three children .He operates a retail shop business that is located in Muhoroni, a suburb within Kisumu town. He has been operating this business for over three years. He started the business with a start up capital of Ksh 10,000, which he acquired through a loan from a microfinance institution. Currently, the business has a working capital of over Ksh 20,000.

The post election violence that rocked Kenya severely affected the western part of the country where his business is located. Forced to close down due to the violence, Edwin is now seeking a refinancing loan and an extension on his loan period in order to rebuild his business. His business is steadily picking up and he is working hard to maintain good customer relations with his key clients. He intends to expand his shop in a more stable environment in order to cushion the effects of any business shocks that might come up in future.

As group leader, he has displayed superior leadership qualities, able to sustain group cohesiveness throughout the crisis period. He particularly serves as a motivating force to the other group members, encouraging them to forge ahead with reconstruction and expansion of their businesses despite the chaos left by the crisis. He is very much aware that as the group leader he should demonstrate by example, ensuring that his business succeeds so that other group members can emulate.

loans.use: To refinance and expand businesses after the post election violence

payments.comment: Kosyin SHG has begun repaying its loan and has made a payment of $456.  It has now repaid 13% of its loan.

loans.name: Biljana

texts.en: Biljana, a 39 year old single mother, with two children ages 5 and 10, comes from Štrpci, a small village near the town Prnjavor. Biljana hopes to receive her first loan of $500 to buy cleaning and polishing products for her job. These tools are essential in helping her clean staircases and flats as best as she can.

loans.use: To buy cleaning and polishing products

loans.name: Gema

texts.en:
Gema K., age 54, is married and has 6 children (ages 30, 28, 26, 20, 18 and 14). Her business is a function hall, where she sells soft drinks and beer. She started the business 4 years ago. She works from 6am to 1am daily and is able to make a monthly profit of around $424.

In the past, Gema has taken out two previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase on business. She hopes for a new loan to buy chairs, tables, and empty crates for her business.

loans.use: To buy more chairs, tables, and empty crates for her business

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca M. is a mother of four children living in Offinsu, Ghana. For the past six years, Rebecca has sold kenkey (a traditional dumpling made of ground maize, or white corn) and fried fish to people in her village. She uses the profit to pay for her children's school fees.

Rebecca has applied for a loan of $825 U.S. dollars to buy more bags of fish and maize for the lean season so she can stay open all year round. What's more, she also wants to start rearing grasscutter, a leading source of "bushmeat," or wild game, in Ghana. It's a new business that the national Ministry of Food and Agriculture has promoting in small towns and villages to reduce poverty.

Rebecca a member of the group called “Yonko Do”. The group members guarantee that each other will re-pay her loan. Rebecca has also succesfully taken out one loan before, so she is confident that she wil be able to pay back this loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy more maize and fish for a food stall

loans.name: Creciendo Por La Union Group

texts.en:
Momsy is a vivacious 23-year-old who lives with her husband, Miguel, and their two children (ages: 6, 8). She has lived in Puerto Plata since she was a child and loves her country. Momsy sells used shoes and clothing out of a small addition to her home, and she works very long days trying to make enough money to support her family. She told us that her favorite foods are the most popular ones here in the DR: rice, beans, and meat. She hopes that one day she will have enough money to own her own home and business, and that her children will have a good life.

Most of the women in Batay la Union have moved here from Haiti, in search of more opportunity and a better life. A micro-loan is often times the only “break” they get in their lives, and it gives them a chance work hard and accomplish something on their own. On behalf of Esperanza, and this entire group of women, we want to thank you for your support!

loans.use: Purchase shoes and clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Mujeres Poderosas Group

texts.en:
Ana B. is a gracious 44-year-old woman who lives with her husband (36 years old) and her five children (ages: 25, 24, 22, 18, 6). She currently runs a small business out of her home selling clothes and shoes. During her free time she loves to go to her church or read her Bible. Her favorite foods are soup and beans, and her dream for the future is that she would one day have a large, beautiful store to sell her merchandise from.

This will be the first loan that this community of Maimon, Puerto Plata has applied for with Esperanza. For many of these women, credit has been a foreign concept and this is the first opportunity they have had to receive a loan. Maimon is located on the north coast of the Dominican Republic, where beautiful all-inclusive hotels and slums sit only minutes apart. It is our hope in Esperanza that this community will grow together throughout the next six months towards a better and sustainable future. On behalf of Esperanza and the women of Maimon, thank you for your support and generosity!

loans.use: Purchase shoes, sandals, jeans, khaki pants, T-shirts, dresses, skirts, blouses, collared shirts

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda J., age 40, is married and has four children (ages 22, 20, 17, and 13). She has a salon and a charcoal business which she started 3 years ago. She works from 6am to 9pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $121.

Matilda has taken out two previous loans from Tujijene Tanzania to start a charcoal business. She hopes for a new loan to open a stationery shop.

loans.use: to open a stationery store

loans.name: Amanda

texts.en: Amanda A. is a 42 year-old resident of the Fise community of Greater Accra with 4 children.  She has over 4 years of experience in the sale of traditional cloth, including those she imports from nearby Togo.  She would like to expand the inventory of  her shop in central Accra with a loan of $600 (8 months).

loans.use: Amanda would use the loan to expand the inventory of her business.

loans.name: Thersah

texts.en:
Thersah N. is a 46-year-old unmarried mother of seven children living in Offinsu, Ghana. For the past 20 years, Thersah has earned a living by selling kenkey (a traditional Ghanian food staple, similar to a dumpling, made of milled white corn) and fried fish to her community.

Thersah has applied for a loan of $825 U.S. dollars to expand her operation. She wishes to buy more bags of corn, fish, and tomatoes so she can stay open all year round. Thersah has successfully taken out one loan from Sinapi before; she used part of her extra profits to help send her daughter to a trade school.

Theresa is a member of the group called St. Anthony which uses the peer pressure principle on members to re-pay their part of the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase corn, tomatoes, and fish to sell

loans.name: Aminah Diana

texts.en: Diana is a 43 year-old married resident of Sapeman in the Greater Accra region of Ghana.  She has over 8 years of experience in the retail sales of used clothing and other cloth items such as curtains.  She is seeking a loan of $500 (8 months) so as to expand her business to serve the market in adjacent communities.

loans.use: Aminah would use the loan to expand her business to serve the market in the adjacent communities.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A. is a 65-year-old married mother of six and grandmother of five living in Offinsu, Ghana. For most of her life, Rose has farmed the land, but now her age and health prevents her from performing such hard labor. That's why she has applied for a loan of $725 U.S. dollars to purchase groceries, such as fresh yams, to sell. She also wants to rent a permanent store to protect her products from theft.

Rose is member of a group called St. Anthony. The group guarantees that each member pays off her loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase fresh yams, tin fish, carton of tomatoes, dried mud fish, onions, crates of eggs,etc.

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha A. is a 60-year-old married mother of six in Offinsu, Ghana. For the past three decades, she has earned a living and supported her children by selling scarves and cloths. Agatha travels to the nearby village of Kumasi to purchase these materials. She's requesting a loan of $675 U.S. dollars so she can buy in bulk and not have to make the journey to Kumasi as frequently. Agatha also hopes to save her profits, so she can rent a store one day; currently, she carries her goods on her head and walks through the village to sell them.

Agatha is a member of the group called St. Anthony. Members are accountable to each other in re-paying their loans, ensuring that every person will pay back the money they borrow.

loans.use: To purchase more cloth and scarves to sell

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara D. is the mother of two children living in Offinsu, Ghana. To support her family, she cooks rice and sells it in front her home. Sara is requesting a loan of $575 U.S. dollars to purchase more rice and a refrigerator, so she can begin selling water as well. With the increased profit, Sara plans on saving it to help pay for her children's education. 

Sara is a member of the trust group Nyame Nsa Wom (translation: God’s hands is in it).  The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loans.use: To buy rice and a refrigerator for a food stall

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria has been a member of the Communal Bank “Despertar” for 3 years, when she has learned how to take care of her customers, children, and husband.

Maria is married, 40 years old, and has 4 children. Together with her husband she sells clothing in a rented space near the Santa Clara market. Her merchandise is acquired in Lima and Huancayo.

Maria needs a loan of 3000 soles to invest in the purchase of sweaters, shirts, blouses, pants and jackets.

Her savings will be used to educate her children and to increase her capital. Maria has dreams of having a bigger business with multiple locations, improve her home, and enable her children to receive an education and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar hace 3 años, en su Banco Comunal aprendió a como atender a sus clientes, como tratar a sus hijos y esposo.

Maria es conviviente, tiene 40 años y 4 hijos, Maria junto a su esposo vende ropa en un local alquilado que está cerca del mercado Santa Clara, su mercadería es adquirida en la ciudad de Lima y Huancayo.

Maria necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de chompas, polos, blusas, pantalones y buzos.

Sus ahorros lo utilizará en la educación de sus hijos y para incrementar su capital. Los sueños de Maria son tener un negocio más grande con sucursales, mejorar su casa, que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.

loans.use: Maria needs a loan of 3000 soles to invest in the purchase of sweaters, shirts, blouses, pants and jackets

loans.name: Marivel

texts.es:
Marivel has been a member of the Communal Bank “Despertar” for 2 years. She became a member at the invitation of a friend, and during this time has learned to be punctual, supportive, and help herself and other members.

Marivel is married, is 23 years old, and has a 1 year old daughter. Marivel and her husband sell clothing in the 12 of April Market. Marivel says that they both have worked selling clothing and with the first loan from the Communal Bank she bought a dozen shirts, and this is how they grew their business little by little. Today they have 2 stands and sell clothing for children and men. Marivel anticipates also selling women’s clothing.

Marivel needs a loan of 3000 soles to buy pants, jackets, and women’s and men’s shirts.

Marivel dreams of building a big house and renting, having a store, finishing her studies in accounting and provide a good education for her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Marivel es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar hace 2 años, llegó a su Banco Comunal por invitación de una amiga, en este tiempo aprendió a ser puntual, solidaria y a ayudarse entre socias.

Marivel es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 1 hija de 1 año, Marivel junto a su esposo venden ropa en el mercado 12 de abril. Marivel cuenta que ambos trabajaban como vendedores en tiendas de ropa y con el primer préstamo que obtuvo del Banco Comunal compró una docena de polos, fue así que poco a poco fueron creciendo. Actualmente tienen 2 puestos y venden ropa para niños y caballeros, Marivel tiene proyectado vender ropa de mujeres.

Marivel necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones, casacas, polos para damas y polos para caballeros.

Los sueños de Marivel son construir una casa grande y alquilar, tener una galería, culminar sus estudios de contabilidad y brindar una buena educación a su hija.

loans.use: needs a loan of 3000 soles to buy pants, jackets, and women’s and men’s shirts

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda has been a member of the Despertar (“Awaken”) Community Bank for the last three years.

Hilda is married, is 38 years old and has 4 children. Hilda and her husband sell clothes in a rented store that they share with a friend who sells shoes. She buys her merchandise in the city of Lima. In addition, on Saturdays and Sundays her husband travels to the various markets in the Ayacucho region.

Hilda needs a loan of USD $1100 (3000 Soles) which will be invested in the purchase of slacks, jackets, polo shirts and sweaters of various designs.

Hilda dreams of buying a lot and building her own house, having her own capital, owning a store and educating her children.

Trnaslated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Hilda pertenece al Banco Comunal Despertar hace 3 años.

Hilda es casada, tiene 38 años y 4 hijos, Hilda junto a su esposo venden ropa en una tienda alquilada que comparte con otra amiga que vende calzados, su mercadería lo compra en la ciudad de Lima. Además su esposo los días sábados y domingos viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región de Ayacucho.

Hilda necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones, casacas, polos y chompas de distintos modelos.

Los sueños de Hilda son comprar un terreno y construir su casa, tener capital propio, una tienda y que sus hijos estudien.

loans.use: Hilda needs a loan of USD $1,100 which she will invest in the purchase of slacks, jackets, polo shirts and sweaters of various designs.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is the mother of seven children, two of whom are still in school. The other five children are finished and now working. Georgina has been selling jewelry since she was in the fifth grade and she has expanded her business over more than 20 years to include jewelry, rubber products, and plastic containers. She now wants to start selling cough medicines and other non-prescription drugs to her community. The loan will be used to buy these items in bulk. She wants to use the profits from her business to continue with the construction of a family house.

Georgina is a member of the trust group Nyame Nsa Wom (God’s Hands is in It). The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays her share of the loan. Her photo was taken at a group meeting in the village of Akom.

loans.use: To purchase over-the-counter medicines

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth was born in 1953, married with two children. She works hard and strives higher for herself and the family. With the death of her husband and first daughter, who was more like a sister, she was obliged to work very hard to carter for the second son. Her plans for her son could only be realized with more income which, triggered her to joined GHAPE.

With the loan she plans to do mixed farming and increase her business of cooked food. Her business especially with Koki beans provide the community with lunch and ceremonial food at a cheap cost. With the profit from this business she plans to buy a plot and build a house for herself and her son. She plans to pay the loan in 24 months. The first installment repayment shall be on the fourth month from the date of disbursement

loans.use: Purchase of food items such as koki beans and farm seedlings

loans.name: Rukaya

texts.en:
Rukaya is 30 years old and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. She has been selling groceries including canned fish, canned tomatoes, soft drinks, biscuits, pens and maize to her community members in Obuasi for the past six years.

Rukaya says her previous loan from Sinapi enabled her to add variety to her store's inventory and life is becoming more meaningful as she has started saving for her children’s school fees. She wants to use her loan to expand her store as it  is currently small and also to buy more inventory.

Rukaya is member of the group called “Nyame Nhyira” (meaning God’s Blessing). The group uses peer pressure on members to re-pay their part of the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize and expand her store.

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera is a proud mother of five children.  Her youngest, Gloria, is pictured here.  Two of her other children attend primary school.  When Vera was pregnant with Gloria, she left her trust group.  She is now rejoining the group and restarting her business.  She sells uncooked rice, palm oil, eggs, and tomatoes.   This loan will be used to rebuild her business.  She also wants to start saving again as she used her previous savings to help pay for her pregnancy.

Vera is a member of the trust group Yesu Mo (Thank God).  The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase rice, palm oil, eggs, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Jennet

texts.en:
Jennet L. is married with five children. Being a hard workingwoman, she is the breadwinner for the family. This is due to many challenges in life such as ill health, inadequate land for cultivation, poor harvest and the early marriage of the son.

She has being facing difficulties to provide for her children and grand children. As a result of these challenges, she saw GHAPE as a source of relief where she enrolled herself in 2001. She has successfully managed and repaid loans up to six times.

Given a new loan, she plans to buy piglets, fowl, groundnut and mixed farming. She will provide the community with planting groundnut seeds during this period of planting, which is one of the crops commonly grown in the North West.
