She is 42 years old, married, and has four children. Her husband is a chauffer with temporary employment; on his free days, he helps her with the business. La señora R., pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Las Rosas de Yungay, desde hace dos años se dedica a la venta de frutas en el mercado del distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

Con este préstamo de S/. 300.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará 3 cajas de lima, 2 cajas de mango, 2 cajas de manzana y 3 cajas de ciruela. Ella tiene 42 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos, su esposo es chofer y tiene trabajos eventuales, en sus días libres le apoya a su esposa en este negocio.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of fruits to sell at the local market.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda R. D. P. runs a family store selling spare motorcycle parts in the city of Pucallpa, in the Ucayali region of Peru. She opened the store six years ago with her husband. They have a great location on a main road connecting Pucallpa with the town of Yurmicucha.

Belinda is 51 years old with two children and is happily married. Before she opened the store, Belinda had a business renting motorcycles and scooters. She left the business because she was the victim of too many robberies and assaults. The change has been good, and she can now live more calmly.

A member of the community bank Las Abejitas, Belinda is requesting a loan of $1,100 to repay over four months. She will use the loan to restock the products she sells that are in low supply and or are popular.

loans.use: To restock products for her motorcycle parts store

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa S. G. has a business selling ingredients to bake bread in the city of Pucallpa, in the Ucayali region of Peru. She has a stand in the market Mercado Micaela Bastidas Number 4, where she sells eggs, grains, butter, and more.

Teresa is 69 years old and has four children. Her husband died eight years ago, and her children live in Lima. Without her business she would have nothing; it keeps her going. She used to have a general store, but she didn’t have the capital to keep it open after her husband died.

A member of the community bank Las Abejitas, Teresa is requesting a loan of $375 to repay over four months. She will use the loan to buy more frijol canario, frijol ucayalinio, panamito, frijol castilla, and maiz morado.

loans.use: To buy more bread-making ingredients to sell

loans.name: Merla

texts.en:
Merla R. P. sells chickens and roosters in the city of Pucallpa, in the Ucayali region of Peru. She wakes up at 4 a.m. to go buy live chickens and roosters and take them to sell at the Micaela Bastidas Market Number 4. There she rents a stand where she prepares the poultry to sell.

Merla is 55 years old and is a widow with six children. She works very hard and is happy she has been able to help her family. Her hard work helped send her children to school and rewarded her with greater independence and decision making in her family.

A member of the community bank Las Abejitas, Merla is requesting a loan of $725 to repay over four months. She will use the loan to invest in her business. She also owns some land and would some day like to raise her own poultry.

loans.use: To invest in her poultry-selling business

loans.name: Mirella

texts.en:
Mirella R. D. M. has a business selling bananas in the city of Pucallpa, in the Ucayali region of Peru. She rents a spot in the crowded Bellavista market, where she has sold her fruits for four years.

Mirella is 50 years old with three children, and she is happily married. She loves working and being able to help her family. Mirella loves sales and building relationships. She never had the opportunity to study, so her goal is to send all of her children to school so they can become professionals.

A member of the community bank Las Abejitas, Mirella is requesting a loan of $1,100 to repay over four months. She will use the loan to increase her daily stock of fruit to sell to the population of Pucallpa.

loans.use: To increase her daily stock of fruit to sell in the market

loans.name: Zoila Licinda

texts.en:
Zoila Licinda C. M. sells regional food in the city of Pucallpa, in the Ucayali region of Peru. She makes dishes such as juane, caldo, steak, and escaveche. She has many loyal clients that come to visit her stand in the Bellavista market. She also sells bananas and coal when she has enough capital.

Zoila is 45 years old, has six children, and is divorced. She works very hard, and four of her children still depend on her. She loves to cook and build relationships, and she has many loyal customers.

A member of the community bank Las Abejitas, Zoila is requesting a loan of $550 to repay over four months. She will use the loan to buy all the ingredients used to make her delicious meals.

loans.use: To buy all the ingredients used to make her delicious meals

loans.name: Avelina

texts.es:
Avelina’s biggest wish is to see her four children become successful professionals. That’s why she and her husband Meliton are focusing their efforts on buying and selling sheep skins and alpaca fibers. They have been selling these products for 20 years and through their hard work they have managed to build a small house for raising their family. Now that their children are entering college, they are facing higher costs and financial limits. Therefore they would like to increase their investment capital and expand their market. With this goal in mind, Avelina is turning to you to ask for a loan.

Translated by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer

El deseo más grande de Avelina es observar convertidos en profesionales de éxito a sus queridos 4 hijos, es por ello que junto a su esposo Meliton trata de poner su mayor empeño y prestancia en su noble labor de compra y venta de cuero de oveja y fibra de alpaca.Juntos vienen dedicándose a esta labor hace 20 años, gracias a su excelente desempeño han logrado construir su pequeño domicilio y brindarle tranquilidad a su familia, ahora que todos sus hijos se encuentran cursando estudios superiores tienen mayores gastos y limitaciones económicas, es por ello que tienen pensado aumentar su capital de inversión y expandir su mercado, con ese proyecto en mente recurre a ti para hacerte la petición de un préstamo.

loans.use: Injection of capital to offer more leather and alpaca fibers to support their family

loans.name: Milena

texts.en:
Milena R. D. R. owns on beautiful restaurant in the city of Pucallpa, department of Ucayali.  She started the business three years ago and now has many loyal customers.  Customers come to enjoy lunch, drink a beer, or eat dinner.  They enjoy the warm and contemporary environment.

Milena is a 49 years old widow with two children.  She decided to open the restaurant because she loves to cook food and proviD. a service she can be proud of.  She is creative and smart.  She used the internet to find and good design for her bar and came up for the theme of the atmosphere herself.  She works hard so she can send her youngest son to university and she has no one else to rely on.

A member of the community bank Las Abejitas, Milena is requesting a loan of s/1500 to repay over 4 months.  She will use the loan to buy rice, beer, oil, sugar, and condiments

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy rice, beer, oil, sugar, and condiments

loans.name: Brígida

texts.es:
Brígida has always proved to be very hard-working, dedicated and enterprising. Now that she and her husband Rogelio have established a family, she has decided to make clothes, a skill she learned from her parents and, with hard work and diligence, has continued to develop. Her work helps ensure the financial security and stability of her family and her three-year-old son Kevin. To generate additional income, Brígida has begun to sell wool. Through this work, along with making clothes, she and her family aim to improve their quality of life. Brígida would like to increase her working capital to be able to offer a greater number of products.

Translated by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Brígida siempre demostró ser una muchacha muy trabajadora, dedicada y emprendedora, ahora que acaba de formar su familia junto a su esposo Rogelio decidió dedicarse a la confección de prendas de vestir, labor que aprendió y heredó de sus queridos padres y que ahora con mucho empeño y diligencia vienen desarrollando eficientemente con el fin de brindarle seguridad y tranquilidad económica a su pequeño niño Kevin de 3 añitos de edad; del mismo modo para generar ingresos extras esta joven madre decidió dedicarse a la venta de leña, con estas dos actividades están buscando mejorar su calidad de vida.Su deseo es incrementar su capital de trabajo para ofertar en mayor volumen sus productos.

loans.use: Injection of capital to offer greater number of products

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma M. S. owns land where she plants various crops near the city of Pucallpa in the department of Ucayali.  On the land she plans to plant cilantro, peppers, corn, and sugar cain.  Irma has a lifetime of experience farming and harvesting in the Peruvian Amazon Basis.

Irma is 66 years old, has 4 children and is happily married.  She loves working and helping her family.  In the future she plans on investing in the business and increasing production.  The family currently only uses a small percentage of their land.

A member of the community bank Las Abejitas, Irma is requesting a loan of s/3000 to repay over 4 months.  She will use the loan to buy seeds to plant all of her future crops.

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy seeds to plant all of her future crops.

loans.name: Jhony

texts.es:
Jhony and her aunt Thania make the perfect team for making crafts and sewing. Both are originally from Arequipa, but currently live in Juliaca for academic and professional reasons. Since Jhony was a little girl, her aunt Thania has taught her this wonderful craft and, with lots of patience and diligence, has cultivated her talents. The two of them have decided to offer classes to anyone who wants to learn the art of crafts. Jhony is able to pay for her college studies doing this work and Thania uses the income to support her household. They both hope to continue making their beautiful and distinctive crafts. To to do this, they are applying for a loan which they will use to purchase the materials they require for their work. With the essential support you provide, Jhony and her aunt will continue on the road to progress.

Translated by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Jhony y su querida tía Thania son el equipo perfecto para las manualidades y la costura, ambas son naturales del departamento de Arequipa, por cuestiones de estudio y trabajo radican en la ciudad de Juliaca.Desde muy pequeña Jhony aprendió este bello oficio de su querida tía, quien con mucha paciencia y diligencia cultivó sus conocimientos en ella, y ahora ambas en sociedad decidieron ofrecer cursos de manualidades a todas aquellas personas que desean aprender este hermoso arte.Gracias a este trabajo Jhony logra cubrir satisfactoriamente los gastos de sus estudios superiores y por su parte su querida tía cubre plenamente las necesidades de su hogar.El deseo de ambas es seguir realizando sus hermosos y distintivos trabajos, es por ello que solicitan un préstamo que invertirán en la compra de indispensables materiales para su trabajo.Con tu imprescindible apoyo Jhony y su querida tía seguirán por el camino del progreso.

loans.use: Purchase of greater number of raw materials to continue craftmaking and sewing

loans.name: Vicki

texts.es:
Vicki is a happy mother with a generous heart. Despite her economic condition she has always tried to help her family get ahead and improve their quality of life. She is originally from Cuzco but for family reasons now lives in Juliaca. Since she moved to Juliaca she has worked as a vendor of seasonal items. A few months ago Vicki started selling wholesale Christmas cards and postcards. She is very proud and satisfied with her success. During the coming school year she would like to sell books to students in primary and secondary schools. She is sure she can achieve her goal with hard work and dedication.

Translated by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Vicki, es una alegre madre con un generoso corazón, pese a su condición económica siempre trata de apoyar a los suyos a salir adelante y mejorar su condición de vida. Ella es natural del departamento de Cuzco y por cuestiones familiares radica en la ciudad de Juliaca, desde que vive en dicha ciudad se dedica a la venta de artículos por campañas y hace algunos meses atrás se ha dedicado a la venta de tarjetas y postales navideñas al por mayor, se siente muy orgullosa y contenta por los resultados que ha obtenido con su desempeño.Ahora por esta temporada escolar desea ofertar libros para estudiantes de nivel primario y secundario, está segura que con voluntad y mucha dedicación conseguirá su propósito.

loans.use: Injection of capital to sell books in the school fair

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja is from the district of Vilquechico. She has always proved to be a courageous woman who is determined to get ahead. Since her husband’s death, she has looked for work that will help her and her 4 children get ahead. Currently she sells ropes and bags and, with tremendous hard work and persistence, has managed to build a small house in Juliaca, where she and her family have been living for 4 years. A dedicated mother, Maruja sells her goods in the San Jose market in Juliaca and at fairs in her region. Her biggest wish is to see her children become successful professionals. Recognizing the need for resources to achieve this goal, she decided to increase the variety of her merchandise and is turning to you for this loan.

Translated by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Maruja, es natural del distrito de Vilquechico, y siempre ha demostrado ser una mujer con mucho coraje y empeño para salir adelante, desde que su querido esposo falleció sólo tuvo en mente la búsqueda de alguna actividad para salir adelante junto a sus 4 hijos. Actualmente con su negocio de compra y venta de sogas y bolsas, con mucho empeño y constancia ha logrado construir su pequeña y humilde vivienda en la ciudad de Juliaca, lugar donde radica hace 4 años en compañía de su familia.Ésta empeñosa madre ofrece sus productos en el mercado San José de la ciudad de Juliaca y en las ferias de los distintos distrito de su localidad; el deseo más grande que tiene es ver convertidos en profesionales de éxito a sus hijos.En esta oportunidad viendo la necesidad económica de su familia decidió aumentar la variedad de su mercadería, con ese propósito recurre a vosotros.

loans.use: Injection of capital to offer a greater number of goods

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Selling food from her cart has become the greatest source of income for Luzmila’s family. A dependable, diligent and dedicated mother, Luzmila has found, through her work, the means to pay for her household needs. In addition to her day-to-day chores, she gets up early in the morning to sell polos and sweatshirts at the San Jose market in Juliaca. At noon she prepares her delicious vegetable stews which she sells to the merchants at the market. With income from these two business activities she is able to cover her household expenses. She would like to add seats, tables and umbrellas to her food cart to make her customers more comfortable. As such, she is turning to you and applying for this loan.

Translated by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer

La venta de comida en forma ambulatoria se ha convertido en el ingreso económico más importante de la familia de Doña Luzmila, madre empeñosa diligente y muy dedicada, encontró en este noble oficio la manera de cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar.Esta diligente madre adicionalmente a su desempeño diario desde tempranas horas de la mañana se dedica a la venta de polos y polares al por mayor dentro del mercado San José de la ciudad de Juliaca y al medio día prepara sus deliciosos potajes para venderlos a los comerciantes de dicho mercado.Con estas 2 actividades está logrando cubrir satisfactoriamente las necesidades de su hogar, y también ahora desea brindarles comodidad a sus clientes, para ello tiene pensado comprar sillas, mesas y sombrillas, con ese propósito recurre a tu buen corazón y te hace la petición de un préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of chairs, tables and umbrellas

loans.name: Maisa

texts.es:
Maisa is a very pleasant and persevering 23 year old woman. Originally from the town of Cuzco, she has lived in the city of Juliaca for the last two years. She finished secondary school and immediately sought to work to earn her own income and to pay for her higher qualifications. After saving enough money, she decided to open a small soft drinks outlet as the space available for this purpose was located in a very strategic and commercial city of Juliaca.

The desire of this young woman is to increase the stock of her merchandise, with the aim of substantially increasing her sales and to continue her current business.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Maisa, es una muchacha muy alegre y perseverante de 23 años de edad, natural del departamento de Cuzco, hace 2 años radica en al ciudad de Juliaca, terminó sus estudios secundarios e inmediatamente buscó trabajar para generar sus propios ingresos y así lograr cubrir sus estudios superiores, luego de reunir una buena cantidad de dinero decidió abrir una pequeña tiende de bebidas gaseosas y refrescos, ya que el espacio que disponía para este fin se encontraba ubicada en un lugar estratégico y muy comercial de la ciudad de Juliaca. El deseo de esta empeñosa muchacha es aumentar el stock de su mercadería, con el fin de incrementar sustancialmente sus ventas y poder mantener activo su negocio.

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase stock and to offer a greater variety of soft drinks

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Mr. G. is a client of LEON 2000 who has already received 4 loans and with this opportunity he will he will increase the products that he offers to give his community better service. When he received his first loan he sold general merchandise in a limited way and with the loan he was able to expand his business and to establish a grocery store in his home.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

El sr. G. es un cliente deLEON 2000 que ha sido financiado anteriormente con 4 prestamos y en esta oportunidad el ampliara la oferta de productos para brindar un mejor servicio a la comunidad, en su primer credito el tenia la venta de mercaderia en general de forma limitada y ha logrado ampliar su negocio asi como establecer en su casa un negocio de pulperia

loans.use: Purchase of basic grains and cosmetics

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy is a very affectionate and responsible granddaughter. Since childhood, she has always sought ways to earn her own income and to contribute to the cost of running her family’s humble home. She is currently pursuing her higher education and to pay her own way, she decided to engage in various business activities such as selling cosmetics and beauty products, cellular phones, children’s overcoats, and woollen ponchos, that in many cases she weaves herself with great patience and creativity. With all these activities she is achieving her aims and above all she provides peace and well being to her grandparents who always supported and looked after her.

Nancy’s desire is to have more capital to invest in her business selling cosmetics and beauty products; a desire that relies on the goodness of your heart.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Nancy, es una nieta muy cariñosa y responsable, desde pequeña siempre ha buscado la manera de generar sus propios ingresos económicos y aportar con los gastos de su humilde hogar, actualmente viene cursando estudios superiores y para cubrir sus gastos decidió dedicarse a diversas actividades tales como: la venta de cosméticos de belleza, celulares, abrigos para niños y ponchos de lana que en muchos casos los teje personalmente con suma paciencia y creatividad.Con estas labores está logrando su propósito y sobre todo está brindándoles tranquilidad y bienestar a sus queridos abuelitos quienes son las personas que siempre la apoyaron y velaron por ella.El deseo de Nancy es contar con mayor capital para invertir en su negocio venta de cosméticos de belleza, con ese plan recurre a tu solidario corazón.

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase stock and to offer a greater variety of beauty products

loans.name: Ricardina

texts.es:
Ricardina is a very affectionate and loving mother and despite her advanced age she is still eager to improve her beloved family’s quality of life. Since her husband’s death, Ricardina has been both a mother and a father to her children. She has worked tirelessly to ensure they do not suffer financially. Now that the children are older and independent she feels very proud, happy, and fulfilled as a mother.

With persistence and single-mindedness, Ricardina has succeeded in building a small house in one of the new housing estates in the city of Juliaca, within which she has also adapted an area to open her own small grocery store. Ricardina wishes to complete the fitting of her her small shop and to increase its stock.

She believes that this investment will help her achieve higher income from her small shop and proviD. her with better security and peace of mind.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Ricardina es una madre muy cariñosa y amorosa, pese a su avanzada edad sigue deseosa D. mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su amada familia; desD. que su esposo falleció ha desempeñado las funciones D. padre y madre para sus hijos, trabajando incansablemente para que no pasen limitaciones económicas, ahora que ya son independientes se siente muy orgullosa, feliz y realizada como madre.Actualmente con mucho empeño y firmeza logró construir su casita en una D. las urbanizaciones nuevas D. la ciudad D. Juliaca, lugar donD. también adecuó un espacio para abrir su bodeguita. El deseo D. Ricardina es terminar D. implementar y aumentar el stock D. su tiendita, considera que haciendo esta inversión logrará obtener mayores ingresos económicos y se sentirá mucho más tranquila y segura.

loans.use: Capital injection to increase the number of items for sale in her new and small grocery store

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa is a woman who, with great tenacity and effort, is succeeding in improving her standard of living. Financial and family problems prevented Luisa from completing her high school education but she found ways of improving her family situation. She is a dedicated woman and from early in the morning she is busy preparing delicious stews to sell as a street vendor in one of the busiest streets in the city of Juliaca. As soon as this finishes, she heads for one of the passenger terminals in her city to sell bus tickets to Arequipa and Cuzco. She earns a commission for every ticket she sells. Both activities provide indispensable income for her family.

Luisa plans to purchase the basic ingredients for her stews in larger quantities and at wholesale prices as this would increase her profit margin. With your generous heart she can succeed in her plan.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Luisa, es una mujer que con mucho tesón y esfuerzo está logrando mejorar su condición de vida, por problemas familiares y económicos no logró concluir sus estudios superiores pero si encontró la manera de mejorar su situación familiar.Esta empeñosa mujer desde tempranas horas de la mañana se dedica a preparar deliciosos potajes para venderlos en forma ambulatoria en una de las avenidas más concurridas de la ciudad de Juliaca, luego de concluir con este negocio inmediatamente se dirige a uno de los terminales ínterdepartamentales de su ciudad para ofrecer boletos hacia los departamentos de Arequipa y Cuzco, por cada boleto vendido logra obtener un determinado porcentaje de ganancias, ambas actividades le otorgan ingresos indispensables para sus gastos familiares.El deseo de Raquel es comprar insumos de primera necesidad, considera que adquiriendo estos productos al por mayor la preparación de sus potajes le resultará mucho más económico.Con tu generoso corazón podrá concretar sus proyectos.

loans.use: Purchase of non-perishable items in larger quantities to continue preparing her delicious stews.

loans.name: "costeñitas Ii" Group

texts.es:
The Villa Adela zone is the primary focus area of Pro Mujer, to which the group “Costeñitas II” belongs. It is comprised of a lovely collection of women who, along with Ruth Gutierrez their credit assistant, work hard to make their businesses a success. They are pleased because they have an opportunity to qualify for investments as well as loan funds that are offered through this entity. A majority of the members are married and have an average of five children. Some, like Mrs. Malena, cannot count on any help from a partner/spouse. She was abandoned by her husband, leaving her as sole provider for their four minor children who do their best to help their mother while she works as a street vendor selling fruit. There is a variety of activities within the group. We were able to observe that commerce/sales is the primary enterprise and the members sell clothes, in-season fruits, food, tableware, school supplies and other items. Some offer their products at retail from fixed locations, and others work as street vendors. It is certain that with additional capital they would be able to buy their merchandise at wholesale. This would allow them to obtain greater profits which would, in turn, help their small businesses to prosper and provide a higher standard of living for their families.

Note: There are some camera-shy members within the organization, which is why they are not very visible in the photograph.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

EN LA ZONA DE VILLA ADELA FUNCIONA EL CENTRO FOCAL DEL MISMO DE NOMBRE DE PRO-MUJER, A ESTE PRETENECE LA ASOCIACION "COSTEÑITAS II" UN LINDO GRUPO DE SEÑORAS QUE CON LA AYUDA DE SU ASISTENTE DE CREDITOS RUTH GUTIERREZ TRABAJAN INTENSAMENTE PARA QUE SUS NEGOCIOS PROSPEREN. ADEMAS ELLAS ESTAN MUY CONTENTAS PORQUE TIENEN LA OPORTUNIDAD DE CAPACITARSE SOBRE INVERSIONES ADEMAS DE OBTENER LOS CREDITOS QUE LA ENTIDAD OFRECE. EN EL GRUPO LA MAYORIA SON CASADAS CON UN PROMEDIO DE 5 HIJOS, ALGUNAS DE ELLAS NO CUENTAN CON LA AYUDA DE SU PAREJA, POR EJEMPLO A DOÑA MALENA SU ESPOSO LA ABANDONO, TENIENDO ELLA QUE HACERSE CARGO DE SUS CUATRO HIJOS MENORES DE EDAD, LOS CUALES INTENTAN AYUDAR A SU MAMA EN LA VENTA DE FRUTAS DE MANERA AMBULANTE. EXISTEN DISTINTOS TIPOS DE ACTIVIDADES DENTRO DEL GRUPO,PUDIMOS OBSERVAR QUE EL COMERCIO ES LA ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL, ELLAS OFRECEN LA VENTA DE ROPA, FRUTAS DE LA TEMPORADA, COMIDA, VAJILLAS, MATERIAL ESCOLAR Y OTROS ENCERES. PRODUCTOS QUE LOS OFRECEN AL POR MENOR ALGUNAS EN PUESTOS FIJOS COMO TAMBIEN DE FORMA AMBULANTE. TIENEN LA CERTEZA QUE CON UN MAYOR CAPITAL PODRIAN COMPRAR ESTOS PRODUCTOS AL POR MAYOR PARA ASI OBTENER UNA MAYOR GANANCIA Y DE ESTA FORMA PROSPEREN SUS PEQUEÑOS NEGOCIOS PARA BRINDAR A SUS FAMILIAS UNA MEJOR FORMA DE VIDA. NOTA -->:DENTRO LA ASOCIACION EXISTEN ALGUNAS PERSONAS UN POCO TIMIDAS A LAS CAMARAS. MOTIVO POR EL CUAL NO ESTAN MUY VISIBLES.

loans.use: With additional capital, they would be able to buy their merchandise at wholesale and obtain greater profits.

loans.name: Hilario

texts.es:
Since leaving his hometown of Cuzco with his beloved parents as a teenager to live in the city of Juliaca, Hilario and his parents had been engaged in various activities to support themselves financially. But despite their great efforts their income continued to be inadequate. Using their initiative, they decided to begin making clothes hangers. Initially they did not put much emphasis on this work because it did not generate sufficient income. But gradually, as they decided to make the hangers in larger quantities and distribute them wholesale, the situation improved.

Hilario has his own family now and is the father of two small children, whom he adores and are his motivation. That is why this enterprising father plans to produce a variety of clothes hangers in different sizes and models. With your important contribution, his plans would be realized.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Desde adolescente Hilario y sus queridos padres decidieron salir de su ciudad natal, Cuzco, para radicar en la ciudad de Juliaca, desde que viven en dicha ciudad se han dedicado a diversas actividades para cubrir sus gastos familiares pero aún con mucho esfuerzo seguía siendo insuficiente, es así que con mucha creatividad y habilidad han ido fabricando colgadores para ropas, en un principio no le dieron mucha importancia a esta labor porque no les generaba ingresos económicos sustanciales pero poco a poco conforme fabricaban en mayores cantidades y los distribuían al por mayor las cosas fueron cambiando.Actualmente Hilario ya formó su propia familia y es padre de 2 pequeños niños, quienes son su mayor adoración y el motivo de su esfuerzo, es por ello que este emprendedor padre tiene pensado seguir fabricando variedad de colgadores y en diversos modelos y tamaños.Con tu importante aporte obtendrá concretar sus planes

loans.use: Capital injection to purchase larger quantities of raw materials for making finished products

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo was trained as a mechanic in a public institute in the city of Juliaca. For the last ten years, he has been providing his mechanical repair services to the people of the town of Juliaqueña. Initially, he began working from premises not entirely suitable. Now, thanks to his skill, knowledge, ability, and excellent service, Hugo’s customers have trebled and his workshop has become one of the busiest workshops in town. He has expanded his premises and has hired more staff.

To continue to offer his customers excellent service, Hugo is in urgent need of reconditioning his equipment. Through his efforts and diligence, this enterprising father has maintained his beloved wife and son financially and they fully support him in his activities.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Desde hace 10 años el señor Hugo, se dedica a brindar sus servicios de mecánico a la población Juliaqueña, Hugo estudió la carrera técnica de mecánica de producción en un instituto público de la ciudad de Juliaca, ahora gracias a su destreza, conocimientos y habilidad está logrando obtener más clientes.En principio inició su labor en un local no muy apropiado, pero conforme brindaba un buen servicio sus clientes fueron triplicándose y se vio en la necesidad de ampliar su local y contratar a más personal, actualmente es uno de los talleres más solicitados de esta localidad, es por ello se ve en la urgente necesidad de renovar sus herramientas de trabajo con el fin de continuar brindando a sus clientes un servicio de alta calidad.Este emprendedor padre con su esfuerzo y diligencia está logrando también mantener sin limitaciones económicas a su querida esposa e hijo quienes no dudan en apoyarlo en la actividad que realiza.

loans.use: Reconditioning of Workshop Tools and Equipment

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma is 24-year-old, very happy and persistent young lady. Despite her young age, Norma is already the owner of a cap making studio. It has been six years since Norma with the support of her parents, undertook this business. During this time she managed to transform her studio into a big factory. Norma has already entered the markets of the cities of Arequipa, Cuzco and Puno, and her goal is to expand her business activity to other locations and provide people with the opportunity of a job. With this purpose in mind, Norma hopes that you help her to obtain the quantity that she is requesting.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer.

Norma es una muchachita muy alegre y perseverante de 24 años, a pesar de su corta edad ya es propietaria de un taller de confección de gorros, ella con el apoyo de sus padres emprendió este negocio hace 6 años, en ese tiempo logró implementar poco a poco su taller hasta convertirla en una gran fábrica de confección de gorras.. Actualmente ya incursionaron en el mercado de las ciudades de Arequipa, Cuzco y Puno, el deseo que tiene es ampliar su taller y darles una oportunidad de trabajo a otros muchachos que se encuentran desocupados, con ese propósito en mente reúne sus esperanzas en vosotros para obtener la cantidad que solicita.

loans.use: To obtain captial in order to expand business activities to other locations

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty is a woman that in every moment is concerned with the welfare and education of her 3 beloved children. She has always shown to be a mother with a lot of perseverance and will to work. Since the divorced with her husband, she worked in innumerable jobs in order to cover the needs she had at home. Currently, Betty lives with her children in a rented residence, where she decided to designate small space to sell a variety of beverages. This business activity has helped Betty generate additional income, and is because of this that she is thinking about expanding the business. Your contribution will help Betty provide a better future for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer.

Betty es una mujer que en todo momento veló por el bienestar y educación de sus 3 queridos hijos, siempre ha demostrado ser una madre con mucha voluntad de trabajo y perseverancia, desde que se divorció de su esposo trabajó en innumerables labores para ganarse el pan de cada día y cubrir las necesidades de su hogar.Actualmente vive junto a sus hijos en un domicilio alquilado, lugar en donde decidió adecuar un pequeño espacio para vender variedad de bebidas, este negocio le viene generando buenos ingresos económicos, es por ello que tiene pensado ampliar su negocio, con ese proyecto en mente toca tu buen corazón para que le brindes la oportunidad de salir adelante junto a sus queridos hijos.

loans.use: To increase business space in order to service more customers

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
In one of the most concurred avenues of the city of Juliaca we find a very happy and laborious lady named Roxana, a 33-year-old, offering departmental transport service tickets to the population of her city. Roxana is a young lady who has a very low income, but this fact has not discourage her to succeed in life and to try to do well next to her elderly parents. Besides offering transportation tickets, Roxana has a small store selling basic supplies and groceries. Roxana’s mother takes care of the store while she works during the day. Roxana would like to purchase more merchandise in order to expand her business and increase her profits and in this manner offer her parents a better living. "Your important contribution will help Roxana attain her goals."

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer.

En una de las avenidas más concurridas de la ciudad de Juliaca encontramos muy contenta y afanosa a Roxana de 33 años de edad, ofreciendo sus boletos de servicio de transporte departamental a la población de su ciudad.Roxana es una joven de bajos recursos económicos, pero este hecho no la amilanó para esforzarse en la vida y tratar de salir adelante junto a sus ancianos padres, ahora adicionalmente de ofrecer boletos de transporte tiene una pequeña tienda de insumos de primera necesidad, tiendita que atiende su querida madre mientras Roxana desde tempranas horas de la mañana se va a ofrecer los boletos.El deseo de Roxana es aumentar el stock de mercadería de su bodeguita con el fin de obtener mayores beneficios económicos para ofrecerles tranquilidad y seguridad a sus queridos padres.“Vuestra importante colaboración concretará los anhelos de Roxana”

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase textiles and fabrics

loans.name: Alma Delia

texts.es:
Alma Hernández was preoccupied by his family's financial difficulty. She decided to increase her income since two of her three children are at college. She resolved to set up a home business and started selling various gift items. Subsequently, she rented a space to sell her goods and was able to increase sales. It has been 5 years she has started her business.

Now, she seeks a loan of $475 which she will repay in 6 months so she can continue to buy inventory and offer a variety of products to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Alma Hernández preocupada por la situación económica de su familia y decidida a aumentar las entradas de dinero, debido a que dos de sus tres hijos estaban en la universidad resolvió poner un negocio en la sala de su casa. Empezó vendiendo regalitos, posteriormente rento un local y surtió con artículos de papelería aumentando las ventas del negocio todo esto principió hace 5 años,

Ahora solicita un apoyo económico por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para seguir comprar mercancía y ofrecer más variedad de productos a sus clientes.

loans.use: to buy inventory

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa María H. is married to Francisco de la Isla Márquez, an independent mason, and they have 4 children ages 10, 11, 15 and 16 years old. 3 years ago Rosa began her business due to the lack of money as her husband’s job does not provide a steady income. She began her business when she realized that around her house there was not a candy store and there were many children. So she decided to start a business herself with only a table and a few candies, putting the table outside of her home because many children passed by on their way to school.

Now she needs a loan for US$250 which will be repaid in 6 months, to purchase merchandise such as drinks and frozen products in addition to increasing the variety of candy.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa María H. esta casada con Francisco de la Isla Márquez quien es albañil, y trabaja de manera independiente, ellos tienen 4 hijos de 10, 11, 15 y 16 años, hace 3 años Rosa inicio el negocio debido a la falta de dinero ya que el trabajo de su marido no los provee de un sueldo seguro, ella empezó su negocio cuando se dio cuenta que por su casa no hay dulcerías y hay muchos niños, así que decidió emprender un negocio inicio solo con una mesa y pocos dulces, la mesa la coloco afuera de su casa porque por ahí pasan muchos niños que van a la escuela.

Ahora requiere un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía como bebidas y productos congelados además de incrementar la variedad de dulces.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocío S. is an enterprising woman and unmarried. She began her business 10 years ago after much effort in buying her home and seeing that the income she earned at the hospital wasn’t enough to pay her household expenses so she decided to sell medical equipment.

Now she needs a loan for US$1125, which will be repaid in 6 months, to buy medical materials that will enable her to increase her services to her patients. With your support Rocío will be able to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Rocío S. es una mujer emprendedora es soltera y empezó su negocio hace 10 años, después de que con mucho esfuerzo logro comprar su casa y vio que el ingreso que recibía en el hospital era insuficiente para solventar sus gastos familiares por lo que se dedico a la venta de equipo medico.

Ahora requiere un crédito por US $ 1125 que pagara en 6 meses para la compra de material medico lo que le permitirá aumentar el servicio a sus pacientes. Con tu apoyo Rocío podrá hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase medical equipment

loans.name: Nohemi

texts.es:
Nohemí Ramírez buys and sells shoes by catalog. She is married and her husband works as a laborer in a business. They have four children ages 10, 8, 5 and 2. She began her business five years ago, as her husband’s wages were low so she began the business to increase their household income. She obtained a loan to buy the catalogs and she began to sell to her friends.

Now she needs a loan for US$250, which will be repaid in 6 months, to buy merchandise and complete her waiting orders. Let’s help Nohemí so that she may be able to continue to economically support her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Nohemí Ramírez se dedica a la compra y venta de zapatos por catalogo, es casada su esposo trabaja como obrero en una empresa y tienen 4 hijos de 10, 8,5 y 2 años empezó el negocio hace cinco años, debido a que el sueldo de su esposo es bajo entonces ella empezó el negocio para aumentar los ingresos del hogar consiguió un préstamo para comprar los catálogos y empezó a vender entre sus amistades.

Ahora necesita un apoyo económico por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y surtir pedidos pendientes. Ayudemos a Nohemí para que siga apoyando económicamente a su esposo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
Leticia N. is an enterprising woman, married to Alejandro Domínguez Córdoba. They have 2 children, ages 9 and 10. She began her business 5 years ago, selling shoes by catalog to her friends and acquaintances. The motivation behind her business was the need to have additional income to meet her household expenses.

Today she needs a loan of US$250, which will be repaid in 6 months, as she has many orders to fill and with this money she will buy the shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Leticia N. es una mujer emprendedora esta casada con Alejandro Domínguez Córdoba quien trabaja como minero tienen 2 hijos de 9 y 10 años. Su negocio lo empezó hace cinco años vendiendo zapatos por catalogo a sus familiares. Su principal motivación fue la necesidad fue tener ingresos adicionales para los gastos de su casa.

Actualmente requiere un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses tengo muchos pedidos para surtir y con ese dinero comprare los zapatos.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina P. is married to Victor Manuel fajardo carreo who is in the business of buying and selling cattle. She has children whom are 9 and 11 years old. He started his business 15 years ago, and is known for selling clothes and shoes. Currently, her husband does not have a job and she has started a business to help her husband and to pay the bills of her family.

She needs a loan of $250 to pay back in 6 months in order to buy spring-summer clothing. She will use this loan to help support her family.

This story has been translated from Spanish to English by Nikita Ramchandani, KIVA Volunteer.

Josefina P. esta casada con Víctor Manuel fajardo carrero quien se dedica a la compra y venta ganado, tiene dos hijos de 9 y 11 años. Su negocio comenzó hace 15 años, ya que conoció a una persona que le dejo en consignación ropa y zapatos en ese momento su esposo no tenia trabajo y empezó con el negocio para ayudarle a su esposo movida por la necesidad de solventar los gastos de su familia.

Ella requiere un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar ropa de temporada primavera-verano. Con este crédito ella podrá seguir apoyando a su familia.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria Luisa is a single mother of a four year old son. She needed to increase her income without neglecting her child who was very small. She did not have a job that provided for childcare and could not pay a private party nor had anyone that could take care of him. That is when she started to sell lingerie on her own. She started in 2004. Her friend was doing the same and shared with her the information of the stores where she could purchase inventory in Guadalajara. She started her business selling to her neighbors. Thanks to this she has been able to cover the costs of her little one.

She now needs financial help of USD $575 which she will repay in six months, to update her inventory and purchase merchandise of the season. With your help Luisa will be able to give her son a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Ma Luisa es madre soltera de un niño de 4 años debido a esto necesitaba incrementar sus ingresos sin descuidar a su hijo quien estaba muy pequeño y no tenia trabajo que pudiera darle el beneficio de guardería ya que ella no podía pagar una privada y tampoco quien se lo cuidara, fue entonces que empezó a vender por su cuenta lencería inicio en el 2004 , una conocida vendía lo mismo, y le paso los datos de las tiendas en donde podía compra en Guadalajara, y empezó el negocio vendiendo a sus vecinas. Gracias a esto ha podido solventar los gastos de su pequeño.

Ahora requiere un apoyo económico por US $575 que esta dispuesta a pagar en 6 meses para renovar el inventario y comprar mercancía de temporada. Con tu contribución luisa podrá darle mejor calidad de vida a su hijo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Claudia Gabriela

texts.es:
Claudia Gabriela E. is married to Jose Enrique Betancourt Garcia who works at a local company. They have a three year old son. She has a business selling traditional sweets. She started it two years ago with the help of her mother in law and her father. She operates in a space that belongs to her mother in law and her father gave her the initial capital to start the business. Due to her hard work and dedication the business has prospered.

She now need a loan of USD $250 which she will repay in six months, to buy merchandise since the upcoming holidays are a good time for sweets vendors

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Claudia Gabriela E. esta casada con José Enrique Betancourt García quien se desempeña como empleado en una empresa de la localidad, son padres de un niño de 3 años, tiene un negocio de venta de dulces típicos lo inicio hace 2 años, con la ayuda de su suegra y su papa; en un local que su suegra le presto y su papa le facilito el capital inicial para arrancar el negocio. Debido a su empeño y dedicación el negocio ha prosperado mucho.

Ahora ella requiere un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para comprara mercancía ya que para los dulceros las fechas que se aproximan son buena temporada para las ventas

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Elena T. is a widow. She started her business because she could not cover the expenses of her home with the pension income from her husband. She could not even cover the basic costs because the pension was not enough. She decided to get into something that would suit her age and increase her financial income, that is how, eight years ago, she started selling food from a cart outside of a school. Later she rented a small space and that is where she is currently operating.

She needs a financial boost of USD $750 that she will repay in six months, to buy furniture since she needs tables, chairs and benches to improve her service to her customers. With your help, Elena will continue moving forward.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Elena T. es un mujer viuda, emprendió su negocio porque no alcanzaba a pagar los gastos de su hogar con el dinero de la pensión de su esposo, ni siquiera podían cubrir lo básico, debido a que la pensión es insuficiente, decidió ocuparse en algo acorde a su edad que le permitiera aumentar los ingresos económicos fue así como hace 8 años inicio vendiendo en un carrito de comida afuera de una escuela, después rento un local pequeño y ahí es donde opera actualmente su negocio.

Ella requiere un apoyo económico por US $750 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mobiliario ya que le hacen falta mesas, sillas y bancas para aumentar el servicio a su clientela. Con tu ayuda Elena podrá seguir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase furniture

loans.name: Riwruok Eteko Youth Group

texts.en:
Kennedy’s business entails buying molasses in bulk and retailing the same for profit. He came up with this idea after realizing that molasses was readily available due to availability of a sugar industry in his area and he could make use of this opportunity to create a molasses business for a living to support his family. He is the sole provider for his family and this business is the one that has supported his family for over 5 years now. He is married with 4 children.

His business location is in a suburb town within Kisumu city called Muhoroni. There is a sugar factory called Muhoroni Sugar Factory from which he gets his molasses. His business is unique in that there are few people in the area who thought of establishing a business like his. The interruptions that occurred to his business due to the post-election violence slightly affected his supply and necessitated a refinancing. This is the basis for the current loan that he is seeking.

In his group he has a leadership role as the group Chairman. His leadership style is unique in that in addition to being a strong leader, he has devoted part of his time to counseling the group members affected by the post-election violence as a way of ensuring that the group business activities pick up faster. This has endeared him to his group members who view him as a servant leader who is both concerned about their businesses and their social needs. His group leadership qualities have thus ensured that his group is among the most united in the region. Another unique feature of the group that has led to their current cohesion is his highly participative type of leadership which has encouraged members to voice their opinions openly without fear of victimization.


Disclaimer: Kiva is working with OI-WEDCO to refinance businesses disrupted by Kenya's post-election violence.  The group above has received loans from OI-WEDCO in the past and is now working to rebuild their businesses and to get back on their feet.Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To refinance their business for recovery and expansion after the post election violence in Western Kenya

payments.comment: Riwruok has now repaid $332 of its loan and is 20% complete in its repayment schedule.

loans.name: Ayishetu

texts.en:
Ayishetu is forty six years old and a widow with four children. One of her children is currently in Junior High School. She has been selling charcoal (one of the main sources of fire for cooking in most Ghanaian home) for three years now.

Ayishetu wants to use her new loan to buy to more bags of charcoal as her stock is running out. She is so happy that Sinapi educated her to save some money from her profits in order to cater for the house needs. She is a member of the group called Gold. The group uses group guarantee principles to exert peer pressure on members to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is thirty four years old and married with three children. Her children are currently in school. She sells onions and iodated salt to her community folks.

Mary is not able to buy and stock more salt and onions due to her low working capital. She frequently travels to Kumasi to buy her products. But the frequent travel reduces her income and working capital. She therefore wants to use this loan to buy more bags of iodated salt and sacks of onions.

She a proud member of the group called Gold. The group members uses peer pressure on members to repay the loan on time.

Mary is seen above displaying her products.

loans.use: To buy more bags of iodated salt and sacks of onions

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa is forty one years old and she has six children. She has been preparing and selling of local dishes like banku (meal prepared from milled maize), fufu (pounded cassava and plantain or cocoyam), rice ball, and konkonte (meal prepared from cassava flour) for the past fourteen years.

Yaa prepares and sells her dishes in the evening to her customers. She now wants to prepare and sell dishes in the morning because her customers want food to eat in the morning. She therefore wants to use this loan to buy more cassava, plantain, cocoyam, and soup ingredients and also to fix a shed as an eating place.

She is a member of the group called Exodus. Members of the group guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

Yaa is shown in the photo above.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cassava, cocoyam, spices, etc

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 51-year-old father of 5. He works and lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Saida. Ahmad sells birds. This is the third time he's applying for a loan through Al Majmoua. Ahmad wants to buy other birds to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: to buy other birds for re-sale

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 57-year-old father of 3. He works and lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Saida. Mohamad sells clothing. This is the seventh time he has applied for a loan through Al Majmoua. Mohamad wants to buy more merchandise to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to increase his stock

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en: Mustafa is a 55-year-old father of 2. He works and lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Saida. Mustafa sells yogurt and milk. This is the third time he has applied for a loan through A. Majmoua. Mustafa is planning to buy another cow to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: to buy a cow for his dairy

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice M. is a single mother of four children. She was unable to acquire basic education which made her unemployable. With her skimpy income from her odd jobs, the needs of the family could not be met. She decided to take a loan from GHAPE with which she invested in the selling of fried puffballs and beans. It also raised money to pay school fees for her children.

She plans to invest in the selling of puffballs and beans. Her business will provide the community with breakfast at a cheaper cost since she is centrally located. Also she is the only one doing the business where she is located. She plans to repay the loan in 18 months and repayment shall commence from the fourth month from the date of loan disbursement.

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar, yeast , groundnut oil, and beans

loans.name: Walid

texts.en: Walid is 41 years old and is a father of 4. He works and lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Saida. Walid sells fruits and vegetables. This is the third time he has applied for a loan through A. Majmoua. Walid is planning to buy a pick-up truck to develop his business.

loans.use: to buy a pick-up truck

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Talal

texts.en: Talal is a 33-year-old father of one child. He works and lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Saida. Talal sells sweets. This is the second time he's applying for a loan through Al Majmoua. Talal wants to buy provisions and is planning to purchase an ice cream machine.

loans.use: to buy provisions for his sweets shop

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Amin

texts.en: Amin is a 45-year-old father of 3. He works and lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Saida. Amin owns a place where you can find pool, computers/internet, etc. This is the fourth time he has applied for a loan through Al Majmoua. Amin wants to buy computers to develop his business.

loans.use: to buy computers for his business

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en: Jamal is a 36-year-old man. He works and lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Saida. Jamal is in the food vending business and he also paints furniture. Jamal wants to buy provisions for his little shop. The increased amount generated from his business will help him pay for his wife's childbirth expenses.

loans.use: to buy provisions for his small business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 39-year-old father of 6 who works and lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Saida. Mahmoud owns a bakery. This is the fifth time he has applied for a loan through A. Majmoua. Mahmoud wants to buy utensils for his business and is planning to change his oven.

loans.use: buy utensils and an oven for his bakery

loans.name: Sowra 2022-1 Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Margret P.. She is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Margret is 32 years old and is married with a husband who is a reporter over the radio.

Each week, Margret makes approximately 60 Sudanese pounds in profit, and with the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

Margret is joined in her small group by Rejoice A., Regina Y., Joice I. and Anjelina D.. Rejoice A. has a business selling breads and wants to expand the business. Regina Y. is currently operating a business selling charcoal and wants a loan to expand the business. Joice I. operates a business of selling charcoal and wants to expand her business. Anjelina D. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: expand the charcoal business

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is the owner and operator of a beauty salon in the town of Obuasi. She has operated the store for over eight years. She wants to use the proceeds of this loan to expand her product selection to include beauty creams, clothes, and footwear. She is also hoping to save so that someday she may move her salon to a better trafficked location.

Sarah is a member of the trust group David. The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loans.use: To expand beauty salon products to include creams and footwear

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 42963

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 43-year-old man who lives and works in the Beirut suburbs. Ali owns a household goods store. This is the second time he's applying for a loan through A. Majmoua. He needs to buy more merchandise to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his store

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a 45-year-old woman who works and lives with her family in the Beirut suburbs. She has 3 children. Mariam sells women's clothing. This is the second time she's applying for a loan through Al Majmoua. She needs to buy more merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for re-sale

loans.name: Haytham

texts.en: Haytham is a 35-year-old man who works and lives with his family in the Beirut suburbs. He has 2 children. Haytham owns a grocery store. This is the second time he's applying for a loan through Al Majmoua. He needs to buy merchandise to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his grocery store

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en: Rabih is a 32-year-old man wno works and lives with his family in the Beirut suburbs. He has 2 children. Rabih owns a bakery. This is the first time he's applying for a loan through Al Majmoua. He is planning to buy a car for the bakery.

loans.use: to buy a car for his business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 36-year-old man who works and lives with his family in the Beirut suburbs. He has 3 children. Ali is a car mechanic. This is the third time he has applied for a loan through Al Majmoua. He wants to buy material for his business. The increased income generated from the input of this loan will help him pay his children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to buy material for his auto repair business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 23, 2008)

texts.en: Ali is a 54-year-old man who works and lives with his family in the Beirut suburbs. He has 3 children. Ali owns a grocery store. This is the second time he has applied for a loan through Al Majmoua. He wants to buy more merchandise to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Alia

texts.en: Alia is a 50-year-old woman who works and lives in the Beirut suburbs. Alia sells clothing. This is the first time she's applying for a loan through Al Majmoua. She needs to buy more merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is the owner and operator of a general store in Obuasi. She is requesting a loan to help expand the variety of products she can sell at her general store. During the day, Diana is a schoolteacher and her mother Rose operates the store in her stead. In the evenings, Diana returns to operate the stand. Rose is pictured above.

Diana is a member of the trust group David. The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loans.use: To expand the variety of products for her general store

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 42971

loans.name: Hanane

texts.en: Hanane is a 30-year-old woman who works and lives with her family in the Beirut suburbs. She has one child. Hanane is a hairdresser. This is the second time she has applied for a loan through Al Majmoua. She needs to buy material to sustain and develop her hairdressing business.

loans.use: to buy supplies to develop her business

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is a forty year old mother of four children. She has been selling palm nut soup and rice for the last four years. The proceeds of this loan will help her buy rice and palm nuts in larger quantities to help guard against price hikes. Eventually, Adwoa wants to use the proceeds of her loan to build her own house.

Adwoa is a member of the trust group David. The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of rice and palm nuts

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 42973

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: I. is a 37-year-old man. He works and lives with his family in the Beirut suburbs. He has one child. I. owns a bakery. This is the first time he's applying for a loan through Al Majmoua. He is planning to do the maintenance of his business's roof.

loans.use: for the maintenance of the roof of his bakery

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is a forty nine year old mother of four children. She has been operating a small food stand in the town of Obuasi for over ten years. She prepares and sells rice balls, fufu, and banku. Fufu and banku are traditional Ghanaian dishes. Fufu is made of cassava, plantain, and cocoa yams, while banku is made from maize. The proceeds of this loan will allow Georgina to buy rice in larger quantities to guard against price hikes. Georgina hopes the savings from her business will help her build a new structure for her stand and to buy plastic tables and chairs.

Georgina is a member of the trust group David. The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loans.use: To buy rice in larger quantities

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 42975

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en: Bassam is a 40-year-old man. He works and lives with his family in the Beirut suburbs. He has 5 children. Bassam is an automotive blacksmith. This is the fourth time he's applying for a loan through Al Majmoua. He is planning to buy a car for the business.

loans.use: to buy a car

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a 33-year-old woman. She works and lives with her family in the Beirut suburbs. She has one child. Fatima sells household products and accessories. This is the second time she's applying for a loan at Al Majmoua. She needs to buy merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for re-sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 63-year-old man. He works and lives with his family in the Beirut suburbs. He has one child. Hussein owns a grocery store. This is the first time he's applying for a loan at Al Majmoua. He wants to buy merchandise to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir is a 59-year-old man. He works and lives with his family in the Beirut suburbs. He has 4 children. Samir owns a dry-cleaning shop. This is the third time he's applying for a loan at Al Majmoua. He wants to develop and enhance his business.

loans.use: to develop and enhance his business

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Welcome to Fernando’s Bar!! Fernando is 56 years old and is originally from Xilembene, in the Gaza Province. He is single and father of 2 daughters (25 years old and 11 years old) who live in South Africa with an uncle, as their mother died a couple of years ago.

Fernando lived in the capital Maputo most of his life, completing primary school and working as a government employee for the FRELIMO Political Party. When he retired 3 years ago, he decided to open a bar in Ponta D’Ouro, a beach village on the border with South Africa, very famous for its tourism, especially among South Africans.

The bar is located near the village’s central open-air market and serves only Mozambican national brands. A glass of beer costs MTn 50 (US$ 2) and a bottle of rum, his most-sold product, costs MTn 150 (US$ 6). Fernando loves his bar and to serve clients. He has become quite close to some of them, and together they recently started to sell T-shirts and hats with Fernando’s brand name (“Fernando’s Bar – Ponta D’Ouro”). These customers produce the clothing in South Africa and bring it to Ponta for him to sell at the bar; the profit is split 50/50. A T-shirt is sold for MTn 350 (US$ 14) and hats go for for MTn 50 (US$ 2). With the bar, Fernando makes from MTn 50,000 (about US$ 2000) up to MTn 200,000 (US$ 8200) per month, depending on the season and South African holidays, and with the sale of clothes he is making up to MTn 100,000 (US$ 4100) per month, and he is incredibly satisfied about it.

On top of supporting his daughters, Fernando also helps 3 sisters and his mother who live in Zipeto, near Maputo. He goes to Maputo around once a month to buy inventory for his bar and spends around MTn 5,000 (US$ 200) in food for his family (in total around 15 people). As he doesn’t have a car, he goes with the minibus and pays MTn 300 (US$ 12.50) for the round-trip ticket.

Hluvuku is part of Fernando’s life. He has already had 5 loans that he used in the bar (for expansion and increase of inventory), the first one in August 2005 of MTn 6,000 (US$ 250). This sixth loan of MTn 30,000 (US$ 1200) will also be used to increase inventory and prepare for South African holidays in April. In the future, Fernando plans ask for a leasing loan to buy a good car to help him buy merchandise and sell his signature clothing at close beaches. He also dreams of building a small house in Ponta (he currently lives in the back of the bar) and a kitchen in the bar to sell food to his clients. With his motivation, charisma and will to grow his business, he is definitely going to succeed in life.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Azarias Fernando

texts.en:
Azarias is 31 years old and is originally from Inhambane. His parents died when he was very young, so he moved with his 3 brothers to Maputo, where he went to school until 5th grade. He is married and has 4 children: the 2 oldest girls (11 and 8 years old) already go to school.

In 1998 Azarias started working at “Padaria do Papa”, a bakery shop in Maputo, where he learnt how to bake bread. In 2002 he decided to open his own bakery shop, but Maputo would be very competitive, so he moved to Ponta D’Ouro, where wood was very accessible. Ponta D’Ouro is a beach village on the border with South Africa, very famous for its tourism, especially among South Africans.

Azarias worked in construction to save money to build his own oven, and in 2003 he had already started to bake bread. He bakes between 300 to 560 loaves of bread per day, depending on the season. Each loaf is sold for MTn 3.5 (around US$0.15) and they sell out very fast, as Azarias is one of the best bakers in the region (he sells to the most famous hotels and restaurants in Ponta D’Ouro). A sack of 10 kilograms of wheat costs around MTn 200 (about US$ 8) and is enough to make 85 loaves of bread. His oven has the capacity to bake up to 100 loaves at once, so Azarias starts very early in the morning in order to finish baking by 6-7am. Azarias makes approximately MTn 7,500 (US$ 310) per month, and after paying expenses, including his 2 employees and the lady who helps with the house, his profit is around MTn 2,000 (US$ 83).

This is Azarias’s third loan with Hluvuku. The first two he used to buy raw materials (wheat, salt ,and yeast). This time Azarias plans to use his loan of US$ 350 to finish building a grocery store near the oven (which is inside his yard – near his house), where he plans to sell other food products. Azarias believes that he can even start buying some inventory with this loan. The lady who works at his house will work at the grocery store, and his wife will take care of the house.

In the future, Azarias would like to have a fourth loan to build another house on his land to increase his income through rent. In Ponta D’Ouro many people come to work during the season and rent rooms, and Azarias believes this would be a good business venture. What an entrepreneur!

loans.use: Finish construction of grocery store and buy inventory

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia is thirty five years old, married, and has three children. Two of her children are currently in school. She has been selling frozen fish and meat in Obuasi for six years now. She has not been able to buy more frozen products due to low working capital.

Afia wants to use this loan to buy more frozen products, like fish and meat, to increase her stock. She has been educated by Sinapi to save some money from her profits in order to take care of her children.

Afia is member of the group called “Papa Ye” (meaning Goodness). The members of the group guarantee for each other in repaying the loan.

Afia is the person pictured above wearing a pink dress. Beside her is her sister Janet.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen products, like fish and meat

loans.name: Narcisio

texts.en:
Narcisio is 37 years old and is originally from Inhambane. He is married and has 4 children. He went to school in Inhambane until 5th grade (in two more years he would have finished primary school) and in 1995 moved to Swaziland to live and work with his father.

In Swaziland, his father had been working in a lodge since 1989 and his boss employed Narcisio as well. After gaining his boss’s trust, Narcisio was sent in 1997 to Ponta D’Ouro in Mozambique to look after 3 rental houses that the boss had there. Ponta D’Ouro is a beach village on the border with South Africa, very famous for its tourism, especially among South Africans.

Narcisio looks after the houses, helps manage all the employees who work there, and does any repair that is needed. He earns R1600 per month (around US$ 200) and is able to save a bit from time to time. His wife Angelica also works in one of the houses as a cleaning lady and earns R600 (about US$ 70) monthly. Narcisio and Angelica live in a room in the back of one of the houses, mainly because Narcisio is also in charge of security. Their children sleep in a house Narcisio is building, but spend most part of the day with them.

Narcisio first approached Hluvuku in 2000 asking for a loan to start a grocery stand. As the value requested was denied, Narcisio decided to postpone the idea. In 2005 he bought a piece of land and decided to start building a house, so he asked again for a loan to buy construction material, which was approved. This is Narcisio’s third loan and will still be used to buy construction material. The house is almost ready; this time he will buy some missing windows and doors. Before borrowing though Hluvuku, Narcisio used to ask his boss to lend him money, but the boss would make him pay at once, normally deducting from his salary, and that was too much for him. Hluvuku in his opinion is very good because he repays an amount he can afford every month and still has money to support his family.

In the future, Narcisio intends to ask for a new loan to keep improving the house and once it is ready, he hopes to start building 2 others, as he already has other land close to his house. He dreams about giving each of his children a house to live in.

The picture shows Narcisio with his 9-year-old daughter Aida.

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a mother of four children and all her children are currently in school. She is twenty nine years old and has been selling frozen fish, meat, and charcoal (one of the main sources of fire for cooking in most Ghanaian homes) in Obuasi.

She wants to use this loan to purchase more bags of charcoal and boxes of frozen fish to avoid price hikes. She also wants to rent a store, as she currently shares a store with her sister who is doing the same business.

Janet is a member of the group called David. David members guarantee for each other to repay their part of the loan on time.

Janet is pictured above wearing a red dress along with her sister.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of frozen fish and meat

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 42984

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida is thirty six years old and has one child, who is currently in school. She has been selling home products--like tomatoes, vegetable oils, eggs, garden eggs, tin fish, pastas, spices, okra, and onions--in a very busy market in Obuasi. She has very good customer care and therefore many customers buy her products. She thanks Sinapi for training her.

Vida wants to use this loan to buy more products and a greater variety because customers are always demanding them.

She is a member of the group called David. The group exerts peer pressure on members to re-pay the loan.

Vida is pictured above busy in the market.

loans.use: To buy more varieties of products like tin fish, pastas, and spices

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 42985

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is forty four years old and a mother of six children. The children are all currently in school. She has prepared and sold kenkey (meal prepared from milled maize) with fried fish for ten years now.

Juliana wants to use this loan to buy more bags of maize to prepare kenkey and also add to her business selling fresh yams. She believes it will increase her income, which will help her take care of her six children.

Juliana is a member of the group called David. The group exerts peer pressure on members to repay the loan.

Juliana is pictured above happily frying her fish.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize and tubers of fresh yams

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 42986

loans.name: Željana

texts.en: Željana is from Štrpci, a small village near the town of  Prnjavor. She is not married and she works in a coffee shop which she owns. Željana can earn about US$ 400 monthly. This is her first loan in the amount of US$ 500. Željana will use it  for  supplies.  Her wish is to expand what she offers in her coffee shop  in order to increase her monthly income.

loans.use: for supplies to expand her little cafe

loans.name: Boubacar

texts.fr:
Mr. Boubacar D. is a fashion designer originally from Guinea; he is established in Ziguinchor, where he does business that is highly valued by his customers, especially women; he is requesting a loan to modernize his sewing machine and to buy various supplies.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Mr Boubacar D. est un couturier d' origine guineenne ; il est etabli a Ziguinchor ou il mene des activites tres appreciees par sa clientele , surtout les femmes ; il sollicite un credit pour moderniser sa machine a coudre et acheter des fournitures diverses .

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and various furnishings

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for UIMCEC, a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Sanela

texts.en:
Sanela was born in 1975 and she is married. She is from Filipovići, a small village near the town of Goražde. Her husband has a pension from his military service; he gets US$ 240 monthly as a pension. He also does seasonal work in agriculture together with Sanela. They have two children, 13 and 14 years old.

This is Sanela's second loan at MCO WWI. Sanela will use this loan in the amount of US$ 825 to buy a cow to raise. She intends to increase her monthly household income.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Sabahida

texts.en: Sabahida is a 46-year-old woman from Milatovići, a suburb of  the town Goražde. Her husband works as a seasonal worker. When he has work, he can earn about US$ 400 a month.  They work in agriculture, too. They need additional money  because they  have 3 children  from 7-15 years old and they are all going to primary school. Sabahida wants to use this second loan in the amount of  US$ 975 to buy another cow to raise. She also wants to buy more sheep.

loans.use: To buy a cow
