loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma was born in 1988 and she is married. She lives in Goražde with her husband and their one-year-old child.  Her husband  does seasonal work and he can earn  about US$ 400 monthly. They are doing agriculture  and Elma  will use this  second  loan in the amount of  US$ 975 to buy livestock. Her wish is to expand the number of sheep they raise and increase  monthly income for her family.

loans.use: For buying livestock

loans.name: Mirjana

texts.en: Mirjana was born in 1986 and she lives together with  her parents in Foča. Their monthly family income is about US$ 400. This is  her second loan through  MCO WWI. Mirjana  will use this loan for reselling cosmetic in order to  expand the business and to help her family with additional money.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for re-sale

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es:
Mr Alcides Ramón P. is married to Irene Cabrera de P.. The couple has two daughters, Viviana who is 16 years old and Lady who is 7. Both girls hope to become doctors, and Alcides know only too well how much money this will take. Therefore he is trying his very best to save in order to be able to pay their university fees in the future.

Alcides began his work as a travelling salesman, selling clothing and haberdashery items. Then, in time, he was able to rent a premises in the municipal market, and slowly but surely he began to sell electronic goods. Alcides is an example of a good man, something which others can aspire to be. He did not receive any official business training, yet today he owns a shop which sells plenty of different items and is growing day by day.

Alcides has requested a loan as he wants to buy IT supplies such as pen drives, cds, keyboards, mouse etc.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

El Sr. Alcides Ramón P. está casado con Irene Cabrera de P., la pareja tienen 2 hijas, Viviana de 16 años y Lady de 7 años de edad sus dos hijas sueñan con ser doctoras en medicina, Alcides sabe que esta carrera es muy costosa y esta haciendo sus mayores esfuerzo ahorrando para poder pagar sus estudios universitarios.

Alcides empezó a trabajar como vendedor ambulante, vendía prendas de vestir y artículos de mercería; luego de un tiempo el pudo alquilar un local comercial en el mercado municipal y poco a poco empezó a vender artículos electrónicos. Alcides es un ejemplo de hombre, ejemplo de que las personas pueden progresar si se proponen, ya que el solo curso hasta la primaria, no recibió capacitación en negocios pero aun así hoy día posee un comercio que vende bastante bien y día a día crece más.

Alcides solicita el crédito pues con el quiere comprar insumos de informática como pen drive, cd´s, teclados, mause, entre otras cosas.

loans.use: To purchase sound equipment, televisions and electronic goods

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mrs Elizabeth González is married with 2 children – Fiorela who is 4 and Richard who is 2, who are the love of her life and her greatest hope. She hopes that they can one day go to the university of their choice

Elizabeth is the owner of a sawmill. She knows about business as she has worked in a sawmill since a very young age. Her father also had a sawmill and he is the person who helped her set up one of her own.

Elizabeth hopes to continue to develop her business and improve its infrastructure by building platform. To achieve this, she needs a loan which she is now requesting.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. Elizabeth González es casada, tiene 2 hijos Fiorela de 4 años y Richard de 2 años, que son la luz de su vida y su mayor esperanza, ella desea que ellos puedan culminar el día de mañana una carrera universitaria de la preferencia de ellos.

Elizabeth es propietaria de un aserradero, ella conoce del negocio ya que desde muy joven trabajo en ello; su padre también tenía un aserradero y fue él quien ayudo a Elizabeth a montar su propio aserradero.

Ella desea seguir creciendo en este negocio, y mejorar su infraestructura, construyendo un tinglado; para lograr esto ella necesita de un crédito que hoy día está solicitando.

loans.use: To improve the infrastructure of her sawmill, building a platform

loans.name: Željka

texts.en: Željka lives in the town Foča with her 11-year-old  child who attends fifth grade at primary school. She is a widow and she has monthly  pension  in the amount of  US$ 380. This is her third loan  through MCO WWI . Željka intends to use this loan in the amount of  US$ 975 to buy material to make handicrafts. She is going to sell her handicrafts in order to expand the business  and increase their monthly income for her and her son.

loans.use: To buy material for handicrafts

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel Giménez is 54 years old, and has been happily married to Mr Silverio Mercado, 59 years old, for 32 years. Silverio sells cattle. The couple has 7 children, four of whom are married and have left the family home. Two have moved to Spain to find better jobs and are now working, periodically sending a small amount of money home. The youngest, who is 24 years old, is the only child still living with the couple.

Isabel has been a merchant for more than 10 years. She owns a pantry from where she sells basic everyday food products. She began working in this business with the help of her husband who helped her with savings, so that she could set up her microbusiness. Isabel depends on a well-established customer base and furthermore, she offers home deliveries and supplies other businesses in the area.

She requests this loan in order to buy stock such as sugar, rice, noodles, flour, chorizo, maize flour, drinks etc, as well as pigs and chickens to rear. As a result, she will be able to offer a better supply to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Isabel Giménez de 54 años de edad está felizmente casada hace 32 años con el Sr. Silverio Mercado de 59 años de edad; Silverio se dedica a la compra y venta de animales vacunos. El matrimonio tiene 7 hijos de los cuales cuatro ya están casados y viven en forma independiente, dos viajaron a España en busca de mejores oportunidades laborales y en la actualidad ya están trabajando y envían periódicamente un poco de ayuda monetaria a sus padres, la menor de todos de 24 años es la única que está viviendo con sus padres.

La señora Isabel es comerciante hace más de 10 años, ella posee una despensa donde vende productos de primera necesidad, ella se inició en este rubro con la ayuda de su marido quien la ayudo con unos ahorros para que pueda montar su microempresa. Doña Isabel cuenta con una clientela bien formada y realiza además repartos de sus mercaderías a domicilio y provee a otros negocios de la zona.

Solicita este préstamo para compra de mercaderías como azúcar, arroz, fideos, harina, chorizo, harina de maíz, bebidas en general, también cerdos y pollos para criar, de este modo abastecerán mejor todos los pedidos de sus clientes minoristas y mayoristas.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, noodles, flour, chorizo, maize flour, chickens, pigs, milk, herbs, oil, drinks etc.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.es:
Miguela A. is 34 years old, and is married to Reinerio Boagrín, who is 42. The couple has two daughters aged 8 and 15. The youngest is in school, while the oldest is in secondary school.

Miguela owns a pantry where she sells all sorts of basic, everyday food products. She started up her business with a small amount of capital, which has grown thanks to loans and savings which Miguela has been acquiring.

In time, Miguela also invested her money and bought a television set and Playstation and now, in addition to the pantry, she also rents video games, charging by the hour. This is quite a popular service for the youngsters and children, who are her main customers.

Miguela hopes to continue developing her business, and her future project is rearing chickens, but she lacks capital and the infrastructure to do this. Now she is requesting a loan to buy stock for her pantry.

Miguela is stepping up her efforts as she wants to provide her daughters with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

La señora Miguela A. de 34 años es esposa de Reinerio Bogarín de 42 años, el matrimonio tienen dos hijas de 8 y 15 años, la primera va a la escuela mientras que la otra ya va al colegio.

Doña Miguela es dueña de una despensa donde comercializa todo tipo de artículos de primera necesidad y comestibles. Ella comenzó su negocio con un pequeño capital el cual fue aumentando gracias a créditos y ahorros que Miguela fue adquiriendo.

Con el tiempo, Miguela también invirtió su dinero en la compra de un televisor y un play station, y ahora, además de la despensa, también tiene alquiler de video juegos, en donde cobra por hora; este negocio del alquiler de juegos es bastante popular entre los jóvenes y niños que son sus principales clientes.

Miguela desea seguir creciendo, su proyecto en el futuro es también dedicarse a la cría de pollos, pero para ello aun le falta el capital y la infraestructura para hacerlo. Hoy día ella esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de mercaderías para su despensa.

Miguela redobla sus esfuerzos pues desea darle a sus hijas una buena educación.

loans.use: To buy oil, flour, sugar, eggs, milk, noodles, sweets, rice, fizzy drinks, tinned products etc.

loans.name: Emira

texts.en:
Emira is a 36-year-old woman from the town of Goražde. She lives together with her husband and their child who attends secondary school. Her husband does seasonal work and he can earn about US$ 120 monthly. They are doing agriculture. They are receiving a social help in the amount of US$ 800.

Emira wants to use this loan in the amount of US$ 825 to buy necessities for spring sowing of crops. Her intent is to increase monthly income for her household and secure crops for the coming growing period.

loans.use: To buy necessities for  sowing spring crops

loans.name: Benigno

texts.es:
Mr Benigno P. is 43 years old, single, and is a carpenter. He has worked for several years in large furniture stores and has gained a lot of experience. He has worked for several years in the ACHON furniture factory, one of the most widely recognised in our country.

With such experience, and a good amount of savings, Benigno has decided to set up his own carpentry workshop. Benigno exclusively produces carved beds and, luckily, business is thriving.

The loan which he is requesting is to diversify the products which he makes, as he wants to start manufacturing wardrobes, bedside tables amongst other things.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

El Sr. Benino P. de 43 años, es soltero, y se dedica a la carpintería. Trabajo varios años en grandes mueblerías del país, y fue así que adquirió mucha experiencia. Trabajo por varios años en la fabrica de muebles ACHON, una de las mas reconocidas de nuestro país.

Con basta experiencia y buen dinero ahorrado, Benino se decidió a montar su propio taller de carpintería. Don Benigno se dedica exclusivamente en fabricar camas torneadas y gracias a Dios le va bastante bien en el negocio.

El crédito que solicita es para diversificar el producto que fabrica, pues desea empezar a fabricar también roperos, mesitas, entre otros.

loans.use: Para la compra de madera

loans.name: Blas

texts.es:
Blas is 20 years old, single and lives with his parents – Esteban Martínez, who is a construction worker, and María Franco de Martínez, who owns a grocery store.

Blas repairs motorcycles and has been in this business since he was very young, when he started working as an administrator in a motorcycle workshop in his neighborhood. Because his parents are of very humble means, he had to start working at a very early age. Thanks to his great entrepreneurial spirit and responsibility, today he owns his own workshop.

The workshop runs very smoothly. He has a solid existing customer base for which he performs motorcycle repairs and maintenance. This business is very profitable being that 80% of the population of the city of Caaguzú counts on motorcycles as their means of transportation.

Blas has several objectives outlined for his life. One of them is to expand and modernize his workshop’s infrastructure to offer his customers better service and comfort.

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of a compressor, with which he will be able to repair motorcycle tires and in that way, diversify his services.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Blas es un joven de 20 años de edad, es soltero y esta viviendo con sus padres, Esteban Martínez que se dedica a la construcción y María Franco de Martínez quien tiene una despensa.

Blas se dedica a la reparación de motocicletas, se inicio en el oficio desde muy pequeño trabajando como secretario en un taller de motocicleta de su barrio, ya que sus padres son muy humildes el tuvo que trabajar desde temprana edad. Gracias a su gran espíritu emprendedor y responsabilidad él ya hoy día posee su propio taller.

El taller marcha muy bien, ya posee una sólida clientela formada a quienes realiza reparaciones y mantenimientos de sus motocicletas. Este negocio es bastante rentable ya que el 80 % de la población de la ciudad de Caaguzú cuenta con motocicletas como medio de transporte.

El tiene varios objetivos trazados en la vida, uno de ellos es la de ampliar y modernizar la infraestructura de su taller, para así poder ofrecer mejores servicios y comodidad a su clientela.

El cliente solicita el crédito para la compra de una compresora, con el cual podrá reparar neumáticos de motos y así diversificar su servicio.

loans.use: Purchase a compressor to diversify his services.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela P. is married to Miguel Mercado and has three children (Alejandro, Alexander who is 6 years old and Tania who is 11 years old). Her husband is a carpenter and makes wood bodywork for trucks. They dream that their children become dental and nursing professionals. Currently, they all study. Graciela says that she began in her profession when she was young since she was raised by her grandmother, who sold “chipas” (cheese bread snack), and she helped her in the kitchen. She now has her own business and sells basic necessities. The loan that she is requesting will be used for the expansion of her shop so that she can have a pantry. They hope that their country has new politicians who are interested more in the people.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra.Graciela P. està casada con el Sr.Miguel Mercado y tienen 3 hijos (Alejandro,Alexander de 6 años y Tania de 11 años de edad). Su marido es carpintero y fabrica carrocerias de madera para camiones. Sueñan que sus hijos sean profecionales odontologos y enfermera, actualmente todos estudian. La Sra. manifesto que se inicio en este oficio desde muy pequeña ya que se crio con su abuela, quien vendía chipas y ella le ayudaba en la cosina. Actualmente ya cuenta con su propio negocio y ademàs vende articulos de primera necesidad. El credito solicitado serà destinado a la ampliaciòn de su local comercial y de esa forma tener una despensa. Esperan que nuestro pais tenga nuevos gobernantes que se interesen màs por el pueblo.

loans.use: To expand and improve her shop.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana María started her clothes-selling business in Tampico, Tamaulipas, where she has a stand, is well-known and has many customers. When she arrived in Reynosa, she started off by renting a house from where she also sold clothing. Because she was earning well, she started to save in order to buy the house she was renting. She bought the house with what she had saved and continues to sell clothing in Tampico and Reynosa.

In Reynosa it´s easier to get merchandise, since she goes to the U.S. and buys bundles of clothing as well as buys in the flea markets at wholesale prices, which helps her to earn a good profit.

She now needs a loan of US $200, which she will repay in 5 months, to buy bundles of seasonal clothing and to be able to meet all her customers´ requests. She trusts that with Kiva´s support she will get her loan.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Ana Maria inicio su negocio de venta de ropa en Tampico Tamaulipas en donde tiene un local establecido, con muchos clientes y conocidos. Al llegar a Reynosa empieza rentando una casa, donde también realiza la venta de ropa, al ver que le deja buenas ganancias empezó a ahorrar, ya que la casa que rentaba le ofrecian venderla, entonces con lo que tenía ahorrado la compro y sigue con la venta de ropa en Tampico y Reynosa.

En Reynosa tiene mas facilidades para la compra de mercancía, ya que va a Estados Unidos y compra pacas de ropa, asi como tambien compra en los tianguis a precio de mayoreo lo cual le beneficia mucho por que le deja buenas ganancias.

Ahora ella necesita un crédito por US $200 que pagara a 5 meses para la compra de pacas de ropa de temporada, y asi poder cumplirle a todos sus clientes con los pedidos de ropa que tiene. Ella confía que con el apoyo de Kiva obtendrá su crédito.

loans.use: Buy merchandise.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María Z. is 28 years old and has been married for 8 years to Alexis Gómez, who is 36. The couple have two children; one is 6 years old and in 1st grade in a school in the city and the younger one is a year old.

For the past 4 years Alexis has been working in Spain and comes once a year to visit his family. María says that this is a painful situation as she struggles to raise her two small daughters by herself. Alexis sends money from his job every month. He emigrated to Spain in search of work since there were few job opportunities in Paraguay and he was forced to take extreme measures to get ahead.

With the money her husband sent, María set up a general store in her house. In this way she generates extra income without having to leave home and without neglecting her children, who are still small.

Since the income from the store is good, María would like to invest more into it and for this reason, she is asking for a loan with which to buy a greater quantity and variety of merchandise, such as: handbags, candles, wallets, toys, shoes, jewelry, cushions, vases, sheets, and other things that her customers have requested on various occasions.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La señora María Z. de 28 años de edad esta casada hace 8 años con el señor Alexis Gómez de 36 años, el matrimonio tiene dos hijos, uno de 6 años que ya va a al 1er. grado en una escuela de la ciudad y el otro más pequeño de 1 año.

Hace 4 años Alexis está trabajando en España, y viene una vez al año a visitar a su familia, María cuenta que es muy dolorosa esta situación, pues ella sola debe luchar con sus hijas pequeñas para salir adelante. Alexis le envía mensualmente dinero de su trabajo, el emigro a este país en busca de trabajo pues la escasez de fuentes de trabajo en nuestro país lo obligo a buscar medidas extremas para conseguir salir adelante.

Del dinero que le envió su marido, María monto una despensa en su casa, de este modo genera un ingreso extra sin salir de su casa, y sin descuidar la crianza de sus hijos que aún son muy pequeños.

Como el margen de ganancias es muy interesante, María desea invertir más en su despensa y es por ello que ella solicita un crédito con el que podrá adquirir una mayor cantidad y variedad de mercaderías como: carteras, veladores, kits de billeteras, juguetes, zapatos, bijouterie, almohadones, jarrones, sábanas, entre otras cosas que sus clientes ya le han solicitado en varias ocasiones.

loans.use: Buy handbags, candles, wallets, toys, shoes, jewelry, cushions, vases, sheets and other goods.

loans.name: Kjghk's Group

texts.en: jkhfgkjhg

loans.use: gkhjgkjhg

loans.name: Meregildo

texts.es:
Meregildo is 48 years old and happily married for the past 19 years to Francisca López, who is 37. The couple have a 14 year old daughter who is currently in the 9th grade in a local school. Meregildo says he is very proud of his daughter, as she is one of the smartest students in the school.

Meregilda currently has his own general store where he also sells quick meals. The business is very profitable. Meregildo is an entreprising man and says he likes to start up businesses. In spite of the fact that he never had a formal education, he knows how to manage his business, invest his money and save.

His latest investment was an ice-making machine, and it is going very well since where he lives has very high temperatures and people drink a lot of cold drinks and water. The most popular drink consumed is cold "mate" tea, which is the reason why the sale of ice cubes has been so successful.

Meregildo wants to continue progressing and expanding his business. Now he is requesting a loan with which he plans to buy two freezers so he can increase the sale of cold drinks and also sell frozen foods such as meat, fish and others.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Pugisi, Kiva volunteer.

El Señor Meregildo de 47 años de edad esta felizmente casado hace 19 años con Francisca López de 37 años. El matrimonio tiene una hija de 14 años y que actualmente esta cursando el 9ª Grado en una escuela de la zona. Meregildo cuenta que se siente muy orgulloso de su hija, ya que es una de las estudiantes mas brillantes de la institución.

Don Meregildo actualmente cuenta con su propia despensa donde también se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas. El negocio es bastante rentable, Meregildo se caracteriza por ser un hombre emprendedor y dice que le gusta emprender negocios, a pesar de que no pudo acceder a una formación académica el sabe como manejar sus negocios, invertir su dinero y ahorrar.

Su última inversión fue una máquina de hacer hielos en cubos, y le va bastante bien, ya que nuestro país se caracteriza por sus altas temperaturas, las personas aquí consumen mucho bebidas frías y agua; la bebida más popular y consumida es el tereré que es como el mate pero frío, es por ello que su venta de hielos en cubo es todo un éxito.

Meregildo quiere seguir progresando y ampliando su negocio, hoy solicita un crédito con el que piensa adquirir dos freezer para aumentar la venta de bebidas frías y también vender alimentos congelados como carne, pescado, entre otros.

loans.use: Purchase 2 freezers.

loans.name: Miryan

texts.es:
Miryan Rolón is an enterprising woman of 35, who sells frangrances for women and men. For a number of years she lived in Argentina, a country she emigrated to in search of better job opportunities

After several years, she returned to Paraguay as she could not bear to be far from her family, especially her three daughters who today are 10, 15 and 16 years old. With the money she was able to save during those years, she has invested in the purchase of different goods to sell. Today she mainly sells perfumes and cellular phones.

Miryan makes her sales by visiting her customers door-to-door. Most of her products she buys at the request of her clients. She is asking for a loan with which to buy a new lot of merchandise, as she has new buyers who are requesting perfumes and new cell phones.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Miryan Rolón es una emprendedora mujer de 35 años que se dedica a la venta de perfumes para damas y caballeros, durante varios años vivió en Argentina, país al que emigró en busca de mejores oportunidades laborales.

Luego de varios años, volvió a Paraguay, ya que no soportaba estar lejos de su familia especialmente de sus tres hijas que hoy día ya tienen 10, 15 y 16 años respectivamente. Con el dinero que pudo ahorrar durante esos años ha invertido en la compra de mercaderías varias para vender, hoy día esta comercializando principalmente perfumes y teléfonos móviles (celulares).

Miryan realiza estas ventas a domicilio, visitando a sus clientes, también la mayoria de sus mercaderías las compra bajo pedido de sus clientes. Ella solicita el crédito con el que podrá adquirir un buen lote de mercaderías, ya que posee nuevos compradores que le han solicitado perfumes y celulares nuevos.

loans.use: To buy different perfumes and cellular phones.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is an experienced, hard-working entrepreneur from Melitopol, Ukraine. For the past nine years, she has operated a small grocery sales business. She currently sells a variety of canned foods and dry goods from a little space at a market near the bus station in Melitopol. Tatyana is married and has two children. In addition to taking care of her family, she also helps care for her elderly parents.

Tatyana has requested a six-month loan to give her additional working capital so she can purchase more inventory for her business. Tatyana has been an excellent client with Nadiya Ukraine, repaying all previous loans with no delays. We are happy to have another opportunity to assist her in operating a successful business.

loans.use: Increase working capital so as to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Clorinda Isidora

texts.es:
Clorinda Isidora G. L. is 47 years old, she studied up to fifth grade in secondary school. She has three children but only one still is dependent on her. She lives in the province of Otuzco in the department of La Libertad, Perú.

She sells lamb stew, chicken stew and fried fish during the mornings, in the afternoons she sells a fixed menu or a la carte, and in the evenings she sells a traditional Peruvian soup. When she lived in the district of Carabamba she had a small house where she had a store, but the business did not go well and she decided to go to Otuzco. There she started off selling candy from a small stand selling candy, later she rented a commercial space where she set up her restaurant.

Clorinda has been working since she was 12 years old when she sold fruit every morning at the market and studied in the afternoons. She also has a van with which she provides transportation service to the town of El Sauco.

She belongs for the "Luchando por el Progreso" community bank, where she got her first loan which she invested in the purchase of basic products for her store. With another loan, which will be repaid in four months, she will buy ingredients to make some of her stews and part of the money will be used to buy a tire for her van.

Her greatest dream is to buy a house in the city of Trujillo and reopen her general store there.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Clorinda Isidora G. L. tiene 47 años de edad, estudio hasta el quinto año de secundaria. Tiene tres hijos pero solo uno aun depende de ella. Vive en la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento La Libertad , Perú.

Vende caldo de carnero, caldo de gallina, pescado frito por las mañanas; por las tardes vende menú variado y platos a la carta y por las noches vende aguadito. Cuando vivía en el distrito de Carabamba tenia una pequeña casa en la que había instalado una tiendita, el negocio no iba bien, tomo la decisión de viajar a Otuzco, en un pequeño puesto empezó vendiendo golosinas, posteriormente alquilo un local en la que instalo su restaurante.

La señora Clorinda trabaja desde la edad de 12 años, por las mañanas vendía frutas en el mercado y por las tardes estudiaba. Actualmente también tiene una combi que hace servicio de transporte al caserío El Sauco.

Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Luchando por el Progreso” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 este dinero lo invirtió para comprar productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda. Con el préstamo de S/. 1100.00 el cual pagara en cuatro meses lo invertirá para comprar los ingredientes para preparar algunos potajes y otra parte del dinero para comprar una llanta para su combi.

Su mayor sueño es comprar una casa en la ciudad de Trujillo y allí reabrir su bodega.

loans.use: Buy ingredients for making stews and soups.

loans.name: Nimia

texts.es:
Nimia S. is 43 years of age, and she is married to Aurelio Pereira who is 41 years of age. The couple has 5 children, of which 2 are in high school, 2 in primary school, and the last one, who is the youngest in their home, is not yet in school.

Nimia S. is a peddler and started out in this profession working for someone else. After a long period of time, and with sufficient experience and a little bit of capital, she started her own business, which today runs wonderfully. She already has a very important tool – her motorcycle, which helps her transfer to greater distances in a shorter period.

Her plans for the future include setting up her own stand, but to do so she will require more capital. She dreams with having her children complete their studies and becoming successful professionals and assets to society. Her greatest wish for her country is change; that there is less corruption and more work to avoid massive emigration of her people to other countries, for many families suffer greatly due to the separation that it implicates.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Nimia S. de 43 años de edad, esta casada , su esposo se llama Aurelio Pereira y tiene 41 años de edad, el matrimonio tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales 2 van al colegio, 2 a la escuela primaria, y la última, la más pequeña de la casa, aún no va a la escuela.

Doña Nimia S. es vendedora ambulante, se inicio en esta profesión trabajando para otra persona, después de mucho tiempo y ya con experiencia suficiente y con un poco de capital, emprendió su propia microempresa, en la cual hoy día le va de maravillas. Actualmente ya cuenta con una herramienta muy importante, su moto que le sirve para trasladarse a una distancia mayor y en menor tiempo.

Sus planes para futuro es tener un puesto fijo, para ello necesitaría de mayor capital, ella sueña que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean profesionales exitosos y útiles a la sociedad. Lo que mas desea para nuestro país es el cambio, que haya menos corrupción y mas fuentes de trabajo de este modo se pueda evitar la emigración masiva de personas a otros países, pues las familias sufren mucho por la separación que eso implica.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise such as undergarments, towels, tablecloths, coolers, pot and pan sets, casseroles, perfumes, skirts, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Leokadiya

texts.en:
Leokadiya is a seasoned entrepreneur from the city of Stryi in the beautiful western part of Ukraine. She has been self-employed for twelve years as a market vendor and has gained much experience and knowledge along the way. Leokadiya currently sells a selection of household and toiletry supplies. She is constantly renewing her inventory and takes her business very seriously, working hard to ensure its success. Over the years, she has also been able to help a few other people start businesses. One of her goals for the future is to be able to buy her own store facility.

Leokadiya has requested a loan to help purchase new inventory, including bathroom gift sets, to sell in her kiosk. Profits from her business will allow her to continue to support her family – she is married and has two children, a son, 25, and a daughter, 21, who is in college – and will help her pursue her entrepreneurial goals.

loans.use: Purchase new inventory including bathroom gift sets

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Maria del Rosario is married and has 2 children, they are 2 and 4 years old. Her husband is a driver.

Maria del Rosario started her business 3 years ago, when a friend invited her to sell shoes from a catalogue. She now sells the shoes to friends and neighbors.

Thanks to her dedication and hard work, the business has developed well and it has allowed her to help her husband to buy a house, which they are currently paying off.

Her dream is to pay her house as she wants to leave her children a state of their own.

The loan she requests is to buy more merchandise for the pending orders she already has. With your help, Rosario will be able to continue improving her business and she will ultimately pay her house as well.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

María del Rosario es casada y tiene 2 niños uno de 2 años y otro de 4 años, su esposo trabaja como chofer. Debido a la necesidad que tenia de ayudar a su marido y poder obtener una casa propia para su familia gracias a su dedicación y esfuerzo esta meta se vio lograda y actualmente la esta pagando ya que su deseo es poder formar un patrimonio para sus hijos, tiene 3 años vendiendo calzado por catalogo con amistades y vecinos este negocio lo inicio por invitación de una amiga.

Ahora necesita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía y así surtir los pedidos pendientes. Con tu ayuda rosario podrá seguir pagando su casa. .

loans.use: To buy more shoes in order to cover her pending orders

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Mrs. Florencia C. Q. is 57 years of age, and has attended school until the 5th grade. She has five children but only one still depends on her for support. She lives in the province of Otuzco in La Libertad area of Peru. The business involves buying and selling small animals such as pigs, "huachos", chickens and guinea pigs, which after "fattening up", she kills to sell the meat. She also sells wheat and barley, and purchases cheese curds to re-sell. She buys the cheese curds, in bulk, in the Tupac Amaru village, which is located a few hours away in Otuzco. Many of her neighbors know her, and look for her so they can place orders for her products.

Through a family member, she joined the community bank "Mujeres del Olivo", and this is how she obtained her first loan of S /. 300.00. Most of this money was spent buying cheeses and animals. This new loan of S /. 1200.00, which she plans to pay off in four months will be used to buy 4 pigs, 3 "huachos", chickens and cheese.

Her biggest dream is to own a sales post in the market of Otuzco, where she will be able to offer her products.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Florencia C. Q. tiene 57 años de edad, estudio hasta el quinto grado de primaria. Tiene cinco hijos en total pero solo uno aun depende de ella. Vive en la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento La Libertad – Perú. El negocio al que se dedica es la compra y venta de animales menores tales como: chanchos, huachos, gallinas y cuyes el cual después de engordarlos sacrifica para vender la carne. Así también vende grano de trigo y cebada, además compra cuajada y queso para volver a vender. Muchos de sus vecinos ya la conocen por eso siempre la buscan para hacerle algún pedido. El quesillo lo compra al por mayor en el caserío Tupac Amaru ubicado a unas cuantas horas de Otuzco. Por medio de un familiar pudo integrarse al Banco Comunal “Mujeres del Olivo” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 la mayor parte de este dinero lo invirtió comprando queso y quesillo y otra la invirtió comprando animales. Con el préstamo de S/. 1200.00 el cual cancelara en cuatro meses comprará 4 chanchos, 3 huachos, gallinas y quesos. Su mayor sueño es tener un puesto propio en el mercado de Otuzco, para allí ofrecer sus productos.

loans.use: With this loan she will purchase more animals to sell through her business. (Con el prestamo comprara mas animales par a su venta)

loans.name: Rosa Martha

texts.es:
Rosa Martha sells steamed tacos and also sells cleaning products. She’s had the taco business for seven years and conducts it from her house’s porch. She started selling cleaning products two years ago. She has three children. Currently, they are married and no longer live with her. When she began selling tacos, she did so in order to help her husband, a builder, pay for her children’s education expenses. Thanks to her effort and hard work, she has been able to progress.

Currently, she is requesting a loan of US $250, which she will repay in 3 months, in order to purchase a cart from which she will sell tacos since now she does it from a table on her porch. With your help, Rosa will be able to give her customers better service and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa Martha se dedica a vender tacos a vapor y también venta de artículos de limpieza, el negocio de los tacos lo tiene hace 7 años lo hace en el porche de su casa, y la venta de artículos de limpieza lo inicio hace 2 años, ella tiene 3 hijos actualmente ellos ya están casados y no viven con ella. Cuando inicio la venta de tacos lo hizo para poder ayudar con los gastos escolares de sus hijos a su esposo quien trabaja como albañil en una constructora. Gracias a su empeño y arduo trabajo ha podido progresar.

Actualmente solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar un carrito donde instalarse y vender los tacos, ya que ahora lo hace en una mesa que coloca en el porche de su casa. Con tu ayuda rosa podrá darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes e incrementar sus ventas.

loans.use: Purchase a taco cart.

loans.name: Gloria Azucena

texts.es:
Gloria sells shoes by catalog, a business she began two years ago, selling at first to her colleagues at her husband’s work and to her friends. Her husband is a welder in a business, and she wishes to support him in paying the household expenses, primarily the schooling of their two children ages 8 and 4, in addition she would like to renovate their home to be more comfortable for her family.

She is asking for US$250 loan, which will be repaid in 3 months, to buy merchandise and fill pending orders for the next season.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Gloria se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catalogo este negocio lo incio hace dos años, vendiendo primero a los compañeros de trabajo de su esposo y sus amistades, su marido trabaja como soldador en una empresa, ella deseaba apoyarlo con los gastos familiares principalmente escolares de sus dos pequeños de 8 y 4 años, además deseaba acondicionar mejor su casa para ofrecerle mas comodidad a su familia.

Ella solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía y surtir pedidos pendientes de la próxima temporada.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Michail

texts.en:
Michail owns a small clothing sales business in the town of Morshin, in western Ukraine. He has space at a market area near the center of town where he sells a variety of men’s and women’s clothing. Michail has been in business for about eight years. He has benefited from having a great location with no other serious competitors close by. Michail is married and has one daughter for whom he is helping pay college expenses.

Michail has requested a loan to purchase a supply of sportswear to sell in his business. Michail has built an excellent reputation with Nadiya Ukraine and we are happy to be able to continue assisting him with his business.

loans.use: Purchase sportswear inventory

loans.name: Romina

texts.es:
Romina Ruiz Díaz is a peddler and sells clothing, footwear and undergarments. Despite having a teaching certificate, she found it very difficult to find employment and thus decided to sell merchandise door-to-door. Her husband, Jorge, is a public transportation driver and together they try to carry on facing daily life. Thanks to Romina having many acquaintances, she has good sales, and her own friends help her by telling their acquaintances about the items she sells. She says that the best advertising is that done through word of mouth.

Thanks to the earnings from her sales, some savings and help from loans, she was able to grow considerably. She bought a truck in which she travels and offers her merchandise to every home, and has been able to increase the variety and quantity of the merchandise she offers. Today, she is requesting another loan to purchase more merchandise since, with God’s help, she continues to gain demand for her products.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Romina Ruiz Díaz se dedica a la venta ambulante de prendas de vestir, calzados y lencerías. A pesar de tener un título de docente, a ella le resulto difícil hallar un trabajo, por lo que decidió dedicarse a vender mercaderías a domicilio. Su marido, Jorge, es chofer de una línea de transporte público y juntos tratan de salir adelante enfrentando la vida diaria. Gracias a que Romina tiene muchos conocidos, tiene buenas ventas, y sus mismos amigos le ayudan comunicándoles a otros conocidos de las cosas que ella vende. Ella dice que la mejor publicidad es la que se hace de boca en boca.

Gracias a las ganancias de sus ventas, un poco de ahorro y también ayuda de los créditos ella pudo crecer bastante, compro una camioneta con la que sale a recorrer casa por casa ofreciendo sus mercaderías, también a aumentado la variedad y cantidad de mercaderías para ofertar. Hoy día ella solicita un nuevo crédito para poder comprar más mercaderías, ya que gracias a Dios, ella tiene cada vez mas demanda de productos.

loans.use: Purchase different brands of athletic footwear, undergarments, women's clothing, sheet sets, kitchen appliances, among other things.

loans.name: Yolanda  Maribel

texts.es:
Mrs M. started making floral arrangements since a very early age. It is a work that inspires her and moreover, she has enough time to take care of her business and of her children.

She started with a small investment and until now she has been able to supply her shop with the best materials to create the floral arrangements that her customers like.

Her sister also works with her; she drives to the city, where a big part of her clients are located, in order to deliver the floral arrangements.

Yolanda Maribel lives with her 2 sons and she sustains them with the income she gets from her flower shop.

She now requests a loan to buy supplies as artificial flowers, vases, flowerpots, sponge, etc to create her floral arrangements.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra M., comenzó aprendiendo su oficio D. la Floristería a temprana edad, es algo que la inspira y le da el tiempo necesario para atender su negocio y poder estar pendientes D. las necesidades D. sus hijos, inicio invirtiendo poco en la elaboración D. flores hasta la fecha a podido surtir su negocio con materias primas óptimas para la elaboración D. los arreglos florales mas buscados ,en el negocio colabora su hermana que se dedica a llevar los arreglos florales a la zona metropolitana ya que parte D. su cartera D. clientes esta ubicada en ese sector.

Su grupo familiar esta compuesto por dos hijos D. la solicitante que viven actualmente en su vivienda y que ella sostiene con sus ingresos ella actualmente esta solicitando el crédito ya que tendrá que hacer una fuerte inversión en la compra D. materia prima para la elaboración D. flores.

loans.use: To buy supplies as artificial flowers, flowerpots, vases, sponge, etc to create her floral arrangements

loans.name: Roma

texts.en:
Roma has his own small business offering electronics and technical repair services. He and his wife, Erika, live in the western Ukrainian city of Mukachevo, not far from the border with Hungary and Slovakia. Roma has been in business for about four years. In a typical month he makes around $300 in profit. Roma has proven to be a reliable business owner with a stable enterprise.

Roma has requested a loan to increase his available working capital. He would like to expand his business in the future. This loan will help him as he works to pursue his goals and continue providing for the needs of his wife and himself .

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Koudzo

texts.en:
Mr. Koudzo A. is 33 years old and the father of 4 children. He runs a general store in Aventonou, a small village about 120 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. This proximity to the capital facilitates frequent trips back and forth to restock his store.

Mr. A. hopes to use this loan to buy 15 bags of rice, 10 bags of powdered sugar, 10 bottles of cooking oil, 15 cartons of milk, and 20 cartons of canned goods to resell in Aventonou. He hopes that these purchases this will help to boost his sales so that he can support his family and provide for his community.

loans.use: To buy 15 bags of rice, 10 bags of powdered sugar, 10 bottles of cooking oil, 15 cartons of milk, and 20 cartons of canned goods

loans.name: Sara Erlinda

texts.es:
Mrs R. launched her business recently. She started buying one “quintal” of corn (aprox. 100pounds), as that was all she could buy with the money she had. Now, she buys between 15 and 25 sacks of corn which she sells during the week.

This has been a very helpful business for Sara because her husband is sick and he can not work. Therefore, the business allows her to cover all her household financial needs as well as his medicines.

This is the first loan she requests and her credit record shows that she knows how to responsibly manage her accounts.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. R. inicio su negocio con poco, aproximadamente con un quintal de maiz ya que no contaba con los ingresos necesarios para poder invertir una cantidad mayor de dinero, en la actualidad compra los quintales a un proveedor de la zona entre los cuales anda por un promedio de 15 a 25 sacos de maíz que esta vendiendo en el transcurso de la semana.

El negocio le a sido de gran ayuda ya que su esposo actualmente no trabaja por problemas de enfermedad, el negocio le ayuda a cubrir los gastos de la vivienda y los de medicamentos de su esposo este es su primer crédito con la institución, pero en sus registros muestra ser una persona responsable con sus cuentas.

loans.use: To buy more corn and other products necessary for her business as firewood and lime

loans.name: Vita

texts.en:
Vita is a young mother and entrepreneur from Mukachevo, Ukraine. She is married and has two children. Vita helps support her family with a small business selling plumbing supplies at a market in Mukachevo called the “Kompact” market. Vita has been in business for about three years. By offering a necessary product that is in good demand and by working hard, she has done well with her business and it has been profitable.

Vita has requested a loan to increase her working capital which will allow her to broaden her assortment of inventory and help open a new vending location. We are happy to have this opportunity to support Vita in her endeavors and look forward to how her business will do in the future.

loans.use: Increase working capital so as to expand her inventory

loans.name: Akou

texts.en:
Ms. Akou K. is 39 years old and the mother of 5 children. Fish is a staple part of the majority of the population’s diet in this region and many women, like K. Akou, work in the business of preparing fish for consumption. While many women smoke these fish, Akou fries them in oil, making them crispy and tasty.

With this loan, Akou would like to purchase 10 cartons of fish and 5 bottles of oil to increase her sales and continue to satisfy her customers. By replenishing her inventory Akou will be able to continue to provide for her family by frying and reselling fish to the local population.

loans.use: To purchase 10 cartons of fish and 5 bottles of oil

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María Magdalena T. has always been a very enterprising woman, she is married and her husband works as a security guard at Pemex (Mexican Oil Company). Together they have 2 children, who are 5 and 2 years old.

Maria started her business 2 years ago, she was with her mother and sisters and they were going through a shoes catalogue. They planned to buy 5 pairs of shoes as the prices of the normal shops seemed very high in comparison to those in the catalogue. Instead, they decided to buy catalogues and start selling shoes to their family and neighbors.

She liked the idea of selling shoes during her free time as she could keep taking good care of her children. This business has also allowed her to help her husband with the household expenses and to improve their house.

Maria asks for a 300 USD loan that she will pay within 3 months. With this loan she will buy more merchandise as she has an order of 22 pairs of shoes. Maria is very happy because her sales have been going very well and with your support, her business will keep on flourishing.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

María Magdalena T. siempre ha sido una persona muy emprendedora, es casada su esposo trabaja como transito en Pemex, son padres de dos niños de 5 y 2 años.

Su negocio empezó cuando la invitaron a vender zapatos, en sus ratos libres y le agrado la idea ya que no descuidaría a sus hijos. Inicio hace aproximadamente 2 años, la idea surgió un día platicando con sus hermanas y su mama, todas ellas estaban escogiendo zapatos de un catalogo y le pareció que los precios estaban muy altos, entre todas iban a comprar cinco pares de calzado, y después de pensarlo decidieron mejor adquirir los catálogos e iniciaron así vendiendo a sus familiares y vecinas.

Gracias a esto ha podido ayudar a su esposo a solventar los gastos de su hogar así como acondicionar mejor su casa.

Actualmente requiere un crédito por US $300 que pagara en 3 meses par comprar mercancía ya que tiene pendiente por surtir 22 pares de zapatos ella esta muy contenta la ha ido bien con sus ventas. Con tu apoyo magdalena seguirá prosperando.

loans.use: To buy shoes in order to fulfill a current order of 22 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria Luisa is married and has 5 children including 3 who are married and 2 who are single and still live with her and her husband. The younger children are a 19-year old son who works and a 15-year old daughter who is in school. Her husband works as a laborer at Pemex. Faced with the need for an extra income to meet all of the family's bills, she went to work reselling jewelry and shoes that she bought from catalogs. She started about 2 years ago, selling jewelry to her husband's co-workers and relatives, and later added shoes. Because of her hard work, business has been strong. Her son helps her collect money from her customers.

She's asking for your loans in order to pull together US$950, to be repaid in 6 months, for buying jewelry with cash and so be able to offer it more cheaply and to buy shoes for the spring-summer season. With your help, Maria Luisa will continue moving her business forward.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

María Luisa es casada y tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 3 están casados y 2 solteros aun viven con ellos. Los menores son un hijo de 19 años que trabaja y su hija de 15 años que estudia. Su esposo trabaja como obrero en Pemex y ante la necesidad de obtener un ingreso extra para completar con todos los compromisos de su familia fue que ella se dedico a la venta de joyería y zapatos por catalogo. Inicio hace aproximadamente 2 años vendiendo joyería con los compañeros de su esposo, y familiares, y después añadió la venta de calzado por catalogo. Debido a su esfuerzo le ha ido bien con este negocio, y su hijo le ayuda con la cobranza a sus clientes.

Ella solicita de sus contribuciones para reunir US $950 que pagara en 6 meses para surtir joyería de contado y poder ofrecerla mas económica, y comprar zapatos para esta temporada de primavera-verano. Con tu ayuda Luisa seguirá adelante con su negocio.

loans.use: Buy merchandise.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.en:
Koffi K. is 34 years old and is the married father of one child. He owns a photocopying and typing services business in Adèta, a medium-sized town located about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. As most people in his area do not own computers or copy machines or know how to type, his services are often in demand and keep him very busy.

With this loan, Koffi hopes to buy another photocopy machine, as his current one can barely keep up with his workload. He also wishes to buy a few reams of paper. Koffi hopes that with this loan he will be able to satisfy the demands of his customers and to use the revenue from his business to pay for his child’s schooling.

loans.use: To buy paper and a new photocopy machine

loans.name: Yungueñitas Group

texts.es:
The association known as "Yungueñitas" has been part of the ProMujer family for approximately 6 years. They work with the Panamericana branch of the ProMujer organization, located in the Rio Seco zone of the city of El Alto. With their service consultant Ada del Castillo they form a very well organized and tight knit group.

With the association exist a number of economic activities such as carpentry (furniture, doors, picture frames), crafting of sweaters and scarves and sales of raw chicken. Some of the members also have a small store though their principal activity is sales of food they prepare themselves, which they offer in the fairs in the city of El Alto. They offer their clients a variety of delicious Bolivian dishes, such as an exquisite chicharron (deep fried seasoned pork ribs), fricase (a spicey pork stew), chayro (also a tasty stew) and other dishes, particulary traditional dishes.

The majority of the members are married with numerous children. They bring their children to work with them and help their spouses cover the household expenses. Although their children are school age and need to study and have standard comforts in their homes, the women say that the live in small living spaces, that is to say, with an average of 5 people sleeping in the same room.

The Yungueñitas group needs capital for the purchase of raw materials for their businesses, with the objective of growing their businesses and thereby their incomes, so that they will be able to rent places to live that will provide their children with more comfortable environments and better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

LA ASOCIACION "YUNGUEÑITAS" YA FORMA PARTE DE LA FAMILIA DE PRO-MUJER HACE SEIS AÑOS APROXIMADAMENTE, TRABAJAN EN EL CENTRO FOCAL PANAMERICANA UBICADO EN LA ZONA DE RIO SECO DE LA CIUDAD DE EL ALTO. JUNTO A SU ASESORA DE SERVICIOS ADA DEL CASTIILO FORMAN UN GRUPO MUY BIEN ORGANIZADO Y UNIDO.

EXISTEN DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES DENTRO LA ASOCIACION COMO SER: TRABAJOS DE CARPINTERIA ( MUEBLES, PUERTAS, MARCOS), TAMBIEN EL TEJIDO DE CHOMPAS Y CHALINAS, LA VENTA DE POLLO CRUDO, ALGUNA DE ELLAS TAMBIEN CUENTA CON UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDA PERO LA ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL ES LA VENTA DE COMIDA PREPARADA POR ELLAS, ESTA LA OFRECEN EN LAS FERIAS DE LA CIUDAD DE EL ALTO, OFRECIENDO A LA CLIENTELA VARIEDAD DE PLATILLOS COMO SER UN EXQUISITO CHICHARRON, FRICASE, CHAYRO Y OTROS PLATILLOS POR LO GENERAL TRADICIONALES.

LA MAYORIA SON CASADAS CON NUMEROSOS HIJOS, LO QUE LES LLEVA A TRABAJAR Y AYUDAR A SUS PAREJAS EN LA ECONOMIA DE SUS HOGARES. PUESTO QUE SUS HIJOS SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR Y NECESITAN ESTUDIAR Y TENER MAYOR COMODIDAD EN SUS CASAS, ELLAS NOS CUENTAN QUE VIVEN EN PEQUEÑOS AMBIENTES, ES DECIR EXISTE UN PROMEDIO DE 5 PERSONAS QUE DUERMEN EN UNA MISMA HABITACION.

EL GRUPO YUNGUEÑITAS NECESITA MAYOR CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE MATERIA PRIMA PARA SU NEGOCIO CON EL OBJETIVO DE QUE ESTE CREZCA Y ASI OBTENER MAYORES GANANCIAS, DE ESTA MANERA PODER ALQUILAR AMBIENTES MAS COMODOS PARA SUS HIJOS BRINDANDOLES ASI CONDICIONES DE VIDA.

loans.use: Capital for the purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Florencia Cena

texts.es:
Mrs. Florencia Cena V. D. R. is 45 years old and studied until the second graD.. She has five children but only 3 are dependent on her. She lives in the province of Otuzco in the department of Libertad, Peru. In the general store that she opened in her home, she sells a variety of essential products, such as cereal grains, chicken, bread, vegetables, cleaning products, sweets, soft drinks and beer. When she began the business she began with very little and didn’t have much variety. She would buy products in arrobas (units of about 25 pound), and now she buys them by the sack. She belongs to Communal Bank “Mujeres del Olivo,” where she obtained her first loan of 300 soles (about $100), and with this money she bought a variety of products to stock her store. With this loan of 600 soles (about $225), which will be repaid over 4 months, she will buy 5 sacks of sugar, 2 bottles of oil and sweets. Her greatest dream is to open another store in the center of Otuzco.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Florencia Cena V. D. R. tiene 45 años D. edad, estudio hasta el segundo grado D. primaria. Tiene cinco hijos pero solo tres dependen D. ella. Vive en la provincia D. Otuzco en el departamento La Libertad – Perú. En la bodega que ha implementado en su domicilio venD. una variedad D. productos D. primera necesidad, granos D. cereales, carne D. pollo, pan, verduras, productos D. limpieza, golosinas, gaseosas y cerveza. Cuando se inicio en este negocio empezó con muy poco no tenia mucha variedad, compraba por arrobas a diferencia, ahora compra por sacos. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres del Olivo” lugar donD. obtuvo su primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 con este dinero compró diversos productos para surtir su bodega. Con el préstamo D. S/. 600.00 que lo cancelara en cuatro meses comprará 5 sacos D. azúcar, 2 cajas D. aceite y golosinas. Su mayor sueño es instalar otra tienda pero en el centro D. Otuzco

loans.use: Purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Justa

texts.es:
Mrs. Justa C. E. is 50 years old and studied up to the 6th grade. She has 3 children but only two still depend on her. She lives in the El Cortijo sector in the district of Trujillo, in the La Libertad region of Peru.

Justa is skilled in crafting all types of items through needlework. She makes sweaters for adults and children, matching wools sets (sweater, scarf and hat) and weaved tablecloths. Since she was very young she has worked making clothing, primarily sweaters.

Through a neighbor she learned about the community bank "Nuevo Perú" where she obtained her first loan of 30000 soles (Peruvian currency), with which she purchased threads of many colors with which to make sweaters. With the loan of 80000 soles, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy a larger quanity of wool, the equivalent of 60 of the spools she buys now.

Her greatest dream is to buy an industrial machine with which to make her products. The machine would allow her to improve the quality of the sweaters and produce them more quickly.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Justa C. E. tiene 50 años de edad, estudio hasta el sexto grado de primaria. Tiene tres hijos pero solo dos aun dependen de ella. Vive en el sector de El Cortijo en el distrito de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad – Perú.

La señora Justa tiene habilidad para elaborar todo tipo de tejidos, elabora chompas para adulto y niños, conjuntos de lana y tapetes. Desde que era muy joven se dedicaba a tejer algunas prendas, mayormente chompas.

Por medio de una vecina pudo integrar el Banco Comunal “Nuevo Perú” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compró hilos de todos los colores para elaborar chompas. Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00 el cual cancelara en seis meses comprara un moño de lana que equivale a 60 madejas de lana.

Su mayor sueño es comprar una maquina industrial para que elaborare sus tejidos, de esa manera mejorar la calidad de las chompas y elaborarlas con mayor rapidez.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy a large quantity of wool in order to make her products.

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Francisca M. J. is a 49 year old woman who attended school through the third grade. She has six children, but only one is one child still at home. She lives in the Otuzco province in the La Libertad department of Peru. Maria sells items in the Otuzco market. Her business offers fruit, vegetables, and wool items. For the past 15 years she has been selling in this market, and up to the present it has worked out very well for her. She began selling only wool items and thread. Little by little her business has grown, and she has offered additional items for sale. Maria joined the “Mujeres del Olivo” community bank, where she obtained her first loan of 300 soles ($100) which she used to purchase various items to sell. With this 500 sol loan, ($200) which she will repay in four months, she will purchase 15 bats of wool, 10 boxes of fruit, and a variety of vegetables. Her greatest dream is to keep working and saving to purchase her own home, as she now lives in a place which she rents.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria Francisca Monzón Jiménez tiene 49 años de edad, estudio solo hasta el tercer grado de primaria. Tiene en total seis hijos pero solo uno depende de ella. Vive en la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento La Libertad – Perú. Ella vende en condición de ambulante en el mercado de Otuzco. Su negocio es la venta de frutas, verduras y lanas. Hace 15 años que vende en este lugar y hasta la actualidad le ha ido muy bien, primero se inicio vendiendo lanas e hilos. Poco a poco ha ido incrementando su negocio, ha variado con otras mercería. Ella integra el Banco Comunal “Mujeres del Olivo” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro varios productos para surtir su puesto. Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00 el cual cancelara en cuatro meses comprara 15 moños de lana, 10 cajas de frutas y variedad de verduras . Su mayor sueño es seguir trabajando para construir su casa ya que donde vive es alquilado

loans.use: This loan will be used to purchase fruit, vegetables and wool for sale.

loans.name: Sofia Magda

texts.es:
Mrs. Sofia Magda M. A. is a 39 year old woman who attended school through the second grade. She has one child still at home. She lives in the El Cortijo section of the Trujillo district in the La Libertad department of Peru. Sofia raises birds – particularly chickens, and has set up a small farm at her home. Additionally, she prepares chicken sausage in the afternoons which she makes from the chickens that she raises. On weekends she makes cebiche (a fish dish made with citrus juice) and pasta dishes. She is well known among her neighbors for offering tasty cooking at a reasonable price. Sofia joined the “Nuevo Peru” community bank, where she obtained her first loan of 300 soles ($100) which she used to purchase chicks and feed. With this 500 sol loan, ($200) which she will repay in four months, she will purchase 30 chickens, feed, and medicine to protect her chickens from sickness. Her greatest dream is to outfit a fully equipped restaurant in her home.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Sofía Magda Martínez A. tiene 39 años de edad, estudio hasta el segundo año de secundaria. Tiene un solo hijo que aun depende de ella. Vive en el sector de El Cortijo en el distrito de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad – Perú. Se dedica a la crianza de aves en especial pollos, en su domicilio ha ambientado una pequeña granja para criar a los pollos; además por las tardes prepara salchipollo, para lo cual aprovecha los pollos que ella misma cría y los fines de semana prepara cebiche y tallarines. Los vecinos ya la conocen porque aparte de tener una buena sazón lo vende a un precio muy cómodo. Ella integra el Banco Comunal “Nuevo Perú” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro varios pollos bebes y alimento balanceado. Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00 el cual cancelara en cuatro meses comprara 30 pollos, purina y medicina para proteger a las aves de cualquier enfermedad. Su mayor sueño es ambientar un restaurante con todos los implementos, en su casa.

loans.use: With this loan 30 chickens will be purchased, along with feed and other items for the business.

loans.name: Susana Luz

texts.es:
Mrs. Susana Luz Q. R. is a 45 year old woman who attended school through the sixth grade. She has 4 children, with one still living at home. Susana lives in the El Cortijo section of the Trujillo district in the La Libertad department of Peru. She sells food outside her home every weekend, offering chicken sausage, potato sausage, tallarines (a pasta dish), lomitos (a South American sandwich), and other soup-style dishes. During the week she works at a kindergarten near her home; selling food only on Saturdays and Sundays. Susana is a member of the “Nuevo Peru” community bank where she obtained her first loan of 300 soles ($100) which she used to purchase necessary cooking ingredients. With a 1000 sol loan ($375) which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase a box of oil, a sack of rice, a sack of potatoes, and a package of noodles and vegetables. Her greatest dream is to obtain a location where she can open a large restaurant complete with all of the cooking equipment.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Susana Luz Q. R. tiene 45 años de edad, estudio hasta el sexto grado de primaria. Tiene cuatro hijos en total pero solo dos aun dependen de ella. Vive en el sector El Cortijo en el distrito de Trujillo departamento La Libertad – Perú. Vende comida todos los fines de semana fuera de su casa. Prepara salchipollo, salchipapa, tallarines, lomito y otros potajes. Entre semana trabaja en un jardín de niños cerca de su domicilio. Desde años atrás vendía menú diariamente pero debido a que consiguió el trabajo en el jardín, solo vende los sábados y domingos. La señora Susana integra el Banco Comunal “Nuevo Perú” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro todos los ingredientes necesarios para cocinar. Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00 el cual será cancelado en seis meses comprará una caja de aceite, un saco de arroz, un saco de papas, un paquete de fideos y verduras. Su mayor sueño es conseguir un local en donde instale un gran restaurante con todos sus implementos.

loans.use: The loan with be used to purchase rice, oil, etc. for the business.

loans.name: Teodocia

texts.es:
Teodocia P. D. R. is a 62 year old woman. She attended school through the second grad, and has 5 children, who all now live independently. She resides in the El Cortijo section of the Trujillo district in the department of La Libertad, Peru. Teodocia operates a small convenience store in the living room of her home, which she opened with money that she saved while working at the school near her home. She began by purchasing just a few products, and over time she has added a greater variety of items. She is a member of the “Nuevo Peru” community bank, where she obtained her initial loan of 300 Soles. With this money, she purchased a various products to sell in her store. With a loan of 800 Soles ($300), which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase of 5 cases of beer, rice, sugar and oil. Teodocia’s greatest dream is to equip and modernize her store.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Teodocia P. D. R. tiene 62 años D. edad. Estudio hasta el segundo grado D. primaria. Tiene en total cinco hijos y ninguno ya depenD. D. ella. Vive en el sector El Cortijo en el distrito D. Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad – Perú. Ella tiene una pequeña bodega en la sala D. su casa en la que venD. productos D. primera necesidad, gaseosas y cerveza. Su negocio lo inicia con el dinero que iba ahorrando cuando trabajaba en un colegio cerca D. su casa, empezó comprando pocos productos con el tiempo ha ido teniendo mayor variedad. Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuevo Perú” lugar donD. obtuvo su primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro diversos productos para surtir su bodega. Con el préstamo D. S/. 800.00 el cual pagara en seis meses lo invertirá comprando 5 cajas D. cerveza, arroz, azúcar y aceite. Su mayor sueño es implementar y modernizar su bodega.

loans.use: With this loan, she will purchase additional items for sale

loans.name: Vicky Nila

texts.es:
Vicky Nila Lázaro Chávez is 34 years old, she studied administration but for personal reasons was unable to practice her profession. She has one child who is dependent on her. She lives in the El Cortijo section of the district of Trujillo, in the department of La Libertad, Perú.

In her mother-in-law´s house she has set up a spacious general store where she has a variety of groceries, candies, gifts, supplies, CDs, soft drinks and beer. Most of her neighbors come to her store to buy because they always find what they´re looking for. Her business started off with just a few products, in a small space in her mother´s house. Later she started increasing her products and needed to find a larger space.

Vicky belongs to the "Nuevo Perú" community bank where she obtained her first loan with which she bought different products so that she could have some variety in her store. With another loan, which will be repaid in six months, she will buy school supplies since that is what is always in demand at the start of the school year and she will also buy groceries and soft drinks.

Her greatest dream is to buy a van so she can provide school transportation and in that way have another souce of income for her household. She also would like to buy a home.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Vicky Nila Lázaro Chávez tiene 34 años de edad, estudio la carrera de administración pero no ejerció su carrera por motivos personales. Tiene un solo hijo que aun depende de ella. Vive en el sector El Cortijo del distrito de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad – Perú.

En la casa de su suegra ha instalado una bodega muy amplia, en la cual tiene una variedad de abarrotes, golosinas, regalos, útiles, CDS, gaseosas y cervezas. La mayoría de sus vecinos recurren a comprar en su tienda ya que siempre encuentran lo que buscan. Su negocio lo inicio con muy pocos productos , en un pequeño espacio en la casa de su mamá. Posteriormente fue incrementando sus productos y tuvo la necesidad de conseguir un local más grande.

La señora Vicky pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuevo Perú” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro diversos productos para tener variedad en su tienda. Con el préstamo de S/. 1200.00 el cual cancelara en seis meses comprará útiles escolares ya que por campaña escolar siempre le solicitan y también comprará abarrotes y gaseosas.

Su mayor sueño es comprar una combi para hacer movilidad escolar, de esa manera tener otro ingreso en su hogar. Así también desea comprar una casa.

loans.use: Buy more goods for her general store.

loans.name: Vilama Del Rocio

texts.es:
Vilma del Rocío T. C. is 33 years old and studied as far as sixth grade of primary school. She has one child who is still dependent on her. She lives in the province of Otuzco, in the department of La Libertad, Perú.

Her business is the purchase and sale of small livestock, such as pigs, calves, chickens and guinea pigs, which after fattening them up, she slaughters and sells the meat. She also sells wheat and barley grain as well as buys curd and cheese which she resells.

Through one of her relatives, she was able to join the "Mujeres del Olivo" community bank, where she obtained her first loan which she used to buy a sack of wheat grain, a sack of barley grain and small livestock. With another loan, which will be repaid in four months, she will buy pigs, chickens and guinea pigs.

Her greatest dream is to have her own house in the city of Trujillo

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Vilma del Rocío T. C. tiene 33 años de edad, estudio hasta el sexto grado de primaria. Tiene un solo hijo que aun dependen de ella. Vive en la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento La Libertad – Perú.

El negocio al que se dedica es la compra y venta de animales menores tales como: chanchos, huachos, gallinas y cuyes los cuales después de engordarlos sacrifica para vender la carne. Así también vende grano de trigo y cebada, además compra cuajada y queso para volver a vender.

Por medio de un familiar pudo integrarse al Banco Comunal “Mujeres del Olivo” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compró un saco de grano de trigo, un saco de grano de cebada y animales menores. Con el préstamo de S/. 600.00 el cual cancelara en cuatro meses comprara 4 chanchos, gallinas y cuyes.

Su mayor sueño es tener una casa propia en la ciudad de Trujillo

loans.use: Purchase pigs, chickens and guinea pigs for resale.

loans.name: Cira Asteria

texts.es:
Ciria Asteria Gómez R. is 53 years old; she studied as far as second grade in primary school. She has six children but only three are still her dependents. She lives in the province of Otuzco, in the department of La Libertad, Perú.

Every Saturday and Sunday she works as a traveling vendor at the Otuzco market, selling vegetables such as: carrots, green onions, coriander and others, as well as medicinal plants and flowers. During the week she works on her farm, where she raises small amounts of grains and potatoes; part of this she consumes and the rest she sells.

She is a member of the "Sagrado Corazón de Jesús" community bank, where she obtained her first loan with which she bought all types of vegetables. With another loan, which will be repaid in four months, she will buy carrots, onions, coriander and flowers.

Her greatest dream is to buy land where she can build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Cira Asteria Gómez R. tiene 53 años de edad, estudio hasta el segundo grado de primaria. Tiene seis hijos en total pero solo tres aun dependen de ella. Vive en la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento La Libertad – Perú.

Ella vende los días sábados y domingos en condición de ambulante en el mercado de Otuzco, vende verduras como: zanahoria, cebolla china, culantro y otros; así también plantas medicinales y flores. Entre semana se dedica a la chacra en la cual cosecha un poco de granos de cereales y papa parte de estos productos los consume y la otra parte los vende.

Es socia del Banco Comunal “Sagrado Corazón de Jesús” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro verduras de todo tipo. Con el préstamo de S/. 400.00 el cual lo pagara en un periodo de cuatro meses comprará 4 arrobas de zanahoria, dos cientos de cebolla, un paquete de culantro y también flores.

Su mayor sueño es comprar un terreno para construir su casa.

loans.use: Purchase carrots, onions, etc. to sell

loans.name: Digna Emerita

texts.es:
Digna Emerita Gómez Martínez is 37 years old and studied as far as third grade of primary school. She has three children, but only two still are her dependents. She lives in the province of Otuzco, in the department of La Libertad, Perú.

She sells medicinal herbs such as: camomile, HBK herb, plantain, etc. in addition to selling honey, garlic and hot peppers. She has a small place outside the Otuzco market where she sells her products. She started off with just a small amount of goods, but little by little she increased her business.

She is a member of the "Sagrado Corazón de Jesús" community bank, where she obtained her first loan; with this money she bought a variety of medicinal herbs. With another loan, which will be repaid in four months, she will buy honey, hot peppers, garlic, lemon verbena and HBK herbs and a few kilos of curd.

Her greatest dream is to acquire a fixed space inside the market where she can offer her products.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Digna Emerita Gómez Martínez tiene 37 años de edad, estudio hasta el tercer grado de primaria. Tiene tres hijos en total pero dos aun dependen de ella. Vive en la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento La Libertad – Perú.

Se dedica a la venta de hierbas medicinales tales como: manzanilla, panizara, yanten, etc. además vende miel de abeja, ajos y rocoto. Tiene un pequeño lugar en las afueras del mercado de Otuzco en el que vende y ofrece sus productos. Empezó con un poco de mercadería poco a poco fue incrementando su negocio.

Es integrante del Banco Comunal “Sagrado Corazón de Jesús” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro una variedad de yerbas medicinales. Con el préstamo de S/. 400.00 el cual pagara en cuatro meses comprara una caja de miel, un ciento de rocoto, 8 arrobas de ajos, 1 paquete de hierba luisa y panizara, y algunos kilos de quesillo.

Su mayor sueño es conseguir un puesto en el mercado en donde ofrezca todos sus productos.

loans.use: Purchase goods for her business.

loans.name: Eufemia Magna

texts.es:
Eufemia Magna C. V. is 49 years old; she studied up to second grade of primary school. She has two children but only one still depends on her. She lives in the province of Otuzco, in the department of La Libertad, Perú.

Her business is the purchase and sale of curd, vegetables and raising barley, wheat, corn and potatoes. The people who know her always look for her to ask for these products. She offers vegetables as a ambulatory seller at the Otuzco market. She started her business with a small amount of curd and a small amount of grains that she harvested. As time went on and with loans she acquired through the "Sagrado Corazón de Jesús" community bank, she has been able to make some profit and expand her business.

She used all of her first loan to buy curd. With another loan, which she will repay in four months, she will buy 200 units of curd, a variety of vegetables and fertilizer for her planting.

Her greatest hope is to have a stand at the wholesale market in the city of Trujillo because on the coast, business is better.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Eufemia Magna C. V. tiene 49 años de edad, estudio hasta el segundo grado de primaria. Tiene dos hijos en total pero uno aun depende de ella. Vive en la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento La Libertad – Perú.

Su negocio es la compra y venta de quesillo, verduras y siembra de granos de cebada, grano de trigo, chochos y papa. La gente que ya la conoce siempre la buscan para pedirle algunos de estos productos. La verdura la ofrece y vende en condición de ambulante en el mercado de Otuzco. Su negocio se inicio vendiendo con un poco de quesillo y con poco cereal que cosechaba; con el pasar del tiempo y con los préstamos que adquirió en el Banco Comunal “Sagrado Corazón de Jesús” ha podido hacer un capital propio y ha incrementado su negocio.

Su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 lo invirtió todo comprando quesillo. Con el préstamo de S/. 2000.00 el cual cancelara en cuatro meses comprara 200 unidades de quesillo, una variedad de verduras y abono para sus siembras.

Su mayor sueño es tener un puesto pero en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Trujillo ya que por la costa hay mayor negocio.

loans.use: Buy curd and various other products.

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es:
Hortencia sells various brands of cosmetics. She is divorced, has 4 grown children, and does not receive a pension so she had to begin a business in order to meet her expenses and maintain her house. She began her business 2 years ago with some neighbors and to date has a good number of customers.

She needs a loan of US$475, which will be repaid in 6 months, to purchase a display case to show and store her products. With your help Hortencia will be able to continue to earn a living.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.
