“Tengo la necesidad de hacer un cuarto en la parte de atrás de mi vivienda. Voy a tener que construirlo en el patio, ya que si lo hago arriba de mi vivienda tendría que invertir mucho dinero. Mi casa es muy pequeña y estamos muy incómodos porque hay poco espacio para los muebles. Solicito 800 dólares para construir un cuarto atrás de mi vivenda”.

loans.use: Building an additional room in the back of the house.

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
“Last year I was granted the house where I presently live with my family. I would like to start the construction of an additional room, as the space is very limited. I intend to make additions to the house, but it will have to be little by little, as I don’t have the required capital. I am requesting $ 1000 to build the additional room”.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

“El año pasado me entregaron mi casa, donde vivo con mi familia, y me gustaría empezar con la construcción de un cuarto adicional, ya que los espacios son muy pequeños. Tengo pensado ampliarla más, pero tendrá que ser poco a poco ya que no tengo el capital completo. Solicito 1000 dólares para la construcción de un cuarto en mi vivienda.”

loans.use: Building of an additional room in the house.

loans.name: Raúl Rodolfo

texts.es:
“I need to build a fence in the backyard of my house, as I feel my home is not safe and I want to offer protection to my family. I work the night shift at an in-bond factory and I’m not at ease knowing my family is unprotected. I am requesting $200 to build the fence.”

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo la necesidad de levantar una barda en la parte de atrás de mi vivienda, ya que la siento muy insegura y quiero darle protección a mi familia. Trabajo de noche en una maquiladora y no estoy tranquilo sabiendo a mi familia sin protección. Solicito 200 dólares para levantar una barda en mi vivienda”.

loans.use: Building of a fence/

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
"I have an unfinished room in my home, which I need to finish urgently to be able to use it. In order to plaster and paint the walls, I am requesting US$ 500".

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

"Tengo la construcción de un cuarto sin terminar en mi vivienda, me urge terminarlo para poder habitarlo, ya que solo me falta enjarrar y pintar. Es por eso que solicito su apoyo con US$ 500, para terminar la construcción en mi vivienda”.

loans.use: Finish construction of a room in her home.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
The group "Mujeres Luchadoras CD." (Hardworking Women CD.) is 1 year old and has good savings accumulated due to the hard work and dedication from the women members, who are the group's strongest foundation.

The women who make up this group are engaged in various productive activities. They will use the loan as working capital to buy more goods, in some cases, or will use it as capital for product development.

The businesses featured incluD.: sale of cosmetics (creams, makeup, colognes), selling clothes, selling fast food, selling chipas (typical meal Paraguayan maD. based on starch, cheese, flour and eggs), sale of purses maD. from polythene bags, etc.

These women yearn for a better future for their children - this is why they strive twice as hard to generate sufficient income to enable them to pay for their children's education. They want the country to move forward and to decrease the number of people who must migrate to other countries in search of job opportunities.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

El comité “Mujeres Luchadoras D. CD.” tiene 1 año formación posee un buen ahorro acumulado gracias al trabajo y dedicación D. estas mujeres, que son las bases mas fuertes D. este comité emprendedor.

Las señoras que componen este grupo se dedican a diversas actividades productivas, ellas utilizan el préstamo como capital operativo comprando mas mercaderías en algunos casos o insumos para la elaboración D. productos en el caso D. las señoras que se dedican a la venta D. comestibles.

Entre las actividades que realizan podemos citar: venta D. cosméticos (cremas, maquillajes, colonias), venta D. ropas, venta D. comidas rápidas, venta D. chipas (comida típica paraguaya hecha a base D. almidón, queso, harina y huevo), despensa, venta D. bolsas D. polietileno, entre otros.

Estas mujeres anhelan un futuro mejor para sus hijos, por eso se esfuerzan el doble para generar suficiente ingresos que les permita pagar los estudios D. sus hijos. Desean que el país salga adelante y que disminuya el número D. personas que debe emigrar a otros países en busca D. oportunidades laborales.

loans.use: Loan will be used to purchase fabric, thread, buttons, shirts, T-shirts, shoes, bags made of polyethylene, vegetables, fruits, meat, canned goods, sugar, flour, oil, etc  (Compra de telas, hilos, botones, camisas, remeras, calzados, bolsas de polietilenos, verduras, frutas, carne, productos enlatados, azúcar, harina, aceite, etc.)

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras De Remansito Group

texts.es:
This group is named "Mujeres Trabajadoras de Remansito" (Remansito Working Women). When one of its members heard of the program Committee of Women Entrepreneurs from a participating neighbor, and realized its benefits of and the progress attained, she decided to contact her neighbors to get their own committee together. The information sessions were a success and the group was formed. Its members, hard working and active women, are devoted to different activities, such as sales of natural medicines, bijouterie, cosmetics, ice cream, fast food, spices, meat and entrails, as well as clothes confection.

The group has 16 members and is located in the Remansito neighborhood of Ciudad del Este, a city in the border with Brazil characterized by great commercial activity.

These women, apart from being housewives and micro entrepreneurs, also organize diverse activities to raise funds in order to improve their neighborhood. They are a united group that pays the loans timely. They know that responsibility in making payments is crucial, as is communication between them and solidarity. The requested loan will be used in the purchase of merchandise to sell in their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Este grupo lleva por nombre Mujeres Trabajadoras de Remansito. Se inició gracias a que una de las integrantes tuvo conocimiento del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, a través de una vecina que ya formaba parte de un comité. Al ver el progreso logrado y los beneficios del mismo, esta señora decidió contactar a sus vecinas para formar su propio comité. Las reuniones informativas fueron un éxito y se logró formar el grupo que está compuesto por señoras muy trabajadoras y activas. Las integrantes se dedican a distintas actividades como venta de medicinas naturales, bijouterie, cosméticos, helados, comidas rápidas, carne y menudencias, especias o condimentos y confección de ropas.

El grupo está conformado por 16 integrantes y se encuentra localizado en el Barrio Remansito de Ciudad del Este, una ciudad en la frontera con Brasil, caracterizada por el gran movimiento comercial.

Estas mujeres, además de ser amas de casa y microempresarias, también realizan actividades con el fin de recaudar fondos para mejoras en su barrio. Es un grupo unido y muy puntual en sus créditos, ya que ellas saben que es primordial la responsabilidad en los pagos, la comunicación entre ellas y la solidaridad principalmente. El crédito retirado será utilizado para la compra de mercaderías para la venta en sus negocios.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing items (shirts, pants, skirts, etc.), ice cream, sugar, meat, spices, natural medicines, bijouterie and other merchandise.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica’s first experience with business was the sale of beauty products as a consultant for a recognized brand. Little by little, she realized that she enjoyed and was good at selling products. When she separated from her husband, she decided to open her own business so she could increase the income that she was accustomed to. Today, she sells juices in a small soda fountain attended from morning to night. Temporarily, she continues selling beauty products as she receives orders from some customers. She uses the earnings that she obtains from her work to educate and feed her children who are 12 and 5 years old. With the necessary capital, Jessica would like to open a stamping workshop for different types of clothing and locate it in a commercial center.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

El primer acercamiento de Jessica con los negocios fue la venta de productos de belleza como consultora de una reconocida marca. Poco a poco, se iba dando cuenta que le gustaba y era buena vendiendo productos. Cuando se separo de su esposo ella decidió abrir un negocio propio para poder contar con un ingreso económico mas grande lo habitual. Hoy en día ella se dedica a vender jugos en una pequeña fuente de soda atendiendo desde la mañana hasta la noche. Temporalmente ella continúa vendiendo los productos de belleza según le lleguen pedidos de algunas clientas. Las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo las destina básicamente para la educación y alimento de sus hijos de doce y cinco años. De tener el capital necesario a Jessica le gustaría abrir un taller de estampado para diferentes tipos de ropa y ubicarlo en un centro comercial.

loans.use: Establish her soda fountain.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Always seeking progress, since she was young Zoila has dedicated herself to selling. Before working in her shop, she sold cheese and beef to different customers. At the same time, she also worked as a cosmetics consultant. Neverthless, she thought it wasn’t profitable to dedicate her life to these jobs. As a result, with the help of her husband, she opened a shop. Currently, she continues her two previous jobs; however, she dedicates more of her time to increasing her sales in her one and a half year old shop. She is focused on working hard so that in the future she may have a better space for her store and can increase her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Buscando siempre el progreso, Zoila desde muy joven se ha dedicado a vender. Antes de trabajar en su bodega, ella repartía quesos y carne de res a distintos clientes. Paralelo a eso también trabajaba como consultora de cosméticos. Sin embargo ella pensó que no era muy rentable dedicarse de por vida trabajando solo en ello. Es así que con la ayuda de su esposo se animo a abrir una bodega. Actualmente, ella continua con sus dos oficios anteriores pero el tiempo lo dedica más a aumentar sus ventas en su tienda de tan solo año y medio. Ella piensa seguir trabajando duro para en un futuro tener su tienda en un local propio e implementarla con más productos.

loans.use: Increase her inventory.

loans.name: Erica

texts.es:
In spite of her young age, 31 years old Erica has become a successful micro entrepreneur. For 15 years she has been manufacturing, selling and even exporting bijouterie. She learned the craft as a teenager, helping her uncle elaborate jewelry.

From the beginning she was receiving orders from different clients. When she first got an order from a US client, she decided to start exporting every time she had the chance. She has supplied big jewelry stores and renowned department stores.

She splits her profits between reinvestment in her business and maintenance of her home, as she is the single mother of two small children. She would like to receive training, in order to make her business grow and continue exporting.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

A pesar de ser muy joven, Erica, a sus 31 años, se ha convertido en una exitosa microempresaria. Hace quince años que produce, vende e incluso exporta bijouteria. Para ella todo empezó cuando aún era una adolescente. Ayudando a su tío a confeccionar joyas fue aprendiendo el oficio.

Desde un inicio ella producía para diversos clientes quienes le hacían pedidos. Lo mejor fue cuando recibió un pedido de un cliente norteamericano. A raíz de eso, ella decidió empezar a exportar cada vez que tenía una oportunidad. Ella ha llegado a ser proveedora de tiendas grandes de joyas y de tiendas por departamentos conocidas.

Ella reparte sus ganancias en la reinversión y en el mantenimiento de su hogar, pues debe ser madre y padre de dos hijos menores. Lo que ella quisiera es recibir capacitación para crecer en su empresa y poder seguir exportando.

loans.use: Receive training for her business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is a hard-working woman and a good mother. She has not always been dedicated to her business. She always considered herself a homemaker until four years ago when she needed to make her own income because she separated from her husband. As a result, although her husband continues to help her with housing expenses, when her youngest daughter finished high school and she decided to prepare herself to start university, Rosa decided to give her that opportunity. For this, she opened a small shop where she currently sells breakfasts and sometimes, if there’s demand, also lunches. Little by little, she has been growing her business despite the difficulties with the national economic situation. She dreams about a future when she can have a soda fountain.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa es una mujer muy trabajadora y buena madre. No siempre se ha dedicado a ocupar de su negocio. Ella se ha considerado siempre una ama de casa hasta hace cuatro años que tuvo la necesidad de contar con un ingreso económico propio. Ella esta separada con su esposo. Por eso, aunque él aún continúe ayudándola con el mantenimiento del hogar, cuando su menor hija termino el colegio y decidió prepararse para ingresar a una universidad, Rosa decidió darle aquella oportunidad. Fue así que abrió un pequeño local donde actualmente vende desayunos y a veces, según la demanda, también almuerzos. Poco a poco va creciendo en su negocio a pesar de las dificultades que atraviesa la situación económica nacional. Ella sueña en un futuro con tener una fuente de soda.

loans.use: Convert her shop into a soda fountain.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a budding entrepreneur and the proud mother of two school-going children. To make a living and provide food and education for her children, Miriam sells a collection of chic pants, shirts, blouses, and shoes. Recently, the entrepreneur took a loan from FSMA which she used to add new styles of shoes and slippers to her stock. The investment was successful and Miriam managed to attract new people to her business and increase her income.

With this second loan, the entrepreneur will buy new fashionable pants and shirts to add to her inventory. Miriam wants to keep working hard in order to provide a comfortable lifestyle for her family.

loans.use: Purchase of women's clothing to supply her business

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en:
Bertha runs a mini-market in the Yacot community of Santo Domingo. Each day she receives visits from hundreds of customers who want to purchase different kinds of products, ranging from fresh chicken meat, rice, beans, and vegetable oil to bread, peanut butter and the like. Her store also offers alcoholic and energizing drinks.

Bertha plans on using her loan to purchase more products so that she can significantly increase the sales volume and her revenue. That way, the entrepreneur will be able to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: Purchase of a lot of goods for her little grocery store

loans.name: Francia

texts.en:
Francia is twenty-six years old and mother of four daughters who range in age from five to eleven, three of whom attend school. Her husband works as a security agent for a company.

Francia has been operating a small cafeteria for almost three years. She started her business with a loan she took from FSMA. Currently, her business is growing and she hopes that this growth can be constant. The entrepreneur also explains that she would like to have enough money to keep providing good education for her children and to buy a house in the future.

With her loan, Francia will buy products she needs to prepare her delicious typical Dominican food and satisfy her customers' demands.

loans.use: To acquire products and materials to prepare food for a small cafeteria

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is a hard-working and untiring entrepreneur who strives to provide food and education for nine children. She sells women’s clothing in the Yacot community of Santo Domingo. The entrepreneur explains that her children’s education is very important for her future, and that she’d do anything to support them so that they can lift themselves up out of poverty.

Carmen is requesting a loan (actually the second one she’ll take from FSMA) to purchase clothing in bulk to continue her business activity and increase her income. The entrepreneur will do her best to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy clothing in bulk to retail in her community

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.en:
Guillermina is forty years old and the mother of two boys and one daughter. Her husband works for a construction company. To supplement the family’s income, Guillermina sells used and new pants, shoes, shirts, blouses, and the like.

Guillermina would like to have money enough to support their children’s university studies, and also to buy a house some day. With her loan, the entrepreneur will buy more clothing to supply her business and increase her revenue.

loans.use: To buy clothing in bulk to retail

loans.name: Sana Gul

texts.en: Sana Gul lives with his own family in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and is the father of four children. He works in agriculture. Gul started his business one year ago. During this time he has worked hard to cultivate his land. Now he has requested an individual loan to complete his stock of agricultural necessities and to buy more seeds so that he can take good benefit from his land  and so that he can help his family.  He is happy about the process of loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To complete his stock and buy more seeds

loans.name: Hafizallah

texts.en: Hafizallah lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and is the father of two children who are both in school. He is the only breadwinner for his family. He works in agriculture. He has lots of land to cultivate but he is unable to take the best advantage of it, so he wants to take an individual loan to complete his stock of agricultural necessities and be in a position to make good income. In this way, he believes that he can better help his family. He is happy with all members of his family.

loans.use: To complete his stock of agricultural necessities

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Duong Thi T., 46 years old, is one among 20 first members of TYM Fund. In 1992, TYM Fund of the Vietnamese Women Union came to Minh Phu town to put their microeconomic programs to help Vietnamese women into trials. With 20USD borrowed money, Mrs. T. invested in breeding pigs. Even though she did not earn a lot of profit at first, she realized the convenience in being able to repay weekly and she also appreciated the knowledge she learned from their meetings. She continued to be a member of the Fund and borrowed more more money. Her family situation got better over time and she was able to send her children to school. Her oldest child is now the Director of a software company. Because of the current trend, together with the help of her oldest child, she invested in opening an Internet café. Mrs. T. had lots of customers, especially young people. Her current income is 220-250 USD/ month. In the future, she wants to expand her Internet café to serve more customers. This time she intends to borrow 1200 USD to buy more computers

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Dương Thị T., 46 tuổi, là 1 trong số 20 thành viên đã đi vào lịch sử của Quỹ Tình thương. Năm 1992, Quỹ Tình thương của Hội liên hiệp phụ nữ Việt Nam đã về với xã Minh Phú nơi chị sống để thử nghiệm mô hình cho phụ nữ nghèo vay vốn phát triển kinh tế. Với 20USD vay được từ Quỹ, chị T. đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Sau vòng vốn đầu tiên, số lãi T. được tuy không nhiều nhưng chị T. nhận thấy được sự T.ận lợi trong việc hoàn trả tuần cũng như những kiến thức chị học được trong những buổi sinh hoạt cụm. Các vòng vốn tiếp theo chị tiếp tục tham gia và xin vay những mức vốn cao hơn. Đời sống gia đình dần được nâng lên, chị có điều kiện nuôi con ăn học tử tế. Đến nay 2 con chị đều đỗ đại học và có công ăn việc làm ổn định. Cháu lớn hiện là Giám đốc công ty xúc tiến thương mại chuyên về lĩnh vực phần mềm. Trước nhu cầu tìm hiểu thông tin của thị trường và sự T.ận lợi khi có con làm trong lĩnh vực này chị T. đầu tư vốn mở cửa hàng internet. Khách hàng đến với cửa hàng của chị rất đông, đặc biệt là giới trẻ. T. nhập hàng tháng của chị T. khoảng từ 220-250USD. Trong tương lai chị muốn cửa hàng của mình ngày càng mở rộng để phục vụ nhân dân được tốt hơn. Vòng vốn này chị đề nghị xin vay 1200USD để mua thêm máy tính.

loans.use: Buy computers

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ngo Thi N., 46 years old, is living with her husband and 2 children in Minh Phu, Soc Son. When the TYM Fund came to her village in 1992, she participated in the program and borrowed 30 USD to invest in breeding pigs. In the first year, her family situation experienced positive changes. Since then, she borrowed more money to expand her breeding plan. Her income from breeding pigs increased over years and as a result, she was able to send her children to school. Currently, her family income is 330 USD/month. Because of her successful business, in 2004, Mrs. N. was able to have her own well-furnished house built. During recent years, she always borrow the maximum allowed money. Her plan is to borrow 1200 USD to buy more pigs, ducks, fishes and food for them.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Ngô Thị Ngợi, 46 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 2 con tại Minh Phú, Sóc Sơn. Năm 1992 khi có Quỹ Tình Thương về thôn chị xin tham gia và được vay 30USD để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Trong năm đầu tiên kinh tế gia đình đã có những sự thay đổi, các vòng vốn tiếp theo được vay mức cao hơn chị Ngợi đã đầu tư mở rộng dự án. Thu nhập từ chăn nuôi tăng dần lên qua các năm đã giúp chị Ngợi có điều kiện cho con cái học hành đến nơi đến chốn. Hiện nay mỗi tháng gia đình chị thu 330USD. Nhờ làm ăn hiệu quả đến năm 2004 chị Ngợi đã xây được nhà mái bằng khang trang có đầy đủ tiện nghi sinh hoạt. Trong những năm gần đây chị luôn vay mức vốn tối đa. Dự định của chị là sẽ xin vay 1200USD để mua thêm lợn, vịt, cá và thức ăn gia súc.

loans.use: Buy pigs, ducks, fishes and food for them

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ngô Thị Tiếp, 40 years old, joins the TYM Fund in 1993. She is married with 5 children. Four of children are still in school. Funds from the loans are used to invest in her livestock also help to her children’s education expenses. The family’s economy improves. Since 2003, she’s been expanding her livestock business. Now she has 800 ducks for eggs, 100 pigs and a fish pond. The average monthly income is $300. After 14 years with the TYM Fund, her family has a 3 storey house with all modern appliances. She is applying for a loan of $1200 to invest in her livestock.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Ngô Thị Tiếp, 40 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 1993. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 5 người con, trong đó 4 cháu đang trong độ tuổi đến trường. Đồng vốn vay từ Quỹ được chị Tiếp sử dụng vào kinh doanh buôn trâu, bò, và dành một phần đầu tư cho con đi học. Nguồn thu nhập từ dự án kinh doanh đã tạo cơ hội cho kinh tế gia đình ngày càng phát triển. Sang năm 2003 chị Tiếp chuyển sang mô hình làm kinh tế trang trại. Hiện nay gia đình chị có 800 con vịt đẻ, 100 con lợn, 2 sào ao thả cá. Thu nhập bình quân đạt 300USD/tháng. Thành quả sau 14 năm tham gia Quỹ của chị Tiếp là ngôi nhà 3 tầng với đầy đủ tiện nghi. Dự định của chị Tiếp là vay thêm 1200USD để mua thức ăn cho đàn gia súc, gia cầm của mình.

loans.use: Invest in livestock

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị L. is 50 years old and her husband is 52. They have 2 children who are grown up. Her main occupation is selling grocery and raising pigs. With her first loan of 30 USD from TYM in 1995, she started her pig raising business which had yielded good results. In 2000, she opened a grocery store and it really picked up. After more than 10 years with TYM, she was able to build a house for her family. Selling grocery and raising pigs are suitable to enabling weekly payment. Her husband is an electrician, he helps her out whenever she needs help. This time Mrs L. is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to buy feed for her herd of 14 pigs. Her family monthly income is 300 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị L. năm nay 50 tuổi còn chồng chị 52. Anh chị có hai con đã trưởng thành. Công việc hàng ngày của chị là chăn nuôi lợn và bán hàng tạp hóa. Với số vốn 30USD vay từ Quỹ năm 1995 chị đầu tư cho chăn nuôi mang lại hiệu quả kinh tế cao. Sang năm 2000 chị mở thêm cửa hàng tạp hóa nên kinh tế ngày càng phát triển. Sau hơn 10 năm tham gia Quỹ chị L. đã xây được một ngôi nhà khang trang với đầy đủ công trình phụ. Việc bán hàng kết hợp với chăn nuôi lợn rất phù hợp với mô hình hoàn trả tuần. Bên cạnh đó anh Đức chồng chị, một thợ điện, luôn hỗ vợ mỗi khi có khó khăn. Dự án tiến triển thuận lợi, vòng này chị L. xin vay 1200USD để mua thức ăn cho đàn lợn 14 con, đồng thời mua hàng bán. Mức thu nhập hiện nay của gia đình chị L. là 300USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy goods for grocery store and buy food for pigs

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
The family of Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Luyến, 40 years old, has a store front right on the Highway 13. It is the main artery of Hà Nội - Cao Bằng. The area has high concentration of population, many industrials and businesses. With a good location but lack of funds, she joins the TYM Fund which has a convenient weekly payment plan that fits her needs. The family’s economy improves. She acquires more lot to expand her store and hires 2 clerks that she pays $50 a month each. The net income is 8-10USD a day. She is applying for a loan of $1200 to replenish her store.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Gia đình chị Nguyễn Thị Luyến, 40 tuổi, có cửa hàng ngay mặt đường quốc lộ 3, trục giao thông huyết mạch Hà Nội - Cao Bằng, nơi tập trung đông dân cư và các cơ quan xí nghiệp nên rất phù hợp cho việc kinh doanh. Với điều kiện thuận lợi như vậy nên vốn nên năm 1994 chị đã quyết định tham gia vào Quỹ để được vay vốn. Điều chị cảm thấy thích nhất là vốn vay của Quỹ hoàn trả theo tuần. Đúng như chị nghĩ số vốn vay từ Quỹ qua nhiều năm đầu tư đã giúp kinh tế gia đình ngày càng phát triển. Chị Luyến đã tích lũy đủ tiền để mua thêm đất mở rộng cửa hàng. Hai con đang trong độ tuổi đến trường cũng được chị cho học hành đến nơi đến chốn. Hiện nay trung bình mỗi ngày cửa hàng chị lãi từ 8-10USD. Công việc bận rộn, chị Luyến thuê thêm 2 nhân công giúp việc và trả lương 50USD/tháng. Sắp tới chị tiếp tục xin vay 1200USD để mua thêm thực phẩm và đồ uống phục vụ khách hàng.

loans.use: Buy food and drink

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 23, 2008)
